Things turn around when he's visited by the neurotic accountant Leo Bloom, who proposes a scheme tailor-made for producers who can only make flops: raise far more money than you need, then make sure the show is despised. No one will be interested in it, so you can pocket the surplus. To this end, they produce a musical called Springtime for Hitler written by escaped Nazi Franz Liebken... (imdb)
film.quote: Matthew Broderick is meh in general for me, I can't really remember liking anything he's ever been in ever (Ferris Bueller and Lion King are the exceptions, but neither of those am I a fan of because of him). The ensemble cast hold it together very well, Nathan Lane of course stealing the spotlight as the flamboyant director. And y'know, I never thought I'd say this - but I didn't dislike Will Ferrell in this movie! It's a rare treat to not cringe in embarrassment at seeing him on film. See it!

film.summary: Barry Egan is a small business owner with seven sisters who kept him alone and unable to fall in love. When a harmonium and a mysterious woman enter his life, his romantic journey begins.
film.quote: If Adam Sandler only did movies like this, he might be able to renew my faith.

film.summary: If on one night every year, you could commit any crime without facing consequences, what would you do? Over the course of a single night, a family will be tested to see how far they will go to protect themselves when the vicious outside world breaks into their home.
film.quote: I know that we're stepping out of reality here, so it's probably forgivable, but the acting is just a little off-putting aside from Rhys Wakefield. And I wish the first "shit goes down" moment had more of an impact; you see it coming as soon as it's teased and it has virtually no force behind it, and bad logic continues from there, especially from Zoey. But when Polite Leader & the gang show up, things take a pretty solid upswing. It's got a nice feel throughout and ends very well. Worth seeing!

film.summary: A couple are driving home to their kids when their car runs out of gas just as the Purge commences. Meanwhile, Leo goes out into the streets to get revenge on the man who killed his son, and a mother and daughter run from their home after assailants destroy it. The five people meet up as they attempt to survive the night in Los Angeles. (imdb)
film.quote: I like that the franchise takes concepts like propaganda, manipulation & economics, and uniquely smashes them together. I like that it's more open-world, but I don't like that there isn't a stand-out "Polite Leader". That character is split between Big Daddy, "God", and... Capitalism. Don't get me wrong, I LIKE money as an enemy but, I guess I prefer a more singular villain. I do appreciate that the antagonists weren't just "entitled educated college kids" this time. Sets up nicely for a third.

film.summary: Two years after choosing not to kill the man who killed his son, former police sergeant Barnes has become head of security for Senator Charlene Roan, the front runner in the next Presidential election due to her vow to eliminate the Purge. (imdb)
film.quote: About as good as the second if not a little better. I think you have to gobble these movies up like cotton candy to really enjoy them: forget that it's not real food and just enjoy the sugary goodness. And that's not a sleight against the franchise in the least. For the third time, the premise (and the swing on the formula) is interesting. Though I do think that they toned down the violence in this one. Maybe it was more about the message this go-round. This, like the others, is worth seeing.

film.summary: Seeking revenge for the death of his love, secret agent James Bond sets out to stop an environmentalist from taking control of a country's valuable resource.
film.quote: In most every way, a downgrade from Casino Royale - there seems to be a plateau in Bond's development and charm, it lacks one outstanding "Bond Girl" to target (indeed the role was split between Fields and Camille, which didn't entirely work for me), the antagonist(s) just didn't have the same pop as Le Chiffre, and while the "action" so to speak is mostly an upgrade, it might have been too much for a spy vs. an action hero. Needed to be longer and more subtle to achieve maximum "Bond-ness".

film.summary: Davis Okoye and his bestfriend white gorilla fight monsters in a big city. (imdb)
film.quote: I have a weird relationship with this. I almost wanted it to suck when I first heard about it. This movie had, to quote... somebody, "one fucking job", and that job was to be fun. Nothing more. It didn't have to reach any unanticipated heights, nor did it particularly have to wrestle against high expectations. It just had to be fun. "Rampage" is fun. It's dumb, and that's fine. It's not particularly well-written, and that's fine too. Rock does his Rock thing, there's some emotion. Worth seeing.

film.summary: A fictionalized account of the last days of Edgar Allan Poe's life, in which the poet pursues a serial killer whose murders mirror those in the writer's stories. (imdb)
film.quote: Hm. Interested by the dislike for this movie. I thought Cusack's portrayal of Poe was exquisite and the reveal of the killer was done with care. I do believe that the method in which the killer "gets away" is rather... well, silly. He just... walks away. So yeah, Moriarty he ain't, but Moriarty he didn't have to be. Very very good performances I thought, though, from Cusack as Poe to Evans as Fields. It doesn't jerk you around with constant tiring twists that plague this genre. Worth seeing.

film.summary: Two dimwit sewage workers watch their hero, WCW wrestler Jimmy King, get screwed out of the World title by wrestler Diamond Dallas Page and evil WCW owner Titus Sinclair. They embark on a quest to help their hero win his title - and honor - back. Features cameos by lots of WCW wrestlers. (imdb)
film.quote: This works for me just because I love wrestling and it was a pretty decent comedy. David Arquette is hilarious.

film.summary: American security guard Richard Jewell (Paul Walter Hauser) saves thousands of lives from an exploding bomb at the 1996 Olympics, but is vilified by journalists and the press who falsely report that he was a terrorist. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a good movie in a lot of ways: the pacing, screenplay, and many of the performances. But in a way that sticks out like a sore thumb, it is very clearly an Eastwood film: the antithesis to whatever person/thing Eastwood is defending (in this case, Jewell, his antithesis being the media and the government) is presented as a pack of incredulous, almost bumbling fools. Yes, Jewell is the good guy, but his bad guy lacks menace and credibility due to its own Eastwoodian incompetence.

film.summary: Rachel Keller is a journalist investigating a videotape that may have killed four teenagers (including her niece). There is an urban legend about this tape: the viewer will die seven days after watching it. If the legend is correct, Rachel will have to run against time to save her son's and her own life. (imdb)
film.quote: Not bad for a horror flick.

film.summary: Josh and Tiffany have been together since they were kids. ENTER Beth, a sexy blonde going to college with Josh. One night, Josh and Beth hook up and make a videotape the same day that Josh plans to mail a video to Tiffany of him talking about college life. The wrong tape gets sent, forcing Josh, along with a few pals, to go to Austin, where Tiffany is, and stop her from seeing the tape. Full of laughs, you'll be sure to enjoy Road Trip. (imdb)
film.quote: Actually a quite serviceable comedy, immature but sometimes that's okay. The cast of this film are really genuine and smart... yes, even Green.

film.summary: Scotty Smalls moves to a new neighborhood with his mom and stepdad, and wants to learn to play baseball... (imdb)
film.quote: It's a cute film, a bunch of kids just wanna play some baseball, yo.

film.summary: While "Scary Movie" targeted the onslaught of teen horror film flicks, the sequel takes aim at the root of the great classic horror movies. (Dimension Films)
film.quote: At this point, was still relatively-clever satire and worth the watch. Plus... Tim Curry!

film.summary: A follow-up to the 2015 film, 'Sicario', which centers around the escalating war against drugs along the border of the United States and Mexico. (imdb)
film.quote: Sicario 2 is missing several ingredients that made the first meal so appetizing. Emily Blunt (to take nothing away from Brolin and del Toro who are both great and believable), and the direction and artistic approach of Denis Villeneuve (Sollima did fine, but just fine), stand out the most as being missing. I don't think this had near the script of the first, nor made any attempt to make Mexico its own character, as the first did. I do think this aptly sets up a third, which I would be down for.

film.summary: A SIMPLE FAVOR, directed by Paul Feig, centers around Stephanie (Anna Kendrick), a mommy blogger who seeks to uncover the truth behind her best friend Emily's (Blake Lively) sudden disappearance from their small town. (imdb)
film.quote: Despite the spelling of favour, this was a ton of fun. Blake Lively is coming full circle with me; from actively disliking her work in "Savages", to mediocre enjoyment in "The Shallows", to this: what I think is a pretty solid performance that she clearly got to have fun with. I'm such an Anna Kendrick mark, I'd watch her do anything, and she's enjoyable on the level of, a lot of this performance didn't feel like acting. She's just that awkward. Paul Feig delivers a more-fun "Gone Girl". See it!

film.summary: It takes a wide screen to fully capture Homer Simpson's stupidity, and The Simpsons Movie does it. In the eagerly-awaited animated feature film based on the hit TV series, Homer must save the world from a catastrophe he himself created. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Pretty decent episode, I mean, all it is is an episode stretched-out and without commercials. I think it lives up to the series at some of its best points, though.

film.filmname: Sin City: A Dame to Kill For (2014)
film.summary: The town's most hard-boiled citizens cross paths with some of its more reviled inhabitants. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not a big Sin City mark; I know I've watched the first, but I literally had to Wiki the synopsis of the first to refresh my memory. But I mean, I was very entertained. Such a great visual style, that for me is fresh and effective because, again, I'm not married to the first. I understand that this is so very gratuitous and in that sense the criticisms of misogyny and ultra-violence don't bother me. This movie is lots of fun; it disappoints me to see it struggle so heavily at the box office.

film.summary: Two sisters decide to throw one last house party before their parents sell their family home. (imdb)
film.quote: This is about 95% propelled by the undeniable, unarguable, and unstoppable chemistry and play-off-of-each-other abilities of Tina and Amy. Bobby Moynihan is a comic force, kind of in the vein of a Sean Cullen but WAY more bearable for long periods of time. He's gold in this. And let's talk about JOHHHHHHHN CENA! He's had a great year when you think about it, Trainwreck and now this. The premise, personalities and situations don't have to be realistic to be fun, and this one is definitely fun.

film.summary: Balthazar Blake (Nicolas Cage) is a master sorcerer in modern-day Manhattan trying to defend the city from his arch-nemesis, Maxim Horvath (Alfred Molina). Balthazar can't do it alone, so he recruits Dave Stutler (Jay Baruchel), a seemingly average guy who demonstrates hidden potential, as his reluctant protÃ©gÃ©. The sorcerer gives his unwilling accomplice a crash course in the art and science of magic, and together, these unlikely partners work to stop the forces of darkness.
film.quote: An enjoyable watch that shoots for something and achieves it. Yet another example of Nicolas Cage playing a character and having fun with it. I love reading reviews that hate on the movie for being "kid stuff". Well... it's a Disney movie, dumbass, what did you expect? That's your own fault, not the movie's. You really have to suspend your disbelief in order to enjoy the movie (which, you're walking into a movie about sorcerers, does that REALLY surprise you?), but it's definitely enjoyable.

film.summary: Michael Jordan agrees to help the Looney Toons play a basketball game vs. alien slavers to determine their freedom. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a bit of a guilty pleasure. I like this flick, it's cute, story is pretty timeless and MJ is pretty funny. Good kids flick.

film.summary: Spider-Man 3 reunites the cast and filmmakers from the first two blockbuster adventures for a web of secrets, vengeance, love, and forgiveness. (Columbia Pictures)
film.quote: ...I hope the fourth one gives me a reason to want to care about this franchise again. How dare you fuck up Venom?

film.summary: Susan Cooper is an unassuming, deskbound CIA analyst, and the unsung hero behind the Agency's most dangerous missions. But when her partner falls off the grid and another top agent is compromised, she volunteers to go deep undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer, and prevent a global crisis. (imdb)
film.quote: I had my reservations going in, as I felt that this would just be another "Melissa McCarthy goes too far with it" comedy. Not the case at all. This is, actually, solid all the way around. Everybody's good, the story is good, McCarthy plays it very restrained early on, and even when they take the reigns off of McCarthy's character and let her run with it, it never pushed over that boundary of "too much". Feig might just be one of the more underrated writer-directors in the action-comedy genre.

film.summary: Capt. Picard, with the help of supposedly dead Capt. Kirk, must stop a madman willing to murder on a planetary scale in order to enter a space matrix (imdb)
film.quote: Having just finished binge-watching all of TNG, I've decided to tackle the movies. Seeing the crew of 1701-D again was like slipping into a warm cup of tea, yet I can't say that I'm in love with this. Stewart's periodic overacting (something he seldom fell victim to during the series) hurt my experience. Data's trials with emotion were fine for the most part but perhaps under-explored. You're forgiven if you got lost once they entered the Nexus. Overall, a good opening effort for TNG on film.

film.summary: The Federation is about to encounter its greatest challenge - The Romulans want peace. Conceived in the regal senate halls of Romulus and forged in the dilithium mines of Remus, comes a nemesis bent on destroying Picard and the Federation... exactly in that order.
film.quote: Having just finished binge-watching all of TNG, I've decided to tackle the movies. Here's something I never appreciated fully in the past: mothafuckin Tom Hardy! I would say that this is arguably Patrick Stewart's best performance in the four TNG films. Part of that could well be from having a foil the calibre of Hardy, even in 2002. The killing off of Data is I'm sure a sore point for some Trekkies even today. I would have preferred a different send-off for the TNG crew. It is what it is: fine.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)
film.summary: When the evil Trade Federation plots to take over the peaceful planet of Naboo, Jedi warrior Qui-Gon Jinn and his apprentice Obi-Wan Kenobi embark on an amazing adventure to save the planet.
film.quote: None of the three "sequels" live up to the worst moments in the first trilogy, but Episode I tries its best.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
film.summary: Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with PadmÃ© Amidala while his teacher, Obi-Wan Kenobi, makes an investigation of a separatist assassination attempt on PadmÃ© which leads to the discovery of a secret Republican clone army.
film.quote: This flick was kinda the downfall of this series. Just didn't seem to work for me.

film.summary: A home invasion rattles a quiet family town. (imdb)
film.quote: Clearly written at a time when the dystopia idea was still fresh and not at all pounded into the dirt. At times delightfully absurd, and at other times, a little too insistent on the quality of its commentary (which, I have no qualms about what it's trying to say or how it's trying to say it - just to say that it isn't a perfect delivery), it winds up being an uneven experience for me. I wasn't bored and I didn't dislike it. But I can't say that I loved it, by any stretch. Great cast, though.

film.summary: A secret government agency recruits imprisoned supervillains to execute dangerous black ops missions in exchange for clemency. (imdb)
film.quote: To me, a classic case of expectations vs. reality. I expected things, I got some of them, I didn't get a lot of others. That doesn't mean that what I got wasn't good, just different. Time to admit my bias, my near-genetic disposition to liking comic book movies. You are totally allowed to not like this movie - I too feel that there are a lot of missed opportunities, especially with the Harley-Joker relationship and with Joker himself. But there's time. Tons of it. Body of work, folks. See it.

film.summary: The coming of age summer-camp saga of four best friends who hate each other. (imdb)
film.quote: Bump it up to a 70 due to the close-to-home Canadian content (I have several friends who starred in it), and its struggles to gain any kind of a mainstream audience. It's definitely a movie worth seeing; doesn't exactly write the book or re-define the coming-of-age flick, but has interesting characters with complicated inter-relationships, and the camp itself plays an integral role, almost becoming a character in and of itself. Plus is has awesome narration from Jon Cusack. Sweet nicknames, too.

film.summary: When a border dispute arises between the U.S. and Canada, the Super Troopers are tasked with establishing a Highway Patrol station in the disputed area. (imdb)
film.quote: One of the tougher movies I'll review this year, because of the place ST holds in my heart. Of note, Chandrasekhar's direction hasn't changed in 15+ years. Like other sequels, this doesn't HAVE to be the original to be good; this is good, but, I'd be lying if I said I thought it was anything more. The Can-Am humor works for me, and it really was great to see these characters again. But I'm left fighting that ugly "we waited 16 years for this?" feeling. Not disappointed, but aspired for greater.

film.summary: A small group of former classmates organize an elaborate, annual game of tag that requires some to travel all over the country.
film.quote: Sometimes you watch a movie and it really gets over how much fun the people making it are having, just making a fun movie. That's how I feel about Tag. It's light and pretty fun. Helms and Buress in particular are really funny. While it does take things a step or two "too far" in terms of what I would consider good taste, I wasn't personally offended by anything I saw. Kinda stuck out that this was Tomsic's first feature in four years; his direction left a bit to be desired. Worth seeing though!

film.summary: Four mutant warriors fight to save their city from an evil kingpin. (imdb)
film.quote: Afraid I can't jump on the "fuck this movie" bandwagon. I'm no fan of Mr. Bay, and there are totally some moments where you shake & scratch your head, or out-and-out cringe. They really play up the "teenage" aspect, be prepared for that, and I didn't REALLY like Donatello's personality. I won't say that I loved all the creative choices made. That being said, this was such undeniable fun. It's sweet, sweet candy, but it's organic so it's still KINDA good for you. Don't believe the negative hype.

film.filmname: Tenacious D in The Pick of Destiny (2006)
film.summary: The legend of the fabled "Pick of Destiny" infuses every page of rock history. Since the dark ages, this supernatural pick has been passed down through many hands. Now, the time draws nigh when the pick will be passed to the next generation of rock - the ones they call Tenacious D. This is their tale of a friendship that would last through the ages and a musical and spiritual synergy so strong that it would reshape our very understanding of the concept of rock. This is the story of Tenacious D in The Pick of Destiny. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: Jack Black is the man in my eyes.

film.summary: Thank You for Smoking is a fiercely satirical look at today's "culture of spin." The hero of the film is Nick Naylor (Eckhart), chief spokesman for Big Tobacco, who makes his living defending the rights of smokers and cigarette makers in today's neo-puritanical culture. (Fox Searchlight)
film.quote: Only saw this once, liked it but don't remember too much. Eckhart is quite good, though.

film.summary: The powerful but arrogant warrior Thor is cast out of the fantastic realm of Asgard and sent to live amongst humans on Earth, where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.
film.quote: The 3D is -- yup! -- completely worthless. If you're gonna use 3D, do it in such a way that makes people, after seeing the movie, either A) want to see it again; B) tell their friends to see it in 3D; or C) both. "Thor" does none of these. Luckily it's worth seeing because of what actually happens IN the movie (which is the main thing of course). Just don't shell out your extra $$$ to see it in 3D. Has some humor and alright action. Might be a little rushed. AND, Kat Dennings. Mmm, Kat Dennings.

film.summary: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian (Bana) with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage.
film.quote: It's still creepy. Like "P.S. I Love You" creepy. But at least McAdams is gorgeous. Sometimes it didn't feel enough to just have Bana with or without grey hair to denote which "Henry" we were seeing, old or new, and the soundtrack was at the same time very fitting (ie. "Love Will Tear Us Apart" by Joy Division - performed by Broken Social Scene in the movie), and very cliche and expected (ie. "Clocks" by Coldplay, every fuckin romance movie needs "Clocks" in it). The high point was the daughter.

film.summary: Lara Croft, the fiercely independent daughter of a missing adventurer, must push herself beyond her limits when she finds herself on the island where her father disappeared. (imdb)
film.quote: You might be able to make this statement more than I'm giving it credit for, but I legitimately can't think of another working actress I would rather see portray this version of the Lara Croft character, than Alicia Vikander. It's not her most challenging dramatic performance but she definitely puts in work, especially in the physical sense. Insulated by a good cast and featuring more than enough story-wise to keep me in it, I have virtually no complaints, even if it didn't jump off the screen.

film.summary: A factory worker, Douglas Quaid, begins to suspect that he is a spy after visiting Rekall - a company that provides its clients with implanted fake memories of a life they would like to have led - goes wrong and he finds himself on the run. (imdb)
film.quote: There are a lot of things about this remake you can get behind. The WWIII angle and the ambiance of the UFB and Colony are great, we had nods to the previous version including the chick with 3 boobs and the reference to Mars at Rekall. Beckinsale didn't exactly re-define the villain or anything, but was solid and sexy and that's really all we needed. I may have qualms with the ending (although I appreciate open-ended finales), but it's also something of an homage to the first film. Worth seeing!

film.filmname: Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day (2009)
film.summary: Ricky, Julian and Bubbles are released from jail again to find that the Sunnyvale Trailer park has moved along with all the residents and Bubbles' kitties have been taken to the SPCA.
film.quote: I love the material, and at the same time hate how far Clatts has departed from the cinematography that built the series. Flick suffered from the same formula of season 7; it focused too much on Bubbles rather than him being the side-kick character, where he's best. With no single scheme throughout, the movie feels too chaotic. There were two ways to properly end the tale: they go to jail forever or they make it big; neither happens, which is very disappointing to the series' hardcore fanbase.

film.summary: Decepticon forces return to Earth on a mission to take Sam Witwicky prisoner, after the young hero learns the truth about the ancient origins of the Transformers. Joining the mission to protect humankind is Optimus Prime, who forms an alliance with international armies for a second epic battle. (imdb)
film.quote: Again, you get what you pay for. It kept me entertained, but I mean, you're going to get NO emotional investment in any of the characters. Bumblebee might be the only character you can get behind, and that's in bits and peices. Fox is hot, of course, but meh. Points get taken off for the horribly, blatantly racist characters Mudflap and Skids, and Wheelie's robo-fucking of Megan Fox's leg.

film.summary: A man is captured by a maniac and tortured, physically and mentally, into becoming a walrus. (imdb)
film.quote: TUSK is my artistic spirit animal: a whimsical, goofy idea that became reality. Is it everything I wanted it to be? No, but then again, it would have been hard to be that. Parks' dialogue is brilliant. Long plays the annoying self-important internet brat very well, too. When the walrus is revealed, it's goofy but it's twisted. "The cameo"... it's not that it isn't funny... it just doesn't really fit. 2-movies-in-1 isn't necessarily a BAD thing, but, I do wish it stuck more to one over the other.

film.summary: A chronicle of the life of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic runner who was taken prisoner by Japanese forces during World War II. (imdb)
film.quote: There are parts of this I really liked, and parts of it that were just there. It's a shade heavy on the American Jingoism for my taste. It's a shade more religiously-undertoned than I expected; among other things, I immediately connoted Jesus' crucifixion from the plank scene. Also, wasn't there, y'know, a nuclear bombing that ended the war, not just... nothing? I dunno, that bugged me more than it should have. This is inoffensive, good in pieces, but should have been much better for its hype.

film.summary: When Martin (Liam Neeson) emerges from a coma following an auto accident in Berlin, nothing is as it should be: Not only does his wife (January Jones) no longer recognize him, but a stranger (Aidan Quinn) has apparently taken over his identity. With assassins chasing him and the police unsympathetic to his story, Harris must reassemble his world piece by piece, helped only by the one person (Diane Kruger) who seems able to grasp his plight.
film.quote: Always enjoy Liam Neeson, in basically anything I see him in. Fairly good performances by the entire cast, though it doesn't jump to that next level of fantastic-ness that I think people expected the movie to get to. With the supposed promise that the movie is better than "Taken", quote, "in every possible way", the movie unfortunately doesn't get to that level. But it's definitely worth going out and seeing. The twist caught me by surprise, and Liam Neeson remembers how to kill you (asshole!).

film.summary: Hoping to bring his family closer together and to recreate his childhood vacation for his own kids, a grown up Rusty Griswold takes his wife and their two sons on a cross-country road trip to the coolest theme park in America, Walley World. Needless to say, things don't go quite as planned. (imdb)
film.quote: Wow, really? I'm not going to say something douchey like "We must have been watching two different movies or something!", but... kind of surprised that people vehemently disliked this. Is it a laugh-a-minute riot? Nope. Will you laugh? Yeah, probably. Does the youngest son's schtick get old quick? Yes. Is he still funny? Yes. Are the gimmick and the situations that arise from the gimmick believable? Not always. Do they need to be? Not really. I dunno, I liked it. Take that for what it's worth.

film.summary: A car accident puts Paige (McAdams) in a coma, and when she wakes up with severe memory loss, her husband Leo (Tatum) works to win her heart again. (imdb)
film.quote: Is it possible that a romance flick with Mumbles Tatum and Rachel McAdams (who I've never really liked) was NOT a sack of dogshit-stained carpet? Believe it! I loved the dynamic between the two, this North-side-of-Chicago, hipster-esque romance. I'll pull the reigns back a bit though, because there was some textbook wonk in there (the car accident and her flying through the window was TERRIBLY done, it looked silly), but nothing felt tacked on and I was surprisingly pleased with the experience.

film.summary: A man's nervous breakdown causes him to leave his wife and live in his attic for several months. (imdb)
film.quote: The beginning feels like a film school project where anybody that gave Swicord 5 minutes of their time gets an EP credit; this film literally has over a dozen EP's. Bryan Cranston's tremendous inner monologue is more than worth the price of admission. He's delightfully insane, more so for his state of mind than for his actions themselves. I really dug the black comedy elements of the dialogue. And that is just the perfect ending for the movie's tone. I'd say this is absolutely worth the watch.

film.summary: A contemporary retelling of H.G. Wells&#039;s seminal classic, the sci-fi adventure thriller reveals the extraordinary battle for the future of humankind through the eyes of one American family fighting to survive it. (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: This film worked for the first-time watch. Not so much afterwards.

film.summary: The peaceful realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invaders: orc warriors fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction. From opposing sides, two heroes are set on a collision course that will decide the fate of their family, their people, and their home. (imdb)
film.quote: I feel rather blessed, believe it or not, that I know virtually nothing about the lore. Allows me to approach this as its own movie. In terms of the elements of fantasy, this is everything that I wanted it to be; it's layered and interesting, with more than enough character and intrigue to keep me going. At the same time, it's imperfect; there are rushed and undercooked elements for sure, and more than a few. Performances could have been better. I think "generic" is an unfair criticism. See it!

film.summary: The inseparable duo try to organize a rock concert while Wayne must fend off a record producer who has an eye for his girlfriend. (imdb)
film.quote: Excellent.

film.summary: When the greedy mayor (Andrew Daly) decides to close Jellystone Park to cash in by selling the land, Yogi Bear (voiced by Dan Aykroyd) and his sidekick Boo-Boo (voiced by Justin Timberlake) must team with their adversary, Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh), to save their home. Meanwhile, filmmaker Rachel (Anna Faris) follows Yogi and captures his antics.
film.quote: Y'know what, fuck you guys, this movie was funny as shit. End review.

film.summary: A war veteran's attempt to save a young girl from a sex trafficking ring goes horribly wrong.
film.quote: I have to wave the "inaccessibility" flag here. The conclusions that Joe comes to aren't spelled out in such a way that makes clear exactly what they are. Elitists might say differently, but that's a problem for an audience. This nails the intensity in both tone and performance, though it borders on overdoing things on both counts and becoming melodramatic. Unlike most I'm not willing to praise the sound design; found it distracting in (too many) parts. I didn't dislike it - it just missed me.

film.summary: In the wake of a disaster that wipes out most of civilization, two men and a young woman find themselves in an emotionally charged love triangle as the last known survivors. (imdb)
film.quote: Dammit Loomis, why'd you have to play the most awkwardly-hilarious, random race card in cinema history? Chiwetel Ejiofor, despite being given loads of credit for his most recognizable role in "12 Years A Slave", may yet be underrated. Here he pulls off close to a master performance, as a lonely, paranoid man at the end of the world. I would say it's his performance specifically that made this enjoyable for me. Chris Pine and Margot Robbie would make gorgeous babies, though. Check this one out!

film.summary: "21" is the fact-based story about six MIT students who were trained to become experts in card counting and subsequently took Vegas casinos for millions in winnings. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Blackjack, so mild saving grace. It's a nice cautionary tale, nothing more. But the cast was pretty talented, and Kevin Spacey was great as always.

film.summary: Two fledgling criminals kidnap a pizza delivery guy, strap a bomb to his chest, and inform him that he has mere hours to rob a bank or else... (imdb)
film.quote: A throwback sit-com which hits the funny without asking its audience to think... well, at all. Felt like Danny McBride wrote it even though he didn't, same kind of comedy, but comes off better than his last effort ("Your Highness"). McBride is starting to suffer from Will Ferrell syndrome (playing the same character each and every time out). I wonder how many people caught the "Social Network" reference early on, I laughed at that a lot. It did its job, but I won't seek out seeing it ever again.

film.summary: The Greek general Themistocles battles an invading army of Persians under the mortal-turned-god, Xerxes. (imdb)
film.quote: Athenians AREN'T as much fun as Spartans. "300" it ain't. To clarify, 300 is a bad movie that stands as perhaps my top all-time guilty pleasure. This is a bad movie a second time, with a director who, despite his best efforts to look like Zack Snyder, ISN'T Zack Snyder and shouldn't have tried to be. Eva Green and her bare chest is a high point (though that sex scene was self-aware silliness). The persistent narration can get annoying. Don't see it in 3D. I love the universe too much to hate it.

film.summary: In a near-future city where soaring opulence overshadows economic hardship, Gwen and her daughter Jules do all they can to hold on to their joy together, despite the instability surfacing in their world. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a movie that is sure to engender different reactions from different demographics. It's not BAD but I don't think I can characterize it as good, either. At least, good in the conventional sense of Sci-Fi. Which is maybe an unfair metric. This is more of a Drama with a dystopian Sci-Fi glaze. Written "by feminists, for feminists", which is fine, and it expresses a number of interesting ideas in visually-interesting ways. Performances just aren't there for me. Ditto for the wonky dialogue.

film.summary: After the earth-shattering revelations of Insurgent, Tris must escape with Four beyond the wall that encircles Chicago to finally discover the shocking truth of what lies behind it. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll say this -- it is definitely the best of these three movies, hopping over a relatively-low-hanging bar. At the end of the day, I really could not get into these movies on a consistent enough basis to really recommend them. Woodley gives her best performance but still feels useless to the plot at times. I kept waiting for random romances to start getting shoe-horned in; luckily it didn't happen. Bottom line, these movies SHOULD be better, and aren't. But you've come this far. Finish it up.

film.summary: In Aloha, a celebrated military contractor returns to the site of his greatest career triumphs - the US Space program in Honolulu, Hawaii - and reconnects with a long-ago love while unexpectedly falling for the hard-charging Air Force watchdog assigned to him. (imdb)
film.quote: Remember kids, unconventional story structure/dialogue/delivery are bad things and should be feared. Don't get me wrong, this flick isn't going to win awards, but this is another of those movies that's getting inconceivably and unduly shit on. Could it be better? Totally, there are lots of things that this movie could do better, but people are discounting the things that this movie does RIGHT -- primarily, that it entertained and told a story in an off-beat, weird, but ultimately satisfying way.

film.summary: A stoner and his girlfriend's sleepy, small-town existence is disrupted when his past comes back to haunt him in the form of a government operation set to wipe him out. (imdb)
film.quote: The best way I can describe this would be: imagine if "Pineapple Express" was directed by David Lynch, and written by Robert Ludlum. Boom. That's American Ultra right there. This thing is fucking weird, and I find myself at something of a loss to say much about it. I wasn't in love with it, but at the same time I know I had a positive response to what I saw. I guess I land more in the "intrigued" camp than I do in the "entertained" one. I think this is worth seeing, but, curb your expectations.

film.filmname: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy (2004)
film.summary: Ron Burgundy (Ferrell) is the top-rated anchorman in San Diego in the '70s. When feminism marches into the newsroom in the form of ambitious newswoman Veronica Corningstone (Applegate), Ron is willing to play along at first-as long as Veronica stays in her place, covering cat fashion shows, cooking, and other "female" interests. But when Veronica refuses to settle for being eye candy and steps behind the news desk, it's more than a battle between two perfectly coiffed anchor-persons... it's war. (imdb)
film.quote: I think this film gets too much credit. It really pales when you look at the fact that Will Ferrill has been playing the same character for 5 years.

film.summary: Several years after the tragic death of their little girl, a dollmaker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from a shuttered orphanage into their home, soon becoming the target of the dollmaker's possessed creation, Annabelle. (imdb)
film.quote: If these Conjuring movies get one thing right, it's that for the most part, they set up their jump scares in a tense and satisfying way - even if some of those setups go on too long. Significant uptick from the original Annabelle and closer in line with The Conjuring 1 in terms of quality, which is still a titular misnomer. "Demon Logic" in full effect, and there are some things here that will run the risk of taking you out of it. Didn't tank the experience; this is an exercise in good and bad.

film.filmname: The Art of Racing in the Rain (2019)
film.summary: A dog named Enzo recalls the life lessons he has learned from his race car driving owner, Denny. (imdb)
film.quote: I get the feeling that fans of the book - a co-worker of mine is a MASSIVE fan - may find this movie lacking in how quickly it moves from plot point to plot point. I understand that as an artistic choice, never lingering in one spot too long, rather just letting the moments pass naturally, but you're still telling a story at the end of the day. Amanda Seyfried is really good; it's probably the best performance of hers I've ever seen. I'm not in love with it, though there's content of value here.

film.summary: The Bad Boys Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett are back together for one last ride in the highly anticipated Bad Boys for Life.
film.quote: Upon entering the movie and realizing that this was just over TWO HOURS LONG (seriously Hollywood, this needs to stop), I was met with the terribly dreadful thought that this movie would suck. Honestly, on pure popcorn, don't-think-too-much entertainment, I'm here for the Bad Boys. I certainly don't feel any compulsion to sit and pick it apart, and based on that at least, this was fine for what it was. Maybe it wanted to say a little more than I felt it did, but it wasn't a failure by any means.

film.summary: A man whose brain becomes magnetized unintentionally destroys every tape in his friend's video store. In order to satisfy the store's most loyal renter, an aging woman with signs of dementia, the two men set out to remake the lost films.
film.quote: Again, I love Jack Black and he's quite charming in this flick. Doesn't make it strong, though.

film.summary: A furloughed convict and his American and Chinese partners as they hunt a high-level cybercrime network from Chicago to Los Angeles to Hong Kong to Jakarta. (imdb)
film.quote: Far from bad, but never reaches above that "Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit" level for me. Aside from some silly lines and wonky situations here and there, the story & performances are fine (though I could have done without the unexplored sub-sub-sub-story of "character whose only motivation is that their spouse died on 9/11"). Gunfights were good, more of those may have helped. Visual effects were quite good. Some sloppy editing. Still don't know why the love story happened. Bottom line, inoffensive.

film.filmname: Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again (2004)
film.summary: Celebrated comedians Jeff Foxworthy, Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, and Ron White are reunited by popular demand to bring back more of their blue collar humor. The first movie was a runaway hit and the latest installment of this concert experience allows you to once again see them perform their original material on stage, up close and personal, from the best seat in the house. (imdb)
film.quote: It's high-end average because it's the Blue Collar boys and they're very funny. But compared to the first movie... sorry boys, this don't cut the mustard.

film.summary: Picked as her best friend's maid of honor, lovelorn and broke Annie (Wiig) looks to bluff her way through the expensive and bizarre rituals with an oddball group of bridesmaids. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie had a shit-ton of hype behind it, which I think makes me instinctively skeptical. However. There were some definite solid laughs (the "Fight Club" line made me lose it) and something of a story to it. 90% of the comedy came from Melissa McCarthy, but, she is so damn funny that it really makes up for something of an un-funny cast outside of her, Wiig, and O'Dowd. But it's a good female buddy comedy - it does the things that, if Sex & The City did them, it wouldn't be such a trainwreck.

film.summary: An ex-cop trailing the wife of New York City's mayor finds himself immersed in a larger scandal. (imdb)
film.quote: Initially I dug the late 80's/early 90's feel to this movie: quick-hit scenes that don't dump too much story on you, just background info and character intros. Story takes about 20 minutes to start unfolding, and when it does it seems like a fairly cut-and-dry detective story that could serve as an okay way to spend a few minutes. There's good and bad. The political stuff doesn't bog me down, and when the real story is finally swung on us it definitely improves. It's convention done decently.

film.summary: A young man arrives in Hollywood during the 1930s hoping to work in the film industry. There, he falls in love, and finds himself swept up in the vibrant cafÃ© society that defined the spirit of the age. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't mean this in a bad way, but I'm not entirely sure that Woody Allen is NOT still stuck in film school. I guess it's just his style. I found the overt narrator... distracting. I'm all for satire but I feel like this might be ten or twelve shades too hard on the nose, especially when it cuts back to New York. There is definitely good here but it feels so uneven. I don't know what else to say. It's a miss from me, although a strong, poignant and nuanced ending does bump the ranking up a bit.

film.summary: A sheltered high school girl unleashes her newly developed telekinetic powers after she is pushed too far by her peers. (imdb)
film.quote: Shouldn't be expecting Shakespeare here. It's popcorn fare plain and simple. You don't have to think about it, you just have to watch Carrie White go super nuts over these cunty teenagers being assholes for literally NO RAISIN except, teenagers. You're sitting there waiting for Carrie to finally go full Carrie, and when she does, it's satisfying. Julianne Moore was creepy as hell, and CGM played the role she was handed quite well. Other performances were struggles but to me it's worth seeing.

film.summary: After he reunites with an old pal through Facebook, a mild-mannered accountant is lured into the world of international espionage. (imdb)
film.quote: I wanted to like this more than I ultimately did. I wanted to laugh MORE OFTEN. The laughs that I got were good ones, don't get me wrong, but I wanted them more frequently and it just didn't happen. As unfair a criticism as this probably is, the ending didn't make any sense to me in terms of Amy Ryan's character. Unfair in the sense that hey, it's a comedy, it doesn't always have to make sense, but it's also a spy movie, and like it or not, the who-what-when-where-why-how matters. Wasn't bad.

film.summary: Reboot of the 2000 action comedy based on the 1970s television series. A new generation of private detectives working for the mysterious Charlie. (imdb)
film.quote: It's really not that difficult to have fun with this movie, and even though I'm not walking out of it having seen something revolutionary, what I DID see, I'd be down to see more of! Fight choreography could use some work in places and it's not the smartest screenplay, but it has wit and a bit of warmth and is propelled by yet another really solid showing from Stewart. Do I mean Patrick or Kristen? I mean both: K-Stew is pretty good throughout, and "haming-it-up" Patrick is best Patrick.

film.summary: Surrounded by limber, wanton women on a booze-soaked island resort owned by rock star has-been Coconut Pete (Paxton), a non-stop party takes a turn for the weird when dead bodies start turning up faster than you could drink a rum punch. (Fox)
film.quote: Definitely a downgrade for the Broken Lizard guys, but it's hard not to downgrade from one of the best comedies of all-time. They try to mix comedy with horror and do an okay job, and I would rather watch this and get some laughs and (very) small doses of horror and suspense than, say, The Grudge.

film.summary: A fresh out of jail parolee finds out that life outside his prison cell is much more complicated than he was expecting, especially when he starts spending time with his eccentric sister and all the crazy people in and around her life.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Following an epidemic of zombies two Philadelphia SWAT team members, a traffic reporter and his girlfriend seek refuge in a secluded shopping mall.
film.quote: Don't put this movie or its remake on par with, say, 28 Days Later, but for a late 70s horror flick it does its job.

film.summary: NY police officer Ralph Sarchie investigates a series of crimes. He joins forces with an unconventional priest, schooled in the rituals of exorcism, to combat the possessions that are terrorizing their city. (IMDb)
film.quote: The end of this movie was soul-crushing. I feel bad for saying that, but it's true. I was actually entertained! Enjoying myself! Stuff was interesting! Ramirez is really good and doesn't just play the cut-and-dry "normal" priest! It was going really well, like 80/100 territory. And then that ending. I'm not talking about the exorcism, that was fine. I'm talking about the cop-out "Miami Vice" ending, where everything just falls into place in the laziest ways possible. Could have been a contender.

film.summary: Two teens begin to suspect that one of their neighbors is a serial killer. Are their suspicions merely the product of cabin fever and vivid imagination? Or have they unwittingly stumbled across a crime that could cost them their lives? (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: Works for awhile, then, plummets. But Shia LaBeouf is the luckiest skinny kid in Hollywood.

film.summary: Rocky, a young woman wanting to start a better life for her and her sister, agrees to take part in the robbery of a house owned by a wealthy blind man with her boyfriend Money and their friend Alex. But when the blind man turns out to be a serial killer, the group must find a way to escape his home before they become his newest victims. (imdb)
film.quote: For me this is a movie of tremendous premise that slips in more than one spot in its execution. The main trio are fine in most cases, though I think their characters are rather hollow with the exception of Jane Levy. There are those moments, however, where typical thriller and horror logic (or lack thereof) comes into play. Stephen Lang is a boss, though. I feel like the ending is somewhat wasted, though. It's going for something that is kind of pointless to go for. But it could be WAY worse.

film.summary: After meeting at a nightclub in a Mediterranean resort, seven young adults decide to continue partying aboard a luxury yacht in the middle of the ocean. But when one of them dies in a freak accident, the others argue about what to do, which leads to a ruthless fight for survival. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Brit flicks. They always seem to have this aesthetic of dread that American movies can rarely match. And British movies have the market cornered on real, raw emotion. But onto the important stuff: the girls are BEAUTIFUL. Not just sex appeal it's real *beauty*. And it's always fun to see truly beautiful girls get down. Full frontal nudity and good simulated sex scenes are included in the price of admission. Not to mention some excellent and the most innovative kill scenes I've ever seen.

film.summary: A loan officer who evicts an old woman from her home finds herself the recipient of a supernatural curse. Desperate, she turns to a seer to try and save her soul, while evil forces work to push her to a breaking point.
film.quote: I appreciate the throwback nature of it, the intro looked like something out of the 70s which I dug. But it seemed to me like DMTH was a second-tier Grudge, with the blatant A/V scares one would expect from such a flick. I'm sorry, but dancing demons and CGI demon-goats don't entertain me. That whole scene was just a little too "Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' video" for me. I was a fan for about a half-hour - the sequence in the car was fucking harsh and I dug it. After that... just fell apart.

film.summary: A pair of teenagers with life-threatening illnesses meet in a hospital and fall in love. (imdb)
film.quote: Think... "Me Before You", but no assisted suicide and BOTH love interests have the incurable condition. And y'know, for what it was, it's fine! Heavily tropey and melodramatic, but where in other films that's a debilitating criticism, here it's more of... a feature, I guess. Baldoni's direction is serviceable, the misses are almost all forgivable, and the movie-driving performances of Moises Arias, (especially) Haley Lu Richardson, and even Cole Sprouse in places, keep this ship above water.

film.summary: An airline pilot saves a flight from crashing, but an investigation into the malfunctions reveals something troubling (imdb)
film.quote: There's good and bad to be found in this flick, which takes monstrous stylistic turns in an attempt to appear gritty and real... which sadly renders some portions wholly unrealistic. The good includes many of the performances; while Denzel is Denzel, can John Goodman get some love? Dude is phenomenal! The flight sequence and Kelly Reilly are both great. Sadly, the bad is as evident as Whip's alcoholism, and the movie somewhat devolves to preachy, religious anti-alcohol dogma. Far from brilliant.

film.summary: Garfield marks the long-awaited motion picture debut of America's favorite feline and the world's laziest cat. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Worked for me because the jokes and the delivery of Garfield hit a note, reminiscent of the series in some ways, but at the same time they could have done so so so much more.

film.summary: Following the French atomic bomb tests in the South Pacific, an unknown creature is spotted passing eastward through the Panama Canal.
film.quote: When I first saw it, I thought it was pretty great, and the marketing was awesome with the Puff Daddy song "Come With Me", but I watch it now and it's just... not great. But I wouldn't shy away from watching it at any opportunity.

film.summary: Three retirees plan a bank heist. (imdb)
film.quote: This is just a fun time, and that's where all discussion of this movie basically begins and ends. It's an intentionally-unrealistic buddy-heist romp in the spirit of "The Little Old Lady Who Broke All The Rules", and that's all it's trying to be; in that, it succeeds on the strengths and undeniable chemistry of Freeman, Caine, and Arkin. Is it particularly incredible at any one thing, or even as the sum of its parts? Not really. But it's very watchable, and you could do worse this weekend.

film.summary: Career con artist Roy Courtnay can hardly believe his luck when he meets well-to-do widow Betty McLeish online. As Betty opens her home and life to him, Roy is surprised to find himself caring about her, turning what should be a cut-and-dry swindle into the most treacherous tightrope walk of his life. (imdb)
film.quote: This confirms without a shadow of a doubt that virtually nobody likes a slow burn. They just don't, no matter what they say to the contrary. Anyway, that's them. I on the other hand rather enjoyed this movie while not adoring it. The serious uptick in intensity in the film's third act was refreshing and the ultimate connection between the two leads -- who were both excellent, by the way -- was unexpected and (I thought) well-executed. Solid direction. But hey -- you can't please everybody.

film.summary: A young punk rock band find themselves trapped in a secluded venue after stumbling upon a horrific act of violence. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't feel any connection with any of the characters heading into the event that sparks things. That does dull the impact a bit. And the "dumb idea" when it first happens... that kind of doubles as a dumb plot device, too. This has an undeniable style and definitely stays faithful to it throughout, but I'm left feeling a bit ambivalent to it. It's definitely not a bad movie, not at all. It's worth checking out, especially for the style-seekers among us. Just didn't resonate strongly with me.

film.summary: An inventor and his mom hit the road together so he can sell his latest invention. (imdb)
film.quote: It was alright. It was funny in some places, and very funny in some other places. Much of the comedy is featured in the trailer, but again, certainly not all of it as there were some zingers that came out of left field that were very good. Seth Rogen is Seth Rogen and on that level his character really got over for me, but I couldn't help being turned off of Streisand, who is basically just playing Streisand plus obnoxious Jewish mother ala Estelle Costanza from Seinfeld. Wasn't a total waste.

film.summary: A former Special Forces soldier and military contractor suffering from PTSD tries to reconnect with his long time love, but first must go on the run from London to Barcelona and across Europe in order to clear his name. (imdb)
film.quote: Sean Penn is never really my first choice as a lead, but he's okay in this. I like Bardem, but he's starting to... either be type-cast or consciously choosing to play the same character constantly, hard to tell which. I can't quite call this a success -- it being not only overshadowed by "Run All Night", but falling victim to the age-old action dilemma of "when nothing's blowing up, this thing drags on", especially when it tries to get too political -- but it's certainly not a failure, either.

film.summary: When the puppet cast of an '80s children's TV show begins to get murdered one by one, a disgraced LAPD detective-turned-private eye puppet takes on the case.
film.quote: There was enough in this that was funny to me that I'm not disappointed in it. I feel like a broken record here, but if you're a comedy, just make me laugh and send me on my way. This made me laugh, and sent me on my way! So what would I have to be upset about? A weak script? I'm laughing at the puppet dick jokes, I don't particularly care that there isn't an eloquent soliloquy attached to this strip club scene. Who would need that? Pardon the assumption, but stop taking yourself so seriously.

film.summary: A black ops super soldier seeks payback after she is betrayed and set up during a mission. (imdb)
film.quote: I found myself into it early on, it built a decent atmosphere, and was shot decently. However, I soon started feeling like the flick was just there. Not unenjoyable, just... there. Throughout the flick, I felt that the sound hampered my enjoyment and didn't feel fitting for what was happening on-screen; action sounds and background noise completely removed in favor of unfitting music is a crime in any movie. The sound editing/mixing was really off, too. Kinda dug the 70-80's feel. Worth seeing.

film.summary: Based on the graphic novels by Mike Mignola, Hellboy, caught between the worlds of the supernatural and human, battles an ancient sorceress bent on revenge.
film.quote: Now would be the time -- more so than any other time before it -- to just shut your brain off and consume popcorn entertainment. Just have fun. And if you commit to just having fun with this movie, chances are, that's what you'll have. Too many people I think committed to hating this from the jump because of the casting. I think that's unfair; though it lacks the polish and quality of the earlier Hellboy movies, it's far from the 0-ranked "cultural abomination" that others have labelled it.

film.summary: Wayne Szalinski is your average "nutty scientist", working on a top secret machine which miniaturizes objects... (imdb)
film.quote: Was good for its time, catchy premise with slapstick humor, still good for a chuckle here and there and I really enjoyed the camerawork and the effort it took to pull the movie off. Mild recommend for the three people on the planet who haven't see it on TBS.

film.summary: Three people, three extraordinary stories. All lived out within a hundred London streets. (imdb)
film.quote: The British have always had a pretty good hold on really good drama. While I don't know that this qualifies as a whole piece as "really good drama", there's a lot about it to like and a lot of elements that really work well. And then, there are more than a few moments where it veers over the line into forced melodrama. This probably won't jump off the screen at you, but it's an enjoyable watch. No real standout performances, but a capable ensemble compliments capable filmmaking. Give it a shot!

film.summary: Mia Hall thought the hardest decision she would ever face would be whether to pursue her musical dreams at Juilliard or follow a different path to be with the love of her life, Adam. But what should have been a carefree family drive changes everything in an instant, and now her own life hangs in the balance. Caught between life and death for one revealing day, Mia has only one decision left, which will not only decide her future but her ultimate fate. (imdb)
film.quote: Stacy Keach for days. With such a small part time-wise, his performance resonates at a far superior level. I should point out that nobody in the movie was out-and-out BAD (most everyone could be considered alright-to-good), and despite my well-documented distaste for teenage dialogue/situations, this flick felt mostly genuine despite its melodrama and otherworldly-ness. There IS a market for this movie... it just might not be you specifically. It's worth taking a look at, but, tread carefully.

film.summary: Four teenagers discover an old video game console and are literally drawn into the game's jungle setting becoming the adult avatars they choose. (imdb)
film.quote: When you're talking straight comedy movies, you want to have fun, right? You want to laugh, right? You are in luck, my friends -- this is fun and funny and has a surprising amount of heart. Which is more than I expected out of a movie that, I'll be honest, I expected to dislike or be ambivalent to. There's some stuff here that hooks you -- from the video game aesthetics to the inter-relationships (even the under-developed ones) to the outright foolishness and low-brow comedy. This was just fun.

film.summary: The experiences of several teenagers who were removed from their homes and sent to a behavior modification and ex-gay school in Jarabacoa, Dominican Republic. The school's program was called &quot;Culture Shock Therapy&quot;. According to former students of Escuela Caribe, they were subjected to a range of abuses including intense forced labor, physical beatings (called &quot;swats&quot;), and various forms of emotional abuse. (kidnappedforchrist.com)
film.quote: While I don't think this told me personally much of anything I didn't already know (or could glean), it's okay to convey the same message when the thing that is causing that message has not been made better. It's still scary and still sickening to know this kind of thing goes on under the guise of "doing God's work" or "helping kids". Kind of interesting that the original intent of the doc was not at all what it turned out to be, that's a nice organic twist. Logan does a solid job in her debut.

film.summary: The Bride wakes up after a long coma. The baby that she carried before entering the coma is gone. The only thing on her mind is to have revenge on the assassination team that betrayed her - a team she was once part of.
film.quote: I'm just not a fan. Rubs me the wrong way. This seems like one of those flicks that I'll appreciate so much more when I'm 40.

film.summary: The murderous Bride continues her vengeance quest against her ex-boss, Bill, and his two remaining associates; his younger brother Budd, and Bill's latest flame Elle.
film.quote: Clearly I'm missing something here. Gonna have to re-watch them I think.

film.summary: A wholesome, Midwestern woman accidentally gets involved with an international super spy and is forced to flee the country with him while he protects a dangerous new piece of technology.
film.quote: Okay, so it's Tom Cruise. And it's Tom Cruise playing an action hero. So that's all well and good. And the humor in his character went over well with me, it had a decent variance of subtle comedy and fairly standard action which isn't "sub-par", just kind of forgettable. I'm having a hard time writing this review, as the memorability factor of this movie MIGHT be in the negative. But still, as a one-off watch, it gets a pass on the high side of average, and is worth the rental when it comes out.

film.summary: Once there was a young prince whose father, the king of the East, sent him down into Egypt to find a pearl. But when the prince arrived, the people poured him a cup. Drinking it, he forgot he was the son of a king, forgot about the pearl and fell into a deep sleep. (imdb)
film.quote: Knight of Cups is, without question, ambitious and intriguingly-presented. Yet I fear that ambition alone, even when intriguing, does not a good movie make. Ambition in art can often give way to pretense, and here Malick crosses that line on more than one occasion. I've no qualms with the concept and definitely appreciate the experimentation, as well as the intense sensory gravitas that Malick accomplishes. I can't call this bad, but I can't call it good, either. It's kind of its own thing.

film.summary: Live-action role players conjure up a demon from Hell by mistake and they must deal with the consequences.
film.quote: GET INTERESTED IN GIRLS! STOP LARPING! Sure it's stupid, but come on, how in the world can you hate this? It KNOWS how dumb it is, without really going over the edge into being "TOO self-aware" (definitely a thing these movies can do sometimes). Every line Brian Posehn delivers is fucking GOLD, much of the rest of the dialogue is pure nerdy fun, chicks make out hard for a few minutes, people get their shit kicked in, and Ryan Kwanten is pretty good for his role. Not a GOOD movie, but see it!

film.summary: A story that takes place over millions of years and is inspired by the beauty of tropical islands and the allure of ocean volcanoes. (imdb)
film.quote: Dug the animation, didn't so much dig the story as a whole. I can't help but compare it to "Feast", my runaway favorite short of last year. And "Feast" is far, far better. But still, in general, more movies need to have short films play before they start. Keep this trend going.

film.summary: After the murder of his father, a young lion prince flees his kingdom only to learn the true meaning of responsibility and bravery.
film.quote: As Disney continues its weird and wild world tour of reselling 30-somethings' childhoods back to them at $12 a ticket, I'm left asking the question, "What's the point of this movie?" What does this movie give you that the 1994 offering doesn't? Beyonce as Nala. That's about it. Distracting voice acting and unflattering CGI (if you're going for, y'know, emotion) underscore the absolute lack of need for this remake. I didn't hate it. But it doesn't need to exist. Just watch the 1994 one, 'kay?

film.summary: After learning that their handler (Jason Patric) has set them up, a group of disavowed CIA operatives led by Clay -- aka the Colonel bands together to bring down their betrayers in this action thriller adapted from the comic book series by Andy Diggle and Jock.
film.quote: I rather enjoyed this as an action-comedy. I've liked Zoe Saldana in pretty much anything she's been in so far, Idris Elba is wonderful, as are basically the entire cast, and the jokes were funny and effective. Most people seemed to think that the movie was relatively bland, which I don't really agree with, at no point in the movie did I feel bored. Were the premises flimsy? Sure they were. Was it silly at times? Sure it was. But it was still fun. It was still engaging. And I was entertained.

film.summary: A teenage girl in the Midwest becomes infected by an outbreak of a disease that slowly turns the infected into zombies. (imdb)
film.quote: A little heavy on the introspective "family drama in the zombie apocalypse" side, and maybe it's true that, especially for fans of the zombie sub-genre this doesn't present too much that's new or hasn't been seen before. That being said, I enjoyed subdued Arnold, I thought the world was realistic and believable, and for what it's trying to be, I thought this was good. Could have been better, but still good. Also, I like the way this was shot; I'm seeing a lot of "amateurish" cries, but I dug it.

film.summary: The "Sleeping Beauty" tale is told from the perspective of the villainous Maleficent and looks at the events that hardened her heart and drove her to curse young Princess Aurora. (imdb)
film.quote: It looks and sounds like a stereotypical fairy tale, and in that way felt very authentic. This may sound weird for a review about a Disney movie, but it was more... "kiddie", and innocent, than I thought it might be, I guess I expected it to skew a little darker. This was one of the WORST utilizations of 3D technology I think I have ever seen; there were buckets full of opportunities to make something fly at my face, and the movie squanders them all. But I can't say that I wasn't entertained.

film.filmname: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again (2018)
film.summary: In this sequel to Mamma Mia! Sophie learns about her mother's past while pregnant. (imdb)
film.quote: As I watched this, I only had to answer one question for myself: "is this lame?" I can buy in to the construct of the jukebox musical, so criticizing it for being that is your own fault if you're doing it. But within that construct and judged solely against its peers, is it lame? Honestly, it has its moments where it gets close. Ultimately the infectiousness wins out over the melodrama and the contrivances and the over-acting. Sprinkle mostly-white people with fairy dust, and here we go again.

film.summary: Morgan is about a corporate risk-management consultant who has to decide and determine whether or not to terminate an artificial being's life that was made in a laboratory environment. (imdb)
film.quote: "Morgan" builds its universe rather quickly, managing to hold interest despite precious little backstory and context. It does what most good Sci-Fi thrillers do, which is to present an investment-worthy hook ("What's going to happen to Morgan?"). Also, Paul Giamatti is life. It does definitely cross the line into pretty well straight-up action movie for awhile, and not to the story's benefit, I think ultimately failing where other similar movies have succeeded. Decent little twist at the end.

film.summary: A mysterious young woman named Hester Shaw joins forces with Anna Fang, a dangerous outlaw with a bounty on her head, and Tom Natsworthy, an outcast from London, to lead a rebellion against a giant predator city on wheels.
film.quote: I struggled with the idea of giving a Peter Jackson (ish) movie a mediocre score. But honestly, despite tepid expectations, I just didn't enjoy the movie enough to recommend that others should watch it. Visually stunning, and may even demand a 3D viewing if you're so inclined. But it took me altogether too long to get on board with the kinda-dystopic-but-not-really premise, and the material that I did enjoy, was too little and far between. Motivationally frustrating. Imaginative, but lacking.

film.summary: The time-travelling adventures of an advanced canine and his adopted son, as they endeavor to fix a time rift they created.
film.quote: This is pretty predictably enjoyable, especially for a young audience. The running gags and canine puns get a little thick eventually, but there's also some really funny moments to be found, and the animation is really solid. The movie's strongest segments are, of course, the time-travel segments, as a lot of the "real-world, Sherman-is-growing-up" stuff is nothing you haven't seen before (aside from the montage sequence, which was really good). And Robespierre getting tazed... still funny brah.

film.summary: Deep within a shadowy chamber in the British Museum of London, an ancient force of terror is about to be reborn. It is 1933, the Year of the Scorpion. Eight years have passed since dashing legionnaire Rick O'Connell (Fraser) and fearless Egyptologist Evelyn (Weisz) fought for their lives against a 3000-year-old enemy named Imhotep (Vosloo). (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Being the pro wrestling mark that I am, I was pumped at The Rock being in a movie. Even more pumped when he got his OWN. I don't like Fraser, I think he's too cutesy-poo for my taste and I feel like he has just packed in every performance I've ever seen him in. But I have a bit of a soft spot for the Mummy franchise.

film.summary: At his new high school, a rebellious teen (Faris) is lured into an underground fight club, where he finds a mentor in a mixed martial arts veteran (Hounsou). (imdb)
film.quote: This is the payoff for the fact that MMA has exploded in mainstream culture. When I saw it with Obby, the first thing that came to mind was "Dawson's Creek meets mixed-martial arts", and my opinion of it hasn't really improved. Hounsou plays a compelling character, though.

film.summary: An ex-CIA operative is brought back in on a very personal mission and finds himself pitted against his former pupil in a deadly game involving high level CIA officials and the Russian president-elect. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll give it a decent recommend. You can't go in hoping that this will re-write the book on the Criminal Action-Thriller, because it definitely won't. This is a veteran story told in a polished way, not outstanding but not severely lacking in any real way. There are some cliches and tropey moments but the plot is interesting & entertaining enough. The highest praise I can give to this movie is, "I wasn't bored". And honestly, those involved in this movie shouldn't hope for much better than that!

film.summary: Debbie Ocean gathers a crew to attempt an impossible heist at New York City's yearly Met Gala.
film.quote: You know I can't pretend that this wasn't at least a little bit fun. Like I did not fail to enjoy myself. Bullock and Blanchett playing off of each other was endearing and if anything, there should have been a lot more of that. I was down with Rihanna's character too, tropey as it is. But it's undeniable that this is missing the top-down chemistry and magnetism of the Eleven. It has some laughs and minor intrigue, but probably lacks any sense of risk or stakes. On pure entertainment, it's fine.

film.summary: In a world where people collect PokÃ©mon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective.
film.quote: If you remove Ryan Reynolds and the undeniable aesthetic he brings to whatever movie he (or his voice) is in, this is a relatively mediocre movie I think. It's simplistic storytelling at its core, helpful for kids but sometimes frustrating for the rest of the audience. Luckily, Reynolds plus an at-times-interesting whodunit are enough to make this an enjoyable watch. Needed 15% more funny, but I can't say I'm let down, per se. CGI was fine for me. Pikachu makes an unexpected Seinfeld reference.

film.summary: Set in 1954, a group of Florida high schoolers seek out to lose their virginity which leads them to seek revenge on a sleazy nightclub owner and his redneck sheriff brother for harassing them. (imdb)
film.quote: This is kind of a guilty pleasure. As much as I'd like to dislike it, it divides and conquers me into an abyss of cheap (but constant) laughs.

film.summary: Rambo must confront his past and unearth his ruthless combat skills to exact revenge in a final mission.
film.quote: Once the Rambo part of this Rambo movie starts, it's a pretty darn good time! The give-back is that takes roughly half the movie, maybe a little more. As a whole, this is a movie of just enough. There's just enough action to be exciting, just enough emotional content to be investing. The direction does just enough to keep interest in what you're seeing; the script, just enough to keep interest in what you're hearing. It is neither a great Stallone, nor a great Rambo. It is, however, just enough.

film.summary: When a cooped-up macaw named Blu leaves the confines of his birdcage behind for the tropical climes of Rio de Janeiro, he's forced to wing it and re-examine everything he knows about life -- and being a bird.
film.quote: It was cute, for sure. It did its job. Has a nice feel to it like most kids movies do, had some dread, good music, voice acting was superb. I mean what much can you say really, the whole thing is like one giant fetch-quest with an "I-can't-fly" sub-quest to overcome. It's formulaic but fun.

film.summary: The story of an archer in the army of Richard Coeur de Lion who fights against the Norman invaders and becomes the legendary hero known as Robin Hood.
film.quote: I have a few quips about Robin Hood. Firstly, they set up a potential sequel SOLELY on the fact that the King is a big jealousy-pants over the fact that the people love Robin instead of him after they beat the French. That bugged me. Also, King John is a total dick, to everybody, but it's never really explained *why* he is. He just is. He shows his cock to his own mother, for fuck's sake. Sydow was great. Overall, the movie was good, but kinda just... there. Not bad, but by no means sensational.

film.summary: A gritty take on the classic Robin Hood story. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not going to tell you that I thought this movie sucked, just so I can fall in line with most everybody else. I will say that I went INTO the movie THINKING it was going to be awful. Honestly though, this was *fine*. Inoffensive and very proud of being "different" from the classic story. A vehicle for a sequel that, as RealMacgyver points out, likely doesn't get made. Coated from top to bottom in wannabe grit, but I wasn't bored, and if that's the best I can say, that's at least something.

film.summary: In 2028 Detroit, when Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman) - a loving husband, father and good cop - is critically injured in the line of duty, the multinational conglomerate OmniCorp sees their chance for a part-man, part-robot police officer. (imdb)
film.quote: We can't accurately make a decision on this movie if we try to hold it up to the original. This is a re-imagining of RoboCop with only sparse elements brought over. This isn't a dystopic criminal cesspool, for instance, it's just Detroit, and the motivations for building RoboCop are completely different. Are they better or worse? Subjective. I like that there are multiple unanswered questions to lead to a sequel. Good for what it is: flash, arguably less substance, but entertaining nonetheless.

film.summary: Reluctantly retired from boxing and back from riches to rags, Rocky takes on a new protege who betrays him; As the champ&#039;s son must adjust to his family&#039;s new life after bankruptcy. (imdb)
film.quote: Loses its shine in comparison to the others, doesn't have an Apollo- or Drago- calibre character to fuel the conflict, but is still a really genuine and human film. For those who say that this movie was the biggest reason for "Rocky Balboa", you have very little comprehension of the idea of FALLING IN LOVE WITH A CHARACTER. Sly loves Rocky because he IS Rocky at the most fundamental levels. "Balboa" is as much about Rocky letting go of boxing and the past as it is about Sly letting go of Rocky.

film.summary: Perennial survivor Sidney Prescott, now a successful self-help author, returns to her home town of Woodsboro in the fourth act of director Wes Craven's Scream franchise. Sidney's homecoming, however, coincides with a slew of unsettling new murders.
film.quote: I think, had they not sort of crapped out on the Ghostface reveal and what happened from that point on, this would be a bit farther up the line. As it stands right now though, it doesn't quite hit the "Serviceable" mark. The meta-cognitive nature of the Scream franchise is so very lovely, don't get me wrong, and always makes for an entertaining watch - I was most definitely entertained but it wasn't to the next level. Like most others here, I give big props to Hayden Panettiere and Emma Roberts.

film.summary: After discovering a small, blue, fast hedgehog, a small-town police officer must help it defeat an evil genius who wants to do experiments on it.
film.quote: The kids will have a ton of fun with this one. I can't say that there's a ton of content here for anyone over the age of 13, aside from outright nostalgia for hardcore Sonic fans, and Jim Carrey diving fully back into his manic, The Mask and Liar Liar era roots. He is seriously good here. I think this ultimately works better as a setup for future movies than as its own individual movie, and I will be very much on-board with any future Sonic movies made by this team. They clutched it out!

film.summary: Audrey and Morgan are best friends who unwittingly become entangled in an international conspiracy when one of the women discovers the boyfriend who dumped her was actually a spy.
