film.quote: I laughed, and quite frankly that was really all that I needed from this movie. I had no delusions going into this that it was going to be some cinematic masterpiece. There are no stakes, nothing in the narrative particularly matters, and the performances are only adequate, but this isn't really a movie that needs high quality in those terms. It just needs to be funny. For the most part, this is funny, and Susanna Fogel, notable for not much up to now, succeeds here as both writer and director.

film.summary: On January 15, 2009, the world witnessed the "Miracle on the Hudson" when Captain "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) glided his disabled plane onto the frigid waters of the Hudson River, saving the lives of all 155 aboard. However, even as Sully was being heralded by the public and the media for his unprecedented feat of aviation skill, an investigation was unfolding that threatened to destroy his reputation and his career. (imdb)
film.quote: I will credit this movie for a few things: not being as jingoistic as "Flight", and I think giving cudos and props (if a little heavy-handedly) where they deserve to be given above and beyond the pilot(s). And I have to admit (like everyone else who watches this) to not knowing enough about the "true goings-on" to comment on whether they were portrayed melodramatically or not. And Hanks is his usual brilliant self. But this did feel over-dramatic and "Hollywoodized". It's not irredeemable.

film.summary: In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced from semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet agent within MI6's echelons. (imdb)
film.quote: Really, REALLY get the feeling that I missed something potentially special here. I feel like... I know what I saw... I just don't know WHAT I SAW, if that makes any sense. I can't lie, for much of the movie, I felt very lost, and that doesn't usually happen to me. It's a slow-to-develop, in some ways meandering movie, with performances that were good, but that I can't help but feel like I would have enjoyed much more had I been better able to follow the plot. A second viewing is necessary here.

film.summary: When Eddie Brock acquires the powers of a symbiote, he will have to release his alter-ego "Venom" to save his life.
film.quote: Who knew Venom was such a dork? Although I assume he's lying to get Eddie to trust him. Anyways, yeah, people are kinda off about this. It wasn't fundamental garbage. I like many went into this expecting it to be a tire fire, and as soon as it was over my first thought was "Okay, I get why people don't like this, I just don't agree with them". What I felt I got was something akin to a low-rent Deadpool in a Spider-Man movie without Spider-Man. But when tire fire is your expectation, that's good!

film.summary: Young lawyer Arthur Kipps travels to a remote village to organize a recently deceased client's papers, where he encounters the ghost of a scorned woman set on vengeance.
film.quote: I know it's supposed to be a horror movie, but there was a line that really made me chuckle; Kipps' son saying "That's what your face looks like" when asked why he drew a picture with him looking sad. Radcliffe plays tormented to a T. I was a little iffy on the movie's internal logic in parts, then again, it's a horror movie. Follows a rather simple script with a good-enough atmosphere in and around the house, but, not much we haven't seen before. Very well-done ending brings it up a notch.

film.summary: After the disappearance of her scientist father, three peculiar beings send Meg, her brother, and her friend to space in order to find him. (imdb)
film.quote: Different from the book. No twins. Mrs. W's not centaurs. Name of The Black Thing. Gender of Happy Medium. Whatsit's sacrifice. CENTRAL now a beach party for some reason. Large parts of the sequence of events during & after meeting IT. Individually and as a whole, I can't pretend that these changes bother me. I thought this was a fine little film that will work for its core audience. It looks very nice, but doesn't exactly jump off the screen as anything extraordinary. Deric McCabe is the MVP.

film.summary: Jean Grey begins to develop incredible powers that corrupt and turn her into a Dark Phoenix. Now the X-Men will have to decide if the life of a team member is worth more than all the people living in the world.
film.quote: I've criticized these movies before for being less-than-accommodating to those of us not steeped in the lore. These aliens (who we don't know and aren't told anything about) want this power (that we don't really know anything about that doesn't come from a not-interesting unreliable narrator) for reasons we aren't told. Sophie Turner stays great and God bless him, James McAvoy is trying. More than I can say for J-Law. There's some stuff to latch onto; I'm sorry for needing more than that.

film.summary: It is 1987 and Jenna is a 13-year-old girl on the brink of womanhood. The problem is that adulthood is just not arriving fast enough. She makes a wish on her birthday: If only she could be all grown up, she'd have the life she's always wanted. Miraculously, her wish comes true. (Columbia Pictures)
film.quote: Saw this because my friend demanded we rent it, so we did. She loved it, I thought it had its moments but was nothing to write home about.

film.summary: A drama set centered around the war between Russia and Georgia, and focused on an American journalist, his cameraman, and a Georgian native who become caught in the crossfire. (imdb)
film.quote: Very tightly-coiled first five minutes. From there, well... "I will dance for you" might be the most awkward line in cinema since "You're tearing me apart, Lisa!". The musical choices by and large feel like this movie doesn't know if it wants to be legit film or softcore porn when it grows up. The movie wasn't bad or anything, but it just seemed sort of... there were many things about the movie that seemed improbable or too convenient. I like some of the messages though. It's worth checking out.

film.summary: A crash landing leaves Kitai Raige and his father Cypher stranded on Earth, 1,000 years after events forced humanity's escape. With Cypher injured, Kitai must embark on a perilous journey to signal for help. (imdb)
film.quote: It was nice to see an M. Knight Shyamalan film where the twist was, there was no twist. Refreshing. I'm very forgiving to Sci-Fi as I've said many times before, but even if I wasn't, it was still a decent film. It looked very nice, but let's face it guys and gals, Jaden Smith would not have an acting career if Will Smith wasn't his father. He's a weak-ass lead here though Will Smith was alright. Kinda predictable, decent monster design, some stupidity... ultimately, not bad, but forgettable.

film.summary: An assassin hides out in Italy for one last assignment.
film.quote: Have to give it props for going old-school spy genre. Very cerebral, very deliberate. But in general, I found it to be TOO slow in its delivery (which is usually not a bad thing, but here, I unfortunately found myself to be bored). I didn't find Jack to be worthy of getting invested in. That was one of the bigger disconnects; it's a character-centric movie that couldn't get me to give a damn about the character. Felt like a Bond film without the intrigue of James Bond. Beautifully shot, though.

film.summary: Business tycoon and mayoral candidate Benjamin Stacks launches a campaign to take in Annie, a young girl who has been living with her mean foster mom Miss Hannigan since her parents left her as a baby. (imdb)
film.quote: This is what it is. If you're wondering about the rating, well, it does its job, not trying to be anything more than what it is: a mostly-fluffy kids movie with only hints of anything drearier than your average mid-afternoon Nickelodeon show. Believe it or not I actually thought the characters and performances were okay, because I understand that this is supposed to be corny and hammy and silly. It's cinematic "Kids Bop". Apparently not everybody got that. Take the kids, they'll probably dig it.

film.summary: When a corrupt businessman and the grotesque Penguin plot to take control of Gotham City, only Batman can stop them, while the Catwoman has her own agenda.
film.quote: Meh. Penguin shouldn't have been brought to the screen I don't think.

film.summary: Frank Dux has spent most his life being trained by Tanaka to participate in the Kumite, the ultimate martial arts tournament... (imdb)
film.quote: Serviceable action flick, great for those times when you just don't wanna think.

film.summary: Centered on a new CIA operative in the universe based on Robert Ludlum's novels. (imdb)
film.quote: I felt like the first 15-20 minutes really drug (no pun intended), but that's potentially my own fault as I'm not entrenched in the whole Bourne mythology. I'm sure it was more interesting to hardcore fans of the series. Let's just say the movie's intro is not very kind to "Bourne newbies". Indeed the pace barely increases through the flick's first hour. When the personal & political storylines finally intersect it gets better. The ending is very abrupt & not very well-done to me. It's passable.

film.summary: An undercover cop tries to take down a ruthless crime lord with access to a neutron bomb by infiltrating his gang. (imdb)
film.quote: ROBERT MAILLET! On the plus side, it's an easy movie to watch; they only REALLY want you to pay attention to the parkour when it slows down. At full speed the action is filmed so shakily, it's barely worth trying to pay attention to. The movie essentially lives and dies on interesting/funny/exciting moments, and it's not like they're not there. The movie only KINDA takes itself seriously, so there are some pretty alright moments. Not really enough to save it, though. See it if you're into it.

film.summary: Dwayne McLaren has been looking for a way out of his small town upbringing of Cut Bank, MT since he graduated high school several years earlier. When he finds himself in the wrong place at the right time, he jumps at a chance to pursue a better life in a bigger city with his girlfriend Cassandra. But luck doesn't exist in Cut Bank, and this perceived good fortune is quickly followed by a flood of bad karma. (imdb)
film.quote: Dern's and Stuhlbarg's characters are the only ones that I find to be worth investing in. Their back-and-forth dialogue is pretty great. I get this feeling that this WANTS to be something akin to "No Country For Old Men", but lacks many elements of that or similar movies. Does this make the movie bad? Not at all. It's got its own style, and an atmosphere all its own as well. Maybe it's played a little too cornball and the motivations may be wonky, but forgivably so. This is interesting at least.

film.summary: The defiant leader Moses rises up against the Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses, setting 600,000 slaves on a monumental journey of escape from Egypt and its terrifying cycle of deadly plagues. (imdb)
film.quote: The movie is far from perfect (it can't even see perfect), but at the same time it's so inoffensive that there's not much to take issue with. Vengeful "Old Testament" God is best God. I'd have liked to have seen more Ben Kingsley. I'd have liked to have been treated to a better script. I'd have liked to not have felt like there was a lot left on the cutting room floor, resulting in a sometimes-poor narrative flow. Bale is good enough to carry it, and the story and visuals are fine. It's okay.

film.summary: When a mysterious woman seduces Dom into the world of crime and a betrayal of those closest to him, the crew face trials that will test them as never before.
film.quote: It's a drop for me from Furious 7 which is the first of these that I can say I had fun with. But if the plan is to infuse these movies with like 10% more story each time, I'm down, because it's to their benefit. Charlize was a boss and a good villain. I can't tell you anything else you probably don't already know. It's dumber than 7, the action isn't as good as 7, there's not much script to speak of, it subscribes to all the worst elements of its predecessors, but is more entertaining than some.

film.summary: In Paris, a employee in the office of the US Ambassador hooks up with an American spy looking to stop a terrorist attack.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: When comedian George Simmons learns of his terminal health condition, his desire to form a genuine friendship cause him to take a green performer under his wing as his opening act.
film.quote: Like my review for "Orphan": a lot of well-executed material in the first half, but it's now painfully obvious that Hollywood can no longer negotiate an ending. This movie does, however, make a liar out of my review for "Click", where I state that Sandler is not a dramatic actor. He's not a GREAT one, but he actually had me sucked into his character. The "Dante/Randal" dynamic between Sandler/Rogan pales in comparison to Dante and Randal, but is still there and I appreciate it. Funny in spurts.

film.summary: An over-the-hill hitman faces off against a younger clone of himself.
film.quote: This was fine but unspectacular. Far from the worst thing on film this year -- and in a world where Replicas exists, not even the worst movie about cloning to come out this year -- but very much a throwback to a time when action movies just needed to have the good guy win at the end. Ang Lee is a great director but doesn't exactly haul this thing up Quality Mountain. But I'm also a Mary Elizabeth Winstead mark, so any time she's on screen, I am there for it. cagedwisdom nails it in his review.

film.summary: Following a ghost invasion of Manhattan, paranormal enthusiasts Erin Gilbert and Abby Yates, nuclear engineer Jillian Holtzmann, and subway worker Patty Tolan band together to stop the otherworldly threat. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a movie that I'm glad exists. I'm glad it spits in the face of the unreasonable hatred from adult virgins moaning about ruined childhoods, by actually being fun in spots, and never becoming BAD. There is totally an audience for this movie that is going to have a lot of fun with it, and if it translates into even a small percentage of this film's audience seeking out the original, I can't hate that. But it's a lot of so-called "relevant" comedy, which sometimes hits and sometimes misses.

film.summary: A teenager sets out to find her Wall Street father and is forced into the streets in a desperate journey of survival. Based on a true story.
film.quote: There's a lot of anger in the early movie that either doesn't make sense, or isn't explained well. Maybe this is how things really were, but from a "movie" perspective, it's a case of "there for the sake of being there" things with not a lot of explanation, when it doesn't take much effort to explain them. The whole flick reeks of perspective bias, which I guess is to be expected. Love me some JEJ & Rosario Dawson. Hudgens is hit-and-miss. Inoffensive, has its moments, but not the greatest.

film.summary: When four lifelong friends travel to New Orleans for the annual Essence Festival, sisterhoods are rekindled, wild sides are rediscovered, and there's enough dancing, drinking, brawling, and romancing to make the Big Easy blush.
film.quote: Let's be clear about what this movie is: it's made and marketed for a specific audience, but does its job in presenting a pretty watchable story for a wider audience despite being over two hours long. It isn't uproariously funny for the most part -- though as most have pointed out, Tiffany Haddish is the all-star -- nor is the drama particularly spellbinding. What it does do is mix the two well, with relatively few moments of inconsequential feelings. I can safely call this a pleasant surprise.

film.summary: Nick Carraway, a Midwesterner now living on Long Island, finds himself fascinated by the mysterious past and lavish lifestyle of his neighbor, Jay Gatsby. He is drawn into Gatsby's circle, becoming a witness to obsession and tragedy. (imdb)
film.quote: Baz Luhrmann almost fucked "The Great Gatsby". Get ready for over-the-top bullshit and shots lasting under 6 seconds. The story is familiar, having read the book, but the creative direction in the first half in utter shit. STOP PLAYING JAY-Z, IT'S FUCKING 1922! I like Maguire's Caraway; Leo's Gatsby however is hit-and-miss, as it's a victim of Baz's atrocious writing and direction. When the film takes a breath in the second half, the quality improves. Sure it's pretty. But it can get pretty bad.

film.filmname: The Haunting in Connecticut 2: Ghosts of Georgia (2013)
film.summary: A young family moves into an historic home in Georgia, only to learn they are not the house's only inhabitants. Soon they find themselves in the presence of a secret rising from underground and threatening to bring down anyone in its path. (imdb)
film.quote: As a "sister film", we shouldn't EXPECT much difference from the first flick (and to be fair, I have little recollection of the first, other than thinking it was jumpy but pedestrian). But y'know, this was pretty okay. I like this family more than I liked the first one's family. It's still kinda jump-scare dependent (though the jumps were better this go-round!), but it does a much better job of being creepy versus just jumpy, and it has a better story. Creepy woods trumps creepy house any day.

film.summary: When Ellen, the matriarch of the Graham family, passes away, her daughter's family begins to unravel cryptic and increasingly terrifying secrets about their ancestry. (imdb)
film.quote: I am rarely uncomfortable being far from the norm in my reaction to a movie. But I am here. This feels good, feels the way it probably should feel, and I'll never deride anything artistic for being different. But I've got to be honest, this just didn't work for me. It's very insistent on its tone, which is good, but then proceeds to shit itself with unrealistic, over the top reactions. I'm not a cynical viewer, I like much more often than dislike. But this made me laugh too much to unsettle me.

film.summary: A story about two women who trade homes for the holidays only to find that a change of address can change their lives.
film.quote: I'm not much on the ol' chick flicks, but I was pretty happy with this as far as romantic comedies go. Jack Black was probably about as good as he is capable of being. Where the flick falls to Earth is in its blatant predictability and the mindless evolution of the two romances. Jude Law is sexy, yes, but anybody could call that, and... I dunno, there was nothing all that special about it. When I rely on Jack Black to "save" a romantic comedy, something is wrong.

film.summary: A parasitic alien soul is injected into the body of Melanie Stryder. Instead of carrying out her race's mission of taking over the Earth, "Wanda" (as she comes to be called) forms a bond with her host and sets out to aid other free humans. (imdb)
film.quote: The inevitable Twilight comparisons, as I said my Beautiful Creatures review, all come out in this flick's favor. I absolutely adore Saoirse Ronan, and William Hurt's character Jeb is a fuckin' boss. I also generally enjoy this type of alien invasion flick vs. the "shoot, BANGBANGBANG" style. But the movie isn't without its problems - the male lead(s) are completely interchangeable, the romances feel forced (can be explained away as heat-of-the-moment, but still) and the dialogue is unbalanced.

film.summary: Twelve strangers wake up in a clearing. They don't know where they are, or how they got there. They don't know they've been chosen - for a very specific purpose - The Hunt. (imdb)
film.quote: The cinematic equivalent of the emo kid from high school that constantly babbles about how everybody is horrible in their own way. Betty Gilpin is pretty good but for the most part, the characters and groups are too weakly-defined to have any kind of bite on a satirical level. For the audience that knows what this is going for and is pre-disposed to like that messaging, it will work, and I was entertained on an over-the-top survival fantasy level, but I was far from politically impacted.

film.summary: As two evil sisters prepare to conquer the land; two renegades - Eric the Huntsman - who previously aided Snow White in defeating Ravenna, and his forbidden lover, Sara set out to stop them. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm glad to see other people pointing out the pretty misleading marketing involved in this movie; marketed as a prequel, but not. I didn't particularly have expectations going in, but I came away entertained enough. There's totally a market for this movie. The performances are kinda forced and the story is generic fantasy, but I mean... that's what fairy tales are, so, that's not a bummer to me. I wonder how much K-Stew got paid for her two seconds of last-movie-recap screen time? It was okay.

film.summary: Three different men, three different worlds, three different wars - all stand at the intersection of modern warfare - a murky world of fluid morality where all is not as it seems. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie is an answer to a question no-one asked. It markets itself as trying to humanize soldiers and how perilous the situation is. Which are things that I don't feel NEED to be done. I would much prefer something that takes a stand about whether we should be there AT ALL. This doesn't do that, nor does it really give the Afghan people a voice. I don't doubt Gross' work ethic. Just his vision. Frustratingly middle-ground morally, and I find it inferior in almost all ways to "Passchendaele".

film.summary: Two decades after the first Independence Day invasion, Earth is faced with a new extra-Solar threat. But will mankind's new space defenses be enough? (imdb)
film.quote: It felt very authentic to a sequel to a 90's movie. Scratch that: it just straight up felt like a 90's movie, with a 90's plot, 90's dialogue, but some better production values. Oh, and hardcore 90's jingoism. But that's to be expected. Note that I'm not using 90's as a CRITICISM per se, but it's the best descriptor I can come up with. This is fine. It's not great. But it's fine. It'll do the trick for most people. It cops out pretty hardcore but ultimately, it's all forgivable. And... yeah.

film.summary: The haunted Lambert family seeks to uncover the mysterious childhood secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world. (imdb)
film.quote: I honestly remembered very little from the first movie, so this felt like going into a new, but lived-in experience. And while I can't say that Insidious 2 is a *bad* movie... it also wasn't a *great* movie, and I didn't really consider it to be a *good* movie either. Horror fans and fans of the first one will undoubtedly dig it. Elise is a great character (and spawned wrestling chants in her honor), and it had some good scares and atmosphere, but silliness and bad acting hurts the experience.

film.summary: Beatrice Prior must confront her inner demons and continue her fight against a powerful alliance which threatens to tear her society apart with the help from others on her side. (imdb)
film.quote: The best things I can say about this are as follows. I think it's better than "Divergent", Woodley is better (still a shade melodramatic, but shades are better than eclipses), and I actually ended up caring about certain things this time. Teller is 100% pure bag of dicks, but he's convincing. Winslet is even better. However, and I'm not one to cry "predictability" very often, I found the climax to be VERY predictable in its message and its execution -- WITHOUT having read the source material.

film.summary: A group of high school students document the events and aftermath of a devastating tornado. (imdb)
film.quote: Wow, people really seemed to hate this. Interesting. On spectacle ALONE I would say this is worth seeing. Don't get me wrong, the characters and plot are super-wooden and straightforward. If the flick survives at all it survives sheerly on the pre-packaged idea of "this happens, then it escalates a bunch until it stops", as well as some fairly superficial & surface sentimentality. Also, this flick is loud. Almost obtrusively so. I've definitely seen worse, even this year. It worked okay for me.

film.summary: Jack Ryan, as a young covert CIA analyst, uncovers a Russian plot to crash the U.S. economy with a terrorist attack. (imdb)
film.quote: Here's the deal with me -- I like Chris Pine, I like Kenneth Branagh, and I have nothing against Kevin Costner except for, well, "Waterworld". I'm not the world's biggest Keira Knightley fan, but all in all, I like a lot of this movie's PARTS. It's the SUM of those parts that doesn't really work for me. I found this... tedious. I couldn't buy into the relationship between Jack and Cathy (who sports a laughable, Lois Lane style reaction to Jack being covert CIA). Inoffensive, but nothing special.

film.summary: After her outlaw husband returns home shot with eight bullets and barely alive, Jane reluctantly reaches out to an ex-lover who she hasn't seen in over ten years to help her defend her farm when the time comes that her husband's gang eventually tracks him down to finish the job. (imdb)
film.quote: It's an average movie, and maybe a bit above-average within the genre. Performances are fine, story is fine, cinematography is fine, score is fine, basically everything about this movie is fine. It also manages to avoid some kind of fatal flaw that would torpedo the ranking. It just doesn't reach in any significant way for anything more than "fine". Maybe the ending is a little convenient or clichÃ©d but I feel weird criticising over that anymore. It's a good time for most in the audience!

film.summary: A Marine travels to North Carolina after serving three tours in Iraq and searches for the unknown woman he believes was his good luck charm during the war. (imdb)
film.quote: At times, this movie very effectively tugs at heartstrings and makes pulses race. At other times, it's a painfully by-the-numbers copy-paste generic romance story that Nicholas Sparks turns out in his sleep I'm sure. It of course ultimately settles in the middle, a good-enough-for-what-it-is flick that's more for the lady-folk and specific Sparks fans. Some dialogue was horrible, but then there were moments and aspects in the movie that were very well-done. Liked Efron, tolerated Schilling.

film.summary: A girl in a small town forms an unlikely bond with a recently-paralyzed man she's taking care of. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll be honest: I tried my hardest to go in with as few expectations as possible. Tough in this day and age. But with an open mind, absolutely. I liked the chemistry between Clarke and Claflin for the most part, and the first half of this movie I actually can say that I quite enjoyed. For me however the second half becomes clunky, self-important, and cliche-ridden. Is it emotional? Sure. Is it predictable? I believe so. And I'm more comfortable calling this movie "not bad", rather than "good".

film.summary: Jason Statham stars as an experienced hit man who decides he's ready to retire his weapons once and for all -- after he finishes training eager young apprentice Steve McKenna (Ben Foster) in the ways of the professional kill. But the assassin's bosses are not pleased when they discover their man is giving away his trade secrets. Simon West directs and Donald Sutherland co-stars in this action-packed remake of the 1972 Charles Bronson thriller.
film.quote: I enjoy seeing Statham play a conflicted character. Clearly he's rolling along, not giving a fuck, until he has to kill his mentor, at which point he takes a predictable turn and questions what he does. It's fairly by the numbers. The SUV scene with the bus was pretty badass. I, among others, despised the ending, and just when Hollywood was fumbling along fairly well with their endings after the debacle that was 2009. Needs to be longer and wrap up more loose ends; there were plenty to be found.

film.summary: After escaping an attack by what he claims was by a 70-foot shark, Jonas Taylor must confront his fears to save those trapped in a sunken submersible.
film.quote: Yeah my PSI was pretty darn accurate here. This is the very definition of a popcorn flick. Knew that going in, feel that expectation was fulfilled without being expanded upon. I had a fine time. There's enough humour sprinkled throughout that even though it's almost two hours, it didn't strike me as overlong. The 3D was, surprisingly, not completely useless, like 3D normally is. And at least Ruby Rose didn't die. Also, I remember Page Kennedy from Vine. The good old days. Yeah this is fine.

film.summary: Max, a widow and recovering alcoholic, is a security guard who works in a boutique store, where the previous security guard suffered mental breakdown. Max soon begins to become haunted by visions of a girl in mirrors, and his co-workers begin to die gruesome deaths.
film.quote: A passable follow-up to what I thought was a very underrated first movie. The cast did what they had to do, didn't shine, but it was kind of cool to see the guy who played "Cheddar Bob" in 8 Mile make an appearance. The rape scene was quite tame compared to what we're becoming more and more used to in today's cinema, and like always, there had to be some token tits. I wasn't a fan of the kills; whoever did the SFX for this should be fired. Looked mid-90's; we're in 2010 guys, step your game up.

film.summary: An unlikely World War II platoon are tasked to rescue art masterpieces from Nazi thieves and return them to their owners. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty Hollywood, which is to be expected I guess. Love the cast, but a couple of them just played themselves; Clooney = Clooney, Murray = Murray, and in a movie that purports itself to be biographical, it seems to me that it would have been prudent to check the ego at the door and play the role, not play oneself. Be actors, not movie stars. I certainly didn't dislike it, it had its entertaining moments, but I do feel as though there was something more to be had here. Read the book instead.

film.summary: When his best friend is murdered by the shadowy Ozunu clan, Raizo (Rain), an orphan raised to be an assassin, vows revenge. But a government agent (Naomie Harris) is also trying to expose the gang, and now, the two must work together to bring the Okunu to justice. Time is running out as the clan's professional killers chase the pair across Europe.
film.quote: It's pretty shut-your-brain-off fun. It borders on less-flashy DBZ, Crouching Tiger-inspired fight scenes at times, but that's not all bad. It probably could have done without the absolute saturation of its trailer, which literally played before EVERY movie leading up to its release. It was entertainment, definite eye candy for the 16-30 male demo, and it does its job -- gratuitous ninja action, loose and linear plot, and even more gratuitous ninja action. Plus the dude's name is Rain. Ch'yea.

film.summary: An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes.
film.quote: Being a nervous flyer myself, this one wasn't a particularly-hotly-anticipated watch for me, but I like Liam Neeson a lot and I love Julianne Moore, and I'm always up for a good suspense/thriller/mystery. On that level the movie worked pretty well -- a solid mystery that I didn't get to the end of too quickly, and the performances were adequate (Neeson has his wonky moments as always; that's part of his charm). Unfortunately, the climax does not do justice to the build. Still worth watching.

film.summary: When his uptight CEO sister threatens to shut down his branch, the branch manager throws an epic Christmas party in order to land a big client and save the day, but the party gets way out of hand...
film.quote: Don't kid yourself into thinking this is more than your standard-issue "hip modern comedy", because let's be honest, it isn't, but, that doesn't mean that there isn't good to be found! The main trio of Bateman, Miller and Munn really propel the flick, and Aniston, quite frankly, is dynamite in a role like this. This premise sounds worse than the movie actually is. It has its moments of bad but it has its moments of really good too; I didn't die laughing, but I laughed. Could have been way worse.

film.summary: A group of friends must confront their most terrifying fears when they awaken the dark powers of an ancient spirit board. (imdb)
film.quote: I kinda dug this! Make no mistake, it's not a "good" movie, and there's a whole bunch of those silly, overused horror movie cliches, right down to "elderly ethnic lady who has the answers yet isn't sought out until 80 minutes in". But whether you want to admit it or not, this isn't all formula and no originality. The flick swerves you. It doesn't JUST depend on jump-scares. In the horror movie pantheon, this is a lot closer to "Blair Witch" than to "The Grudge". That's the best way I can say it.

film.summary: A spacecraft traveling to a distant colony planet and transporting thousands of people has a malfunction in its sleep chambers. As a result, two passengers are awakened 90 years early.
film.quote: There's some sexist shit going down here and it's really a bummer because this should have been so much better. I can explain a lot of the bad or questionable of this movie away and it becomes somewhat enjoyable, but I can only do that by coming at it from the perspective of Chris Pratt's character being a scumbag that isn't supposed to be a sympathetic character. But then the movie kind of tries to make him one, sorta. Stockholm Syndrome in space. Frustrating doesn't even begin to describe it.

film.summary: Peppermint is a revenge story centering on a young mother who finds herself with nothing to lose, and is now going to take from her enemies the very life they stole from her. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll say this to this movie's credit: when I first saw the trailer, my initial reaction was, "Jennifer Garner does action? She looks so out of place. I wonder what else Michelle Rodriguez was doing that she had to back out of this?" Because this trailer FELT like a Michelle Rodriguez movie with a Michelle Rodriguez character. But I felt that she was pretty believable, outside of a few moments where it just got stretched a little too far. This wasn't a waste of time. You could do worse than this.

film.summary: Louis Creed, his wife Rachel, and their two children Gage and Ellie move to a rural home where they are welcomed and enlightened about the eerie 'Pet Sematary' located nearby. After the tragedy of their cat being killed by a truck, Louis resorts to burying it in the mysterious pet cemetery, which is definitely not as it seems, as it proves to the Creeds that sometimes, dead is better.
film.quote: I thought this was mostly fine! Coming in with very few expectations, and with the full admission that I am a coward (which movies like this one with its tension and jump-scares inevitably bring to the fore), I found little to dislike here, but also little to really cling to as anything special. I guess that makes this forgettable? That feels too harsh. I don't think this does anything fundamentally wrong. Some stuff is under-explored. Could have been fantastic, but also could have sucked.

film.summary: Feature adaptation of Beatrix Potter's classic tale of a rebellious rabbit trying to sneak into a farmer's vegetable garden. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't know that I've ever experienced a movie that I would describe as "meta to the point of exhausting", but that's how I would describe this. It's good for a movie to know what it is, but this winked at you every 5 seconds. It just took me a bit by surprise. The movie was middling but mostly enjoyable, occasionally shockingly dark, and I bump it up a little bit because of the reaction it engendered from its core audience: every child in the theatre laughed and had fun. Mission accomplished.

film.summary: When his new album fails to sell records, pop/rap superstar conner4real goes into a major tailspin and watches his celebrity high life begin to collapse. He'll try anything to bounce back, anything except reuniting with his old rap group The Style Boyz. (imdb)
film.quote: I can't help it: I wanted this to be funnier. I laughed but, I wanted to laugh more. Satire doesn't have to be funny ALL the time, if it's also biting and relevant, but this feels like it's supposed to be laugh-dependant, and I just didn't laugh ENOUGH to REALLY like it. Maybe it needed more insulation? A funnier side cast? I don't know. But I like the Lonely Island guys, and if you like them, you'll probably like this movie well enough. Though that's admittedly a rather narrow path to cross.

film.summary: A group of elite warriors are hunted by members of a merciless alien race known as Predators.
film.quote: Ultimately, a very pretty-looking B-movie. It's so hard to get past the fact that Adrien Brody's nose is 90% of his face. An ensemble which was mostly-boring (a few exceptions, like Trejo) accented by a totally-unnecessary showing by Laurence Fishburne. Now I love the 'burne, but really, he was not necessary at all. I was fairly happy with the soundtrack and the overall ambiance and mood of the flick, it did get over as quite dreary and hopeless. But it was by no means redeeming. Not even close.

film.summary: A priest disobeys church law to track down the vampires who kidnapped his niece. (imdb)
film.quote: I was a pretty big fan of the opening animated sequence, but from that point on the mythology (and logic) was mostly there for show. I won't say I hated or even disliked the movie, because I didn't, I liked it for what it was. But it neither reached my admittedly-lofty expectations, nor did it provide me with an acceptable degree of entertainment below said expectations. It was worth seeing, don't get me wrong. But I wouldn't call this flick an achievement by any means. I did like Karl Urban.

film.summary: A crew of African American pilots in the Tuskegee training program, having faced segregation while kept mostly on the ground during World War II, are called into duty under the guidance of Col. A.J. Bullard. (imdb)
film.quote: I was extremely hyped for this movie when it was released. The CGI is good enough for what it needs to be, and there are some okay sub-plots thrown at you. The dogfighting is good as others have mentioned. In places, the acting leaves something to be desired; in other places, it leaves a LOT to be desired. I feel like this was a Spike Lee movie; the dialogue from a lot of the English-speaking white characters is stiff and robotic, and I feel that was intentional. In any case, an alright flick.

film.summary: Follows the epic Biblical story of the Resurrection, as told through the eyes of a non-believer. Clavius, a powerful Roman Military Tribune, and his aide, Lucius, are tasked with solving the mystery of what happened to Jesus in the weeks following the crucifixion, in order to disprove the rumors of a risen Messiah and prevent an uprising in Jerusalem. (imdb)
film.quote: If asked to choose a premise for a religious film to watch, I'll take a premise like this one over the more generic offerings. While there wasn't much about this that was outstanding or particularly memorable outside of the occasional production design (marred by the occasional awful visual effect... looking at you, fire guy), it told an interesting story in a fresh new way and was at least competent in trying to achieve what it wanted to achieve. You could certainly do a lot worse this weekend!

film.summary: Pot growers Ben and Chon face off against the Mexican drug cartel who kidnapped their shared girlfriend. (imdb)
film.quote: While I loved the two male leads, I couldn't get into O, whether due to character traits (thought she came across as obnoxious) or Lively's portrayal (never had a sense of dread from her over her capture save a line or two). The "wargasms" line was so silly. Not sure how I feel about the cocktease ending. So much love for del Toro, the best Hayek since "Frida", and the best mainstream Stone flick since "Nixon". Many details felt unresolved/tacked on. But see it if you like drugs, sex & violence.

film.summary: What kinds of adventures do pets get up to when their owners are away? This movie tells us. When Max's happy life as a favorite dog is disrupted by the addition of Duke, the two end up lost in New York City, meeting other animals and fighting their way home.
film.quote: Criticker's probable score was dead-on. This is a cute little movie, completely inoffensive, while at the same time managing to not be boring or lifeless. The voice acting is good, and the animation is fluid and beautiful. I think Illumination was dedicated to showing off their water tech in this; these animals spend so much time in and under water, it's gotta be intentional. Don't go in hoping for a "Big Hero 6" degree of adult-worthy material, but it's a good night out for the family for sure!

film.summary: An extremely wealthy man, dying from cancer, undergoes a radical medical procedure that transfers his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man. But all is not as it seems when he starts to uncover the mystery of the body's origin and the organization that will kill to protect its cause. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not going to pretend I didn't like this, because I did. I'm also not going to pretend that this wasn't a wasted opportunity, because it was. It's a really strong sci-fi premise that doesn't get the execution it deserves. I like Kingsley and I like Reynolds, but they don't grab this thing and force it to be something remarkable. And I dislike the fact that either the studio cut Singh's nuts off visually or Singh toned himself down. No bueno either way. It's competent without being noteworthy.

film.summary: In the taut thriller The Shallows, when Nancy (Blake Lively) is surfing on a secluded beach, she finds herself on the feeding ground of a great white shark. Though she is stranded only 200 yards from shore, survival proves to be the ultimate test of wills, requiring all of Nancy's ingenuity, resourcefulness, and fortitude. (imdb)
film.quote: I think there's a lot that this movie does rather well. It nails the atmosphere and the dread. Blake definitely looks the part, but I'm starting to get the feeling that she's a mediocre actress. There's some emotional content there but a lot of it is just tossed at you without much of any thoughtfulness. Sadly I felt the movie gives in to ridiculousness, and many scenes with the shark itself devolve from intimidating tension, to just silliness. But Steven Seagull gives a powerhouse performance.

film.summary: Set in a futuristic world where humans live in isolation and interact through surrogate robots, a cop (Willis) is forced to leave his home for the first time in years in order to investigate the murders of others' surrogates.
film.quote: While the depth of this flick barely nips at your ankles, I thought it worked for what it was. It takes a certain (minor!) view on the direction of technology and explores its surface, but I find myself mostly a fatalist with this flick - I knew what was going to happen, basically from the outset, and I'd resigned myself to it. The twist was quite cool, you could probably see it coming but it eluded me and so it popped for that, I was engrossed in Brucey's mystique, but that can only go so far.

film.summary: Still single and increasingly attuned to the cacophony of her biological clock, 40-something Kassie (Jennifer Aniston) decides that if she can't find a mate she'll still pursue motherhood with the help of a sperm sample that's not quite as anonymous as she thinks. As the baby grows up, Kassie's best friend, Wally (Jason Bateman), agonizes over whether to reveal that he secretly replaced the donor sample with his own DNA.
film.quote: I mean, it is what it is. It's a rom-com and a sitcom rolled into one, and it's not as if I got nothing out of it. I laughed, heartily in places, I thought the performances were adequate to good, Thomas Robinson (the kid) was VERY funny, almost all of his lines were golden. And Jeff Goldblum lays down yet another very solid comedic performance. It's not at all my kind of movie - truthfully, I wouldn't have seen it had my friend not badly wanted to - but I can't say I walked away empty-handed.

film.summary: Anna Kendrick is reteaming with her Rocket Science director Jeffrey Blitz for the comedy Table 19, about a group of strangers who are marooned at the misfits table at a destination wedding. (Deadline)
film.quote: This is probably one of my all-time least-defensible ratings. This is not a good movie. I guess I can't bring myself to hate an Anna Kendrick movie - I can't hate any of the Pitch Perfect's and I can't outright hate this. It isn't all bad, either! The dynamic between Kudrow and Robinson offers some laughter. Kendrick is her usual awesome self. Ultimately, it's a movie of scattered moments resulting in an incomplete whole, but in saying that, there are things here to like. You could do worse.

film.filmname: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
film.summary: #1 NASCAR driver Ricky Bobby stays atop the heap thanks to a pact with his best friend and teammate, Cal Naughton, Jr. But when a French Formula One driver, makes his way up the ladder, Ricky Bobby's talent and devotion are put to the test.
film.quote: Moderately saved by the fact that I'm a NASCAR fan and therefore get some of the inside jokes.

film.summary: After Skynet has destroyed much of humanity in a nuclear holocaust, a group of survivors led by John Connor struggles to keep the machines from finishing the job.
film.quote: Happily, the trailer has music, and isn't entirely live audio from the movie, because if it was, nobody would know what was going on. I will preface this by saying, I like loud, but T:S is obnoxiously loud; loud to the point that it detracts from the film itself. Ahhnold's CGI-ness was enough to make me mark out a little, was probably the apex of the flick from an excitement standpoint, just seeing him. It bothered me that, by the end, nothing had changed. You think they blew up Skynet? SYKE!

film.summary: This thriller recounts the true story of five teenage travelers stranded in a rural Texas town, fighting for their lives against a chainsaw wielding madman and his bizarre extended family. (New Line Productions)
film.quote: Did its job, gory special effect-laden tripe that it was.

film.summary: There's something about Mary that still bewitches Ted. Although he hasn't seen her in over a dozen years, since that shameful prom night, his heart still flutters at the recollection of her. He's still crazy about her after all these years, and curious as to her whereabouts. At the insistence of his good friend Dom, he hires private eye Pat Healy to track her down in Miami.
film.quote: Given more credit than it rightly deserves in my eyes.

film.summary: Two top CIA operatives wage an epic battle against one another after they discover they are dating the same woman. (imdb)
film.quote: It was pretty much what I expected - a generic rom-com in the guise of an action-comedy, with a fundamentally-interesting premise. While it had the trademark one-liners and jokes that come with the genre, and what was a very solid comedic performance by Pine and a good performance by Tom Hardy (not to mention excellent interplay between the two of them), I dunno... it still just felt kind of average to me. It lacks any real suspense within any of the action beats. Nothing special, but not bad.

film.summary: Underworld reimagines Vampires as a secretive clan of modern aristocratic sophisticates whose mortal enemies are the Lycans (werewolves), a shrewd gang of street thugs who prowl the city&#039;s underbelly. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: Nothing memorable about this flick.

film.summary: When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrioress Selene leads the battle against humankind. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a cool idea to take the series somewhat away from vampires versus lycans and turn it instead towards the battle of both against humanity once they are discovered. At least on the surface (DUN DUN DUN!). I was really digging it, it gives you the action you want, it has a storyline you can work with even if you're not a big connoisseur of the series, the CGI is forgivably crummy in places but it has characters that I feel are worthy of empathy. A bit quick & a bit short but worth your time.

film.summary: Prince Seretse Khama of Botswana causes an international stir when he marries a white woman from London in the late 1940s. (imdb)
film.quote: The early part of the film suffers in two ways: the screenplay feels weak, and the narrative feels too rushed; nothing is given any time to breathe, especially the romance. Once it moved to Botswana, finally there is some patience shown in the storytelling. Oyelowo's impassioned performance propels the story while Rosamund Pike is mostly just kinda there. Most white people are stereotypical scumbags, but this is probably both intentional and accurate. Won't blow you away but it's an okay watch.

film.summary: A single mother finds that things in her family's life go very wrong after her two young children visit their grandparents. (imdb)
film.quote: Among the most frustrating movies of the year, for good reasons. I really don't know if this is good or bad. Sadly I had the twist ruined for me via social media (though admittedly, even if it hadn't been, I may have gotten to it before the movie does while watching; plenty of signs without being out-and-out predictable). It doesn't strum that metacognitive-horror-comedy tune like "Cabin in the Woods" does, but, it was sufficiently funny and scary in parts to pass the time. Not great, not awful.

film.summary: The journey of legendary football coach Bob Ladouceur, who took the De La Salle High School Spartans from obscurity to a 151-game winning streak that shattered all records for any American sport. (imdb)
film.quote: Sure it's pretty by-the-numbers and isn't going to set the world on fire from ANY standpoint (as a sports movie, Christian drama, inspirational story, etc.), but I find it hard to hate this. It certainly wasn't the best acting job I've ever seen, from anybody really -- even though I do think Caviezel's portrayal of Ladoucer was fairly accurate (if not long-winded). There's flaws and there's stuff not to like, but I went along for the ride rather comfortably, and I think most others will as well.

film.summary: Socially inept and saddled with a miserable job, Willard shares a powerful bond with the rats who dwell in his basement. When Willard&#039;s world is turned upside down by tragedy, those responsible must answer to his rapidly growing pack of ravenous, fearsome friends. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: A sociologist's dream.

film.summary: An epic adventure about a global cataclysm that brings an end to the world and tells of the heroic struggle of the survivors.
film.quote: I won't totally shit on it - because I fear that if I do, John Cusack won't save us - but like most other cliche-driven disaster flicks, it's very hard to take it seriously, even as art. It's a spectacle piece, and Emmerich should be commended for the grand scale he achieved. And for casting Woody in a borderline-perfect role. It had decent pacing, and I think the scenes in the Antonov aircraft were some of the film's best non-disaster-scenario scenes. But ultimately, it's a forgettable movie.

film.summary: Marine biologist Henry Roth finds the perfect woman, Lucy Whitmore and falls head over heels for her. But when he sees her the following day, she hasn't a clue as to who is he due to a rare brain disorder that wipes her memory clean every night. Now, with the help of his friend Ula, Henry has to concoct new and increasingly clever ways to meet her and get her to fall for him every day.
film.quote: Typical Sandler comedy, filled with references to his other films, but there's a certain charm to this film that saves it.

film.summary: Batman, Robin and new crime fighting comrade Batgirl face Gotham City's deadliest threat yet when cold-hearted Mr. Freeze and venomous Poison Ivy team for some lethal mischief. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Never liked Chris O'Donnell, and Poison Ivy is a shitty villain. Sadly, Arnold held it together.

film.summary: February 12 is just another day in Sam's charmed life until it turns out to be her last. Stuck reliving her last day over one inexplicable week, Sam untangles the mystery around her death and discovers everything she's in danger of losing. (imdb)
film.quote: "Groundhog Day" starring impossibly-pretty-but-cartoonishly-horrible high school girls learning lessons they were probably old enough to already know, that's sure to work for its target audience. That sounds a little too harsh; I definitely didn't hate this. But the over-the-top nature of just how sociopathic these girls are definitely leaned on me for the whole watch. That could be a performance thing, a writing thing, or both. Definite weaknesses in the screenplay. Not a waste of time, though.

film.summary: Wesley Snipes returns as the iconic vampire hunter Blade in this third installment of the hit film series. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: Pretty forgettable, I agree, BUT, it had Triple H in it.

film.summary: A spaceship arrives in Arizona, 1873, to take over the Earth, starting with the Wild West region. A posse of cowboys are all that stand in their way. (imdb)
film.quote: It's got the right idea - it's ambitious and takes chances. It's a solid concept. I just didn't think the execution was all that great. It built up a decent-enough atmosphere of "oh my God, I don't remember who I am, but some shit has clearly gone down and I need to get to the bottom of it", and the sci-fi budget for the second half of the movie is utilized quite effectively (I really have no qualms with the how the movie was shot or the CGI and special effects). I dunno. Just didn't hit for me.

film.summary: In a last-ditch effort to stop a diabolical plot, a dead CIA operative's memories, secrets, and skills are implanted into a death-row inmate in hopes the he will complete the operative's mission. (imdb)
film.quote: Like undercooked pasta, this movie doesn't particularly know what it wants to be. Outside of a few scenes it's probably a complete waste of the talent that's in it, except for Gary Oldman, who is a convincingly-complete asshole. This is capable of keeping your interest via the ticking clock and emotional undertones, but it doesn't take that next step into being anything noteworthy. The Sci-Fi is under-explored, the action leaves much to be desired, and the storyline is half-baked. Safe to skip.

film.summary: Beatrice Prior, a teenager with a special mind, finds her life threatened when an authoritarian leader seeks to exterminate her kind in her effort to seize control of their divided society. (imdb)
film.quote: While I knew virtually nothing going in aside from what the trailer showed me (haven't read the books), my general idea of the world was mostly met. But I couldn't get past what I felt were overtly-melodramatic performances, the most egregious of which was Woodley's (though she wasn't the worst). I was never destined to love this, but unfortunately it didn't ever push past a level of general malaise from me; I didn't really end up caring about anybody or anything I saw. Winslet was good, though.

film.summary: Linda Sinclair (Julianne Moore) is a forty-year-old unmarried high school English teacher in the small town of Kingston, Pennsylvania. She shares a small apartment with two Siamese cats and her rich collection of great literature. She maintains no close personal relationships aside from those she has with her favorite authors and stories. Her life is far less complicated than the dramas she devours on the page, and she likes it that way. (imdb)
film.quote: An interesting little laugh-heavy dramedy with a goofy tone that then goes to some dark-ish places, while mostly maintaining the lighter feel. It doesn't try to be ambiguous or go over your head. I loved the "In the words of David Mamet, 'FUCK YOU'!" line. The omniscient narrator serves as a fun little quirk. Sure (mostly) everything wraps up in a neat little package at the end but hey, that doesn't automatically translate to "bad". It's a three-act fairy tale people! Not the best, but it works.

film.summary: A beautiful young woman maintains relationships with three very different men. (imdb)
film.quote: This is not a bad movie. My rating may not reflect that, but trust me when I say this is not a bad movie. I think this is a movie that is lost in time and place. I felt that this offered me too little in terms of material, things, characters, and situations in which I could invest. Maybe that's due to the age of the source material, I don't know. I can appreciate the historical context, and can appreciate that this movie is well made. Unfortunately, it did not connect with me personally.

film.summary: Agent Hobbs enlists the aid of Dom and team to help bring a rival gang, led by Owen Shaw, to justice. In exchange for clear records, they must put an end to their schemes, no matter how personal the cost. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a sizable improvement from the last flick, given that this flick had a pretty good villain that created a sense of dread and doubt, the performances and emotional content & evocations improved (even though at times, Walker & Diesel have the emotional range of tree stumps), and the action felt worthwhile (except for the obnoxiously-long runway scene, which... how fucking long can a runway be?). But there was some token bullshit, and come on... it's a two-hour souped-up car commercial.

film.summary: The Coast Guard makes a daring rescue attempt off the coast of Cape Cod after a pair of oil tankers are destroyed during a blizzard in 1952.
film.quote: Inoffensive is the perfect word for this movie. It's not great, by any stretch, though I do think it's directed well, and the cast is... fine, I guess? It's also not bad by any stretch. It's just... I dunno, it leaves you with nothing after the fact. You feel for the characters in the moment but immediately after the movie you forget about 98% of them. This is not a movie that is likely to make any kind of indent on you at all. It's just there, and it's fine for the time it takes to watch it.

film.summary: An edgy Shakespeare adaptation like no other, this animated musical transports the classic tale of forbidden romance between two star-crossed lovers from warring families to the unlikely yet hysterical world of garden gnomes.
film.quote: I mean, you can only take a modern re-telling of Romeo & Juliet from the perspective of gnomes so seriously, and suspend your disbelief to such a degree before you just can't be bothered anymore. It's not a bad movie by any means, it's a cute kids/family movie and on that level it does what it sets out to do. I do certainly recommend seeing it if you have kids or are in the mood for something cute. Maybe being forced to watch it over and over at work ruined it for me. You can probably skip it.

film.summary: A college student relives the day of her murder with both its unexceptional details and terrifying end until she discovers her killer's identity.
film.quote: Hollywood has yet to learn that the sociopathic mean girls trope isn't funny or interesting anymore. Or at least this writer/director duo hasn't. This wasn't as bad as I expected it to be but it's far from any kind of accomplishment. We've already had a "Groundhog Day" style movie with horrible teen girls learning lessons this year in "Before I Fall", and while this may be marginally better, its attempts at cheap self-awareness and shoehorned comedy don't do it any favors. Scares are infrequent.

film.summary: A glowing orb terrorizes a young girl with a collection of stories of dark fantasy, eroticism and horror (imdb)
film.quote: Wicked score, probably a stupid premise for a flick, but, scores points for the sex and the fact it was created in Canada.

film.summary: A Nebraska teen gets more than she bargained for when she sets out for the bright lights of Las Vegas.
film.quote: Luli's parents are rip-roaring drunks, she threatens investment bankers wearing rainbow panties and wielding a .45, and there's this creepy vibe that rolls like wind through the grass. All that is inside the first 15 minutes. The conversations are sooo creepy in the early part of the movie, but they lend the movie a certain... uncomfortable nature which is kind of engaging. And then, there's the implied rape scene. Yeah. It's a pretty bad movie, but it's intriguing. The ending sucks, though.

film.summary: When Earth is taken over by the overly confident Boov, an alien race in search of a new place to call home, all humans are promptly relocated while all Boov get busy reorganizing the planet. But when one resourceful girl, Tip, manages to avoid capture, she finds herself the accidental accomplice of a banished Boov named Oh. The two fugitives realize there's a lot more at stake than intergalactic relations as they embark on the road trip of a lifetime. (imdb)
film.quote: In addition to ridiculously-high standards for comic book movies, we also have ridiculously-high standards for kids movies in 2015. And for me, as an adult, this didn't get it done quite enough. Don't get me wrong, this is nowhere near a bad movie, and the kids will eat it up. The animation is spectacular and I think, had this movie come out pre-Wall-E, it would be pretty well-thought-of. The final ten minutes are great but you gotta GET there first, and too little worthwhile happens beforehand.

film.summary: When her cop father is killed, a young woman tracks the murder with the apparent help of his ex-partner. (imdb)
film.quote: It's stylish, I'll say that. Given the source material, it's probably a case of style over substance. Sawa's outfits end up somewhere between sexy and goofy. The most obvious comparison to make here is to "Sucker Punch". While I did not love the main character, the visuals, the soundtrack, the story OR the style presented here nearly as much as I did with "Sucker Punch", I can still mostly appreciate what it's TRYING to do. The action is not great, though. I'm too soft on trashy genre flicks.

film.summary: A group of medical students discover a way to bring dead patients back to life. (imdb)
film.quote: Cursory of course, but I love Olivia Wilde, so you have to consider the source. I also dig Jason Blum movies; I've liked more than I've disliked. I love the atmosphere in these movies. I do have to admit that the movie would almost have been better off if it had stayed about a dog with crazy psychokinetic powers terrorizing the city. But so far as I'm concerned, this is far from bad. It's at least interesting, there's some intrigue in what's going on. There's better, but there's much worse too.

film.summary: Annabel and Lucas are faced with the challenge of raising his young nieces that were left alone in the forest for 5 years.... but how alone were they? (imdb)
film.quote: Y'know we're going along at a not un-enjoyable clip, I mean it's alright, the first two-thirds of the flick is pretty solid, not setting the world on fire but certainly not the worst horror I've seen... and then... wait... wait, why? WHY??? WHAT THE FUCK??? WHY DOES SHE HAVE TO DIE??? WHAT THE FUCK, HOW DID HE SURVIVE THAT??? WHAT THE SWEET FUCK IS GOING ON??? Yeah, it's beautiful and the fairy tale aspect is cool, but holy fuck what the fuck is up with that ending?! Torpedoes a real good flick.

film.summary: A poignant look at the many ways that the internet has changed the relationships between teenagers and their parents. (TIFF)
film.quote: I have a notorious dislike for Sandler movies. Outside of "Happy Gilmour" & "Punch-Drunk Love", he's useless to me. This immediately reeks of the worst stereotypes. Depressing that Jenn Garner & J.K. Simmons would put their names on it. It wants to be a dramedy, but the silly narrator didn't work for me, nor the emo juxtaposition between humanity & Carl Sagan. Overall it's too insincere to pass on a worthwhile message, despite there being a worthwhile message TO pass on. More kids, less adults.

film.summary: The Ghost Dimension, follows a new family, The Fleeges - father Ryan, mother Emily and their young daughter Leila - Who move into a house and discover a video camera and a box of tapes in the garage. When they look through the camera's lens, they begin to see the paranormal activity happening around them - including the re-emergence of young Kristi and Katie. (imdb)
film.quote: OH SHIT FIRST REVIEW! The people are counting on me. This review sets the tone; it helps the good folks considering seeing this movie to make an informed, balanced decision, based on my biased opinion, but it's in that symbiotic relationship where the truest beauty lies in the film community. I'm opining on this because there isn't a ton to talk about in this movie. Is it bad? Not to me. But it's certainly not good. It answers what the fuck this has all been for. But the answer is... kinda limp.

film.summary: After being "marked," Jesse begins to be pursued by mysterious forces while his family and friends try to save him. (imdb)
film.quote: Okay so, we sacrifice the suburban white neighborhood for a latino one, with a whole new cast of characters. While I really wasn't a fan of PA4, I have to say that this one was a slight improvement. There's still plenty of shitty teenage dialogue to be found, but the scares still worked, the camera gimmick was at least mostly fresher than it has been the last two movies, and you actually become sympathetic to the characters instead of not caring. Too many false finishes. See it if you're a fan.

film.summary: An FBI agent goes undercover to catch a gang of bank robbers who may be surfers. (imdb)
film.quote: Keanu Reeves?

film.summary: When a young boy accidentally triggers the universe's most lethal hunters' return to Earth, only a ragtag crew of ex-soldiers and a disgruntled science teacher can prevent the end of the human race.
film.quote: Equally-fun to mock as it is to watch, I can't say that "The Predator" fails to entertain! Like I had a good time with this; granted, I had to create a good chunk of that myself (in an empty theatre, before anybody gets all uppity). This is not what I would classify as a "good" movie, but it is one that's worth taking a look at, if for nothing else, the 90's feel coupled with the badass vision of the future of the Predator character. Unanswered questions sure, but that's what sequel machines do.

film.summary: Set in the near future when artificial organs can be bought on credit, it revolves around a man who struggles to make the payments on a heart he has purchased. He must therefore go on the run before said ticker is repossessed.
film.quote: It's a pass. Had some cool scenes, I actually didn't see the twist coming (but again, there's stuff in the flick that leaves subtle hints about it), but some stuff in there is just roll-your-eyes flimsy. You can tell, once the stylistic tone of the film takes a sharp turn, that they were shooting for self-indulgence and that's it. Law and Whitaker did their jobs well enough, not like they had to be Brando but they did enough and I bought into their dynamic. Not every movie needs to be realistic.

film.summary: When a poor college student who cracks an online poker game goes bust, he arranges a face-to-face with the man he thinks cheated him, a sly offshore entrepreneur. (imdb)
film.quote: There are things in this movie that I really appreciate, like the two male leads who I both like, and I'm a poker fan so that's some surface appreciation right there, not to mention the fact that the story felt lived-in and familiar due to the similar nature between it and the movie "21" which I enjoyed. But let's face it folks, this movie wasn't the greatest. The ultimate conflict resolution was way too convenient, alongside a plethora of unresolved plot points. It gets an uncomfortable pass.

film.summary: FBI Hostage Rescue Team leader and U.S. war veteran Will Sawyer, who now assesses security for skyscrapers. On assignment in Hong Kong he finds the tallest, safest building in the world suddenly ablaze, and he's been framed for it.
film.quote: Almost painfully average. I understand the messaging of "family motivation can make a person do incredible things", and I'm not dumping on it, BUT, you can do that same message in more interesting terms. I'll give the movie credit for casting Neve Campbell (44) to be The Rock's (46) wife -- an age-appropriate, beautiful woman -- rather than the less-realistic, gorgeous 20-something that typically inhabits these roles. That was oddly refreshing; about the only thing in this movie that was so.

film.summary: A young man raised by scientists on Mars returns to Earth to find his father. (imdb)
film.quote: Do I call this movie good? I don't think I can. Do I call this movie bad? I don't think that's quite fair, either. I liked Gary Oldman and his overacting. I liked Britt Robertson and her Britt Robertson-ness (seriously, she's the cutest), and Asa Butterfield is a good performer. The screenplay and story are not good, and hurt an interesting premise by playing it very, very safe. The stakes feel superficial, but it's shot fairly well and will probably work well enough for its target audience.

film.summary: A young cop must save the passengers of a bus that has a bomb set to explode if the bus goes below 50 MPH (imdb)
film.quote: Had some suspense, had action, had drama, just in small doses.

film.summary: Two people attempt to get into a relationship, while exiting the multiple relationships they were each managing through their Blackberries before they met. (imdb)
film.quote: At least Erin had the courtesy to text her fiance whom she was abandoning at the altar to say sorry! Anyways. Dialogue was up and down - the scenes in the grocery store and coffee shop were well-crafted, but there were face-slappingly bad lines too, trying way too hard to be quirky, resulting in... shit. Finally, and this'll sound stupid with a movie called "Textuality"... too much cellphone play. Like a 90-minute BlackBerry commercial featuring indiscriminate sex. Ultimately, it's just there.

film.summary: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge and his kids against prejudice. (imdb)
film.quote: Did not live up to the book. But they very rarely do. On a seperate note, even if this film could have been done in color, it only works in b&w.

film.summary: An automobile mechanic and his daughter make a discovery that brings down the Autobots - and a paranoid government official - on them. (imdb)
film.quote: Despite its many, many flaws, parts of the movie are entertaining ENOUGH. Folks, it's the fourth movie; we all know this formula by now. My advice to you if you hated the character development, inter-relationships, writing, etc. is to stop watching Transformers movies for those things. There's too little fighting & Dinobots, too much human element, weak storytelling, average performances, everything you read is true. But rumors of this being the worst movie of the year are greatly exaggerated.

film.summary: Frank Martin is the most highly-skilled transporter money can buy. The stakes are greater and technology better, but the same three simple rules apply: never change the deal, no names and never open the package. When Frank is hired by cunning femme fatale Anna and her three stunning sidekicks, he quickly discovers he's been played. (imdb)
film.quote: This is... not UN-entertaining, but, not exactly anything special, either. The change from Jason Statham to "younger Jason Statham" is not to the franchise's benefit. Points for some relatively-innovative fight scenes and a plot that is at least somewhat interesting, even if hackneyed and cobbled-together. I also dig the fact that every time the antagonist shows up, BOOM, there's booty. This is not disappointing if you have no expectations; if you're really psyched for this... prepare yourself.

film.summary: Vampire death dealer, Selene fights to end the eternal war between the Lycan clan and the Vampire faction that betrayed her. (imdb)
film.quote: Am I an idiot for not hating this? I fear I might be because really, I didn't hate this. Don't be deluded, this isn't a GOOD movie. By objective narrative standards it's probably pretty dumb. And there's stuff that doesn't add up. And it's kinda just the same old song-and-dance from previous movies. At the very least it opened with a retelling of the key points from the series up to this point; excellent for the casual viewer like me. I just shut my brain off and it worked well enough for me.

film.summary: It's a nail-biting race against time as an unmanned train carrying a load of lethal chemicals speeds out of control, and a conductor and engineer do everything in their power to keep it from derailing and killing tens of thousands of people. Denzel Washington leads the cast in Tony Scott's tough-minded thriller, in which a terrible circumstance forces a couple of ordinary men to become extraordinary heroes.
film.quote: "It's all about precision". I'll say, "See it if you're looking for a loud action movie with some drama". In some places, the drama felt tacked on, unnecessary plot points and the like. And it was obnoxiously loud, like "Terminator:Salvation" loud. Maybe I'm just getting old, but when a movie is THAT loud it takes away from my enjoyment. Like I get it, it's a big train that's moving really fast, but jeez, that's just poor sound editing. And whoever choreographed the camerawork should be fired.

film.summary: A hilarious coming-of-age story about the burden of facing real life...and the freedom that comes from not taking it too seriously. (Artisan Entertainment)
film.quote: Funny at times. The hockey part was easily the best part of the whole movie. Eclaire, anyone?

film.summary: A New York nightclub manager tries to save his brother and father from Russian mafia hit men. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm a Joaquin Phoenix fan, so it kinda saved it that he was in it, and Eva Mendes was hot as always, but it didn't live up to what I had hoped.

film.summary: A pair of losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, but the murderer is out to "finish him off." (imdb)
film.quote: How much can you really say about a dead guy? Points for some decent one-liners and slapstick.

film.filmname: The Woman in Black: Angel of Death (2015)
film.summary: 40 years after the first haunting at Eel Marsh House, a group of children evacuated from WWII London arrive, awakening the house's darkest inhabitant. (imdb)
film.quote: For a sequel to a movie that I somewhat enjoyed despite probably giving it too much credit, this one sets up a rather nice atmosphere amidst WWII England. It's still trope-heavy -- the abandoned-for-years haunted house with the ghost that only the mute child usually sees, with mostly-one-note characters outside of the protagonist heroine. You've seen all this before. But I do LOVE the way this looks. Is it scary? Sort of. It's more atmospheric than scary; in that, it succeeds. It's worth a look!

film.summary: An unprecedented blend of real-life heroism and original filmmaking, Act of Valor stars a group of active-duty Navy SEALs in a powerful story of contemporary global anti-terrorism. Inspired by true events, the film combines stunning combat sequences, up-to-the minute battlefield technology and heart-pumping emotion for the ultimate action adventure. (imdb)
film.quote: Hearing a lot of "what did you expect?" from reviews. I expect that when you sink millions of dollars into a film venture, there's a decent return. Granted this flick only cost 12 million to make, which is a modest budget. No better than B-level, very pro-military quasi-fiction, but at the same time no worse I guess. At times the editing looks very 80's, cookie-cutter story, archetypal characters, not-bad action. The FPS action didn't work for me; then again, I'm not CoD brony. It's just there.

film.summary: If you buy in to official statements, Apollo 17 was NASA's last manned mission to the moon. But what if found footage of a secret Apollo mission that had taken place the following year could prove otherwise -- and explain why we haven't gone back?
film.quote: I enjoy the found footage style. Aside from a bit of obvious bad Hollywooding, I think that aspect of the movie really succeeds, and it does a lot of little things right. It gets the atmosphere and cinematography spot-on, it lays out the characters without delving too much into any one individual (I usually prefer more development, but here it really works), it had suspense and scares... I dunno, I'm not sure where the hate comes from. I enjoyed myself. Bear in mind, I'm forgiving to this genre.

film.summary: Cameron Diaz stars as Elizabeth Halsey, a scheming and coarse-tongued middle school teacher who gets dumped by her wealthy boyfriend and rebounds by sinking her claws into a handsome substitute teacher (Justin Timberlake). There's just one problem, though: He's already dating Amy Squirrel (Lucy Punch), the most revered teacher on campus. And Ms. Squirrel is not at all eager to hand over her beau, who is slated to inherit his family's fortune.
film.quote: Don't get me wrong, there were laughs. And "good enough" performances. But the characters were wooden, and never really changed course from their original singular overwhelming character trait (except Diaz towards the end, but this was superficial at best). Jason Segel was hands-down my favorite character. I just can't help but feel like this movie pales in comparison to others this year within the comedy genre, and as such, sorry, not good enough for me. See it only if you only watch comedies.

film.summary: Chucky hooks up with another murderous doll, the bridal gown-clad Tiffany, for a Route 66 murder spree with their unwitting hosts (imdb)
film.quote: Jennifer Tilly is sexy.

film.summary: Bruce Willis pairs with Tracy Morgan in this Kevin Smith-directed buddy flick about two cops trying to track down a stolen mint-condition (read valuable) baseball card from the 1950s. Along the way, the guys tangle with the mob, a Mexican beauty and countless other characters in this comedic action flick co-starring Adam Brody, Jason Lee, Michelle Trachtenberg and Seann William Scott.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own small kids are soon drawn into a frightening supernatural realm. (imdb)
film.quote: I really did have to think over whether I liked this or Pet Sematary more, and I guess given the choice, I'll take the one that actually has some kind of message behind it other than "Mexico is mysterious, you guys". There just wasn't really any *hook* to this, it's, "here's this woman, here's what she did, now she's a demon because reasons". Any horror movie can make me close my eyes; I'm looking for the ones that invest me, and this one, while passable for what it wanted to be, simply didn't.
