film.summary: An imprisoned vampire, Barnabas Collins, is set free and returns to his ancestral home, where his dysfunctional descendants are in need of his protection. (imdb)
film.quote: I dig comedic fantasy so I do know that I liked the movie. What I'm struggling with is how much. It did have a very good cast who all played solid roles. I especially liked Bella Heathcote and Chloe Grace-Moretz. But I started to feel the movie really drag as it progressed. I can definitely appreciate both the 70's feel and the indirect references to 70's movies/shows thrown in there (a bit before my time but still appreciated). Some classic Burton verve, but could have used some more polishing.

film.summary: In Russia, a group of young adults struggle to survive after an alien invasion. (imdb)
film.quote: Mostly-invisible alien life-forms that look strangely like Sweet Tooth from the Twisted Metal video games sans the face-paint, which incinerate nameless Russian actors. Once again, I believe this is proof-positive of how forgiving I am towards the Sci-Fi genre. I thought it was going along at a decent-enough pace for much of the movie. It was alright, I can't say I wasn't enjoying myself as least somewhat. Then, yeah, the last 20 minutes or so happened. It was still an okay flick with decent 3D.

film.summary: In the near future, when communications go offline at a remote nuclear power plant isolated in the desert, a young safety inspector, Abby Dixon, is forced to fly out to bring them back online. Once inside the facility, mysterious clues and strange behaviors cause Abby to have doubts about the sanity, and perhaps identities, of the two employees onsite. (imdb)
film.quote: Dominic Monaghan's offbeat and increasingly-unhinged performance is probably the primary highlight of what is somewhere between an underwhelming and passable Sci-Fi thriller. The narrative does become incrementally more interesting as it plays out, until a mediocre fight sequence and superheroed-out escape sequence manages to tank not only the denouement of Monaghan's story, but the sentimentality of Habel's. Visuals were fine, otherwise this is little more than a footnote, though not horrible.

film.summary: High-strung father-to-be Peter Highman is forced to hitch a ride with aspiring actor Ethan Tremblay on a road trip in order to make it to his child's birth on time.
film.quote: Ultimately it stands as one of Todd Phillips' worst, and represents quite possibly the low-point of Zach-G's career. It's a moderately-funny re-package of some "Hangover" principles - ie. Zach-G is basically playing the same character, but with a dog this time. I can't say anything against RDJ's performance, thought he was quite good, if not a little bi-polar. Not to mention, you have intentionally-misleading plot points that are introduced and then abandoned. Jamie Foxx? Totally unnecessary!

film.summary: As Johnny Blaze hides out in Eastern Europe, he is called upon to stop the devil, who is trying to take human form. (imdb)
film.quote: Love Idris Elba of course. The movie gets intense right from the get-go, that kind of silly-intense that Nic Cage pulls off in his sleep. It's way over-the-top a lot but there it is. This isn't a flick that sits on its hands and waits for its story; inside the first 10 minutes, the story is out there with a "fuck this talking, it's burny-burny time" attitude. There's a bit of character building in there though, enough to make you invest. I understand the hate but it's (mostly) watchable.

film.summary: Upon discovery of a shard of what could be the Loc-Nar, a miner named Tyler who becomes possessed by an insatiable hunger for power and a thirst for immortality. On his way to the planet of youth, Tyler wipes out most of a space colony and kidnaps a sexy woman. His big mistake is that he doesn't kill the woman's sister, Julie, who then sets out on a mission of rescue and revenge.
film.quote: Look.. it's not a cinematic blockbuster. It's fuckin hentai wrapped up with heavy metal music. But that works for me. So a 50 it is.

film.summary: In the future, a young destitute human woman gets targeted for assassination by the Queen of the Universe, and begins her destiny to finish the Queen's reign. (imdb)
film.quote: Cool elements can still make a disappointing whole. Not that it didn't look great, and not that it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen, either. My problem was, I expected chicken salad. I got... cucumber salad. Still okay, just not what it could be. Nobody has to (or is asked to) stand out performance-wise. Too little is asked logic- and motivation-wise. Bad script and strange (not in a good way) editing. As forgiving as I am to Sci-Fi, I couldn't come to a point of true enjoyment with this.

film.summary: The costumed high-school hero Kick-Ass joins with a group of normal citizens who have been inspired to fight crime in costume. Meanwhile, the Red Mist plots an act of revenge that will affect everyone Kick-Ass knows. (imdb)
film.quote: This was disappointing to me. It lacks the solid direction of the first, the music was at times garbage (AGAIN!), the dialogue took a BIG step backwards despite a few good lines (I'm a fan of swearing when it has purpose, not just saying "faggot" over and over for no reason), the Mean Girls sub-plot (which can be argued as vital to Hit-Girl's development) is a grand waste of camera time to me. And the action/violence is like the dialogue -- all flash, little substance. Sure it's fun. To a point.

film.summary: A mother stops at nothing to recover her kidnapped son. (imdb)
film.quote: Too inoffensive to truly dislike. You can tell from the opening salvo exactly what it's going to be: emotionally manipulative, occasionally thrilling, and wrapped up in a neat little package by the end. But sometimes, that's okay. I didn't exactly go into this movie with a ton of expectations, and that's probably a good thing. It's cliche driven and closer to McDonald's than gourmet dining, but again, not everything has to be gourmet dining. All but hardcore Halle Berry fans can safely skip.

film.summary: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry (imdb)
film.quote: I understand the cultural relevance, it just wasn't all that entertaining to me.

film.summary: Chronicles Jack Harris, one of the pioneers of internet commerce, as he wrestles with his morals and struggles not to drown in a sea of conmen, mobsters, drug addicts, and pornstars.
film.quote: God I cannot handle Luke Wilson. He just comes off so fake to me. And I don't think the dude can act. His inner narratives were his highlight, and they were only on the high side of passable. Giovanni Ribisi plays an extremely convincing coke-head, and his performance was probably the chaotic highlight of the movie. It's a semi-fun crime-dramedy with a couple of memorable scenes that just doesn't quite make it over the top for me. It was just average. "High-end average" would be a stretch.

film.summary: A Christmas-themed special featuring characters from Walt Disney Pictures' 53rd full-length animated motion picture, &quot;Frozen (2013)&quot;. (imdb)
film.quote: Otherwise known as "That Thing You Have To Get Through To See Coco".

film.filmname: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
film.summary: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the film industry during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. (imdb)
film.quote: I never thought I'd leave a Tarantino movie feeling so... unfulfilled. I get it, I understand the references... it's just not much of a movie. Nothing really happens, and even THAT can be done well, but outside of Pitt and Leo having a ball, the ending, and the direction... this is a 165-minute meatless bone. It seems more concerned with name-dropping and being referential, than with any kind of narrative. I have no doubt this is exactly the movie that Tarantino wanted; it's just not for me.

film.summary: THE PARTY is a comedy wrapped around a tragedy. It starts as a celebration and ends with blood on the floor. (imdb)
film.quote: Shut up, Gottfried. It's possible that this is not the genre for me, or, this just isn't a great example of it. There's some tension and laughs but I can't help feeling like I'm on Twitter with all these segues and side-bars -- due in no small part to the fact that these are all horrible people with single-minded characters, most of whom lack much interest within that paradigm, which would make their characters more enjoyable. Cillian Murphy as a cocaine-snorting record-player DJ is a highlight.

film.summary: A tale about a family whose suburban home is invaded by angry spirits. When the terrifying apparitions escalate their attacks and take the youngest daughter, the family must come together to rescue her. (imdb)
film.quote: Originally I was vibing with this. In hindsight, not so much. I'm not gonna sit here and tell you that Poltergeist is a good movie, or that it was worth remaking (has the original aged SO POORLY as to deem this a good idea/necessary/worth spending $35mil on?). There's nothing in this movie that breaks new ground, but at the same time it wasn't AWFUL to me. I quite liked the CGI but the 3D & other effects were mostly a waste. Paper-thin characters. Very formulaic, even for a remake. Safe to skip!

film.summary: A retired assassin is drawn back into the life he gave up when his daughter is kidnapped. To rescue her, he must confront his former rival. (imdb)
film.quote: Love me some John Cusack, I can't admit a strong dislike for Brucey, and I didn't immediately recoil in disgust when I saw 50 Cent's name. I can't say I'm disappointed; I really didn't have any hype going in. It's mediocre. Willis' final stand has moments of intensity, and then buckets full of (unintentional) silliness. And I know New Orleans is a big city, but wouldn't you think SOMEBODY would call the cops during one of these massive shootouts? Not bad enough to suck, but nowhere near good.

film.summary: Woody Harrelson gives a ferocious performance as a dirty cop, balancing a home life with two ex-wives as he becomes embroiled in the Los Angeles Police Department's infamous Rampart corruption scandal. (tiff.net)
film.quote: The entire movie is built on Woody's performance, and on that alone it's worthy of a pass and a viewing. I can't say with any kind of confidence that it's a GOOD movie - rather, it's a movie with a large number of scenes which are good on their own, but make for something of an average ensemble. As far as crime dramas go, it's probably a bit above-average, but quite frankly, I found a lot of the other characters to be repetitive and single-minded. Again, flick is made by Woody's performance.

film.summary: This spooky reimagining of the classic dark-woods folk tale stars Amanda Seyfried as Valerie, a village girl who's confronting a tumultuous romantic situation when a legendary werewolf slaughters her sister. Valerie enlists the help of a veteran demon hunter (Gary Oldman) to destroy the creature, but as each cycle of the moon brings fresh deaths, Valerie begins to realize that the murderous beast may be closer to her than she'd ever dreamed.
film.quote: I was digging this quite a bit actually until the last 20-ish minutes. Great costume and art design, a relatively-mundane script, but another example of convention done fairly well. But oh God, the ending. So fucking terrible. No fault to the actors, just, really pisspoor writing. So there's ups and downs. The ups of course once again include the character portrayed by Ms. Seyfried (Y'know what, say what you will, but she's underrated.) The downs of course are headlined by the God-awful ending.

film.summary: A cop with a connection to the criminal underworld scours a nightclub in search of his kidnapped son. (imdb)
film.quote: Everyone in this movie is strong-arming everyone else, every fight scene looks like it was choreographed that morning, and like a lot of these movies, character motivations/actions/statements are often spotty at best and silly at worst. The story is nothing spectacular; for the most part it's fine, but convoluted all the same. Also does that thing that a lot of pedestrian action-thrillers do which is set up for a sequel that's never coming. It has an audience, but doesn't stand out in any way.

film.summary: The life story of Jesus is told from his humble birth through his teachings, crucifixion and ultimate resurrection. (imdb)
film.quote: I mean, I guess since I just watched the mini-series one day from start to finish, I suppose I've seen the movie that was adapted from it. It was... okay? I mean it was what it was, it was at least moderately interesting, and I'm not going to shit on it because clearly they were trying. It was just *there* -- the story has been told better, the story has been told worse, Jesus has been adapted better, Jesus has been adapted worse, I've seen better and worse production values. It's just there.

film.summary: After returning from a wedding reception, a couple staying in an isolated vacation house receive a knock on the door in the mid-hours of the night. What ensues is a violent invasion by three strangers, their faces hidden behind masks. The couple find themselves in a violent struggle, in which they go beyond what either of them thought capable in order to survive. (imdb)
film.quote: Actually had forgotten that I'd seen this. That's kind of the motife though -- ultimately, not a lot to remember about this flick, other than a few choice scenes. This had a decent amount of potential as a sociological and psychological case study, and the ending was pretty cool. It gets a pass.

film.filmname: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)
film.summary: As Shredder joins forces with mad scientist Baxter Stockman and henchmen Bebop and Rocksteady to take over the world, the Turtles must confront an even greater nemesis: the notorious Krang. (imdb)
film.quote: Of the first movie, I claimed that its flaws were overshadowed by the movie being such undeniable fun. I stick to that. This second one... that's just not the case. It's crossed that line of being TOO corny, with nothing to make up for that. And I didnt hear a single child's laughter. Not to mention, it's just the same formula: Leo & Raph have disagreements, Donnie & Mikey have zero agency and go with whoever, and they all "come together" in the end, sort of? I dunno. This wasn't good enough.

film.summary: Watery, enchanted Venice provides the setting for this thriller starring Johnny Depp as an American tourist seeking solace there for his shattered heart -- only to find it in danger once again after encountering a beautiful Interpol agent (Angelina Jolie). Little does the poor Yank know that the artful agent has gone to great lengths to arrange their "chance" meeting and is using him to trap a criminal who also happens to be her ex-lover.
film.quote: I thought it was alright. I watched it with a girl which probably helped. Yes, it was formulaic; yes it leads you along by the hand like a kid; yes it has a plot twist that you can probably guess (I didn't but I wasn't trying very hard either, preferred to let the movie breathe and get there on its own, as I usually do). As usual, I find the armchair Criticker critics (once again, don't get uppity, I'm one of you) being overly harsh on phoned-in Oscar bait, but, my opinion, it's worth watching.

film.summary: Humans and Transformers are at war, Optimus Prime is gone. The key to saving our future lies buried in the secrets of the past, in the hidden history of Transformers on Earth.
film.quote: Basically a 90's-narrative-with-2017-visual-effects genre mash-up: part action, part war film, part comedy, Sci-Fi and fantasy, epic in scale but, probably, if we're being honest, not a "good" movie when held against most others. Too long, too convoluted, cuts the nuts off of evil Prime, too genre-diverse (without being incredible at any of them) and far away from what would make these movies great. But when held against its namesakes, fans likely get what they want and it isn't the worst entry.

film.summary: A harmless game of Truth or Dare among friends turns deadly when someone -- or something -- begins to punish those who tell a lie or refuse the dare. (imdb.com)
film.quote: My kind of horror movie in so much as, it isn't really scary, which is right up my alley because I'm a huge coward. I liked what they did with the faces, and the premise is not entirely terrible. What really failed to churn my butter was the ending. I get that you're paying off "the promise" between the girls but, that ending only leaves me thinking "these are horrible people who don't deserve my sympathy for what they've gone through". That's not really my idea of effective messaging. Shame.

film.summary: As a string of mysterious killings grips Seattle, Bella, whose high school graduation is fast approaching, is forced to choose between her love for vampire Edward and her friendship with werewolf Jacob.
film.quote: If there's one thing that I am really loving about these movies, it's the Dad. Bella's Dad is hilarious. It retains the essential wonk and facepalm that has made the series (in)famous, but shows some minor growth. Here's something that bothers me though - more noticeable in this one than in the others. EVERY character is so goddamn self-righteous. "You're wrong!" "No, YOU'RE wrong!" "YOU'RE BOTH WRONG!". Can somebody please just be right for once so you can shut the fuck up? Improving slowly.

film.summary: People have always searched for a way to communicate with the other side - fascinated, motivated, driven to find a way to connect with loved ones who have passed on. Now comes this suspense thriller that explores this very-real, other-worldly communication - White Noise. Tapping into our deepest fears and most profound longings, White Noise forces us to re-examine the world in which we live and, in the process, question our most basic notions about life and death. (Universal)
film.quote: Interesting premise, and I've always been terribly fascinated with the ways in which people attempt to pacify themselves through communication (or implied communication) with the afterlife (whatever they believe the afterlife to be). Kind of a let-down, the ending was all fizzle, acting was pretty sub-par. But I don't think anyone was expecting Oscars from this one.

film.summary: Eccentric firearm heiress believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle. (imdb)
film.quote: A middle-of-the-road thriller that doesn't completely waste its fresh-ish premise, but breaks no new ground whatsoever. I think I walked in with no expectations and therefore can't say that I'm either disappointed or impressed. It's just kind of there, and just being there is kind of fine in this case, where in some cases that could be a criticism. Jason Clarke is decent, Helen Mirren is better (though not tasked with a complex role). Suckers for this genre will probably enjoy more so than I.

film.summary: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family. (imdb)
film.quote: Simple story to this movie for me -- didn't hate it, but found myself tremendously uninterested. Almost bored. Helen Mirren is a tremendously-skilled actress (obviously), Ryan Reynolds is impossibly pretty (obviously), and the movie is shot pretty beautifully... but it doesn't add up to an entertaining or captivating whole. Things happen, then more things happen, then there's emotion, then there's resolution. If this was trying to be "Argo" quality, it didn't get there. Just fell flat with me.

film.summary: A stranger with mysterious intentions comes to stay the night at a secluded country home, but what he finds inside is a family torn apart by a violent past and a secret more deadly than he expected. (imdb)
film.quote: So you have a mentally unstable mother harboring a dark secret, a work-obsessed father who turns a blind eye to the dysfunction in his family, the older brother who can't wait to get out, and the younger sister who is an emotionally-scarred, glorified emo kid sociopath who goes by the name "BlackBird" (or, as I affectionately dubbed her while watching, "RavenClaw", while making multiple World of Warcraft jokes). Then this calm-ass Southern dude rolls up and 86's the whole lot. Standard but okay.

film.summary: Six tourists hire an extreme tour guide who takes them to the abandoned city Pripyat, the former home to the workers of the Chernobyl nuclear reactor. During their exploration, they soon discover they are not alone (imdb)
film.quote: Oren Peli projects have one great thing down pat - they execute minimalist tension and fear to absolute perfection. The problem here is twofold - both that there are no characters with which you are compelled to have any real investment (with the possible exception of Chris; all he wants to do is go to Moscow and propose to his girlfriend), and that the movie submits to the same old wonky character logic and decision-making that plagues the genre. Eh. It's watchable but you can find much better.

film.summary: A young woman, while attempting to save her father during a Category 5 hurricane, finds herself trapped in a flooding house and must fight for her life against alligators. (imdb)
film.quote: Would someone like to tell me exactly what I missed, here? I tried; I've reflected on it, did my level-headed best to give this movie every benefit of the doubt, and I landed on, it just isn't very good. It's a low-rent Sharknado (and THAT is painful to say) that doesn't do nearly enough to take advantage of its claustrophobic setting, nor its ridiculous premise, NOR its semi-interesting tagline. "They were here first". Okay... and? This is just horror via happenstance. Criminally undercooked.

film.summary: An abrupt climate change has cataclysmic consequences for the entire planet. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: There are redeeming qualities to this flick, but for the most part, isn't as strong as it could have been.

film.filmname: Don't Be Afraid of the Dark (2011)
film.summary: A young girl sent to live with her father and his new girlfriend discovers creatures in her new home who want to claim her as one of their own.
film.quote: I'm okay with this. Visually, it's very lovely and fleshed-out for the most part. Honestly, could have done without the CGI "Gremlins" rip-offs, I think it would have gone over much better had they been a "faceless unseen fear" sort of thing. But, they decided on CGI gremlins, so, there you have it. This movie is a moving poster for bad parenting; I dunno if they were going for that or it was just poorly-written characters. Katie and Guy do enough, while Bailee is creepy as fuck. It's passable.

film.summary: Ben Holmes, a professional book-jacket blurbologist, is trying to get to Savannah for his wedding. He just barely catches the last plane, but a seagull flies into the engine as the plane is taking off. All later flights are cancelled because of an approaching hurricane, so he is forced to hitch a ride in a Geo Metro with an attractive but eccentric woman named Sara. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll give it a pass. I was comfortable with what I saw, but at the same time, it just felt like another movie that was really full of itself. I don't particularly like Sandra Bullock, and in fact, Maura Tierney basically made the movie for me.

film.summary: Twenty years after an accident during a small town high school play results in death, students at the school resurrect the failed stage production in a misguided attempt to honor the anniversary of the tragedy - but ultimately find out that some things are better left alone. (imdb)
film.quote: There's some stuff in here that definitely works and is at least a good IDEA, even if in execution it leaves quite a bit to be desired. But if there ever was a well that had been bled dry, it's the found-footage horror movie. I just think that a movie like this is too derivative of its predecessors to be anything more than inoffensive. There are some cool scenes bogged down by all-world terrible dialogue and a male co-lead who is an asshole for NO reason. I'll play nice with the ending. Skip.

film.summary: A paranoid thriller about a family on the run from a natural crisis that presents a large-scale threat to humanity. (imdb)
film.quote: *GONG*, but dammit if M. Knight isn't trying.

film.summary: After a family is forced to relocate for their son's health, they begin experiencing supernatural behavior in their new home, which turns out to be a former mortuary. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually didn't mind this flick all that much, it's average, and the rating is saved a bit by a really cool (albeit brief) ending credits sequence, with some photos that may lead you to question whether they're real scene photos or props. And it had kind of a decent twist towards the end. But yo, if you're not a fan of jump-scares, you can pretty much skip this flick entirely, as that's 80% of the flick. And they're often really cheap jump scares, with very little thought involved. Passable.

film.summary: A dad convinces his friends to start an illegal casino in his basement after he and his wife spend their daughter's college fund.
film.quote: So in THIS Will Ferrell movie, the comedy is derived from his two personality quirks and a few quick one-liners, which differs from all these other Will Ferrell movies where the comedy is derived from his two personality quirks and a few quick one-liners. What I'm saying here is that Will Ferrell is a hack and basically parodying himself at this point. Yet I can't pretend that I didn't laugh and enjoy myself a bit. I guess this time around, I didn't hate the formula. Excuse me. I need a shower.

film.summary: Young hero Thomas embarks on a mission to find a cure for a deadly disease known as the "Flare". (imdb)
film.quote: In a review below, someone stated "Young adults are cancer". No, but middle-aged men writing FOR young adults, now THAT'S bad! Thomas might be replacing Christian Grey as the least interesting main character in cinema history. There's nothing special about him but his blood, and there's no sense of stakes because someone swoops in to save the day literally every single time. WCKD recruits Stormtroopers. I can't say exactly WHEN, but this movie jumps the shark, HARDcore. Could have been alright.

film.summary: A big-screen look into one of America's most successful entertainment industries, NASCAR racing. (imdb)
film.quote: Well, I mean.. what can you say, it's a NASCAR documentary. Kiefer was good.

film.summary: Holly Kennedy (Hillary Swank) is beautiful, smart and married to the love of her life-- a passionate, funny, and impetuous Irishman named Gerry (Gerard Butler). So when Gerry's life is taken by an illness, it takes the life out of Holly. The only one who can help her is the person who is no longer there. Nobody knows Holly better than Gerry. So it's a good thing he planned ahead... (imdb)
film.quote: Ugh, I guess. I mean fuck sakes, if it was me, I would be creeped the fuck out that I was married to and banging a guy who is the kind of person who would plan out sending me letters after he's dead. I'm obviously missing the point of this flick, I guess it's an interesting idea and maybe it's sweeter than I'm giving it credit for. It just weirds me out. And every time I saw Butler I had to bite my lip and resist the urge to scream out "THIS IS SPARTA!!!!!!!" in the theatre. Kudrow is adorable.

film.summary: It has been five years since the disappearance of Katie and Hunter, and a suburban family witness strange events in their neighborhood when a woman and a mysterious child move in. (imdb)
film.quote: Ugh, teen dialogue. In all its forms, an abortion. Okay, maybe there's a decent line or two. As always, at times, the justification for carrying or having a camera EVERYWHERE becomes wonky as all hell, even 10 minutes into the flick. We all know the format here, daytime safe, night-time scary, creepy little boy at the center of it all. I pay attention only to attempt to extrapolate the continuation of the story, but that's starting to not cut it anymore. But since I'm a sissy the scares worked.

film.summary: A group of friends are horrified when the male stripper they hired for a wild bachelorette party in Miami winds up dead.
film.quote: I'll keep riding the ScarJo bandwagon right into the ground if need be. She's my jam. I also appreciate Kate MacKinnon's role today in Hollywood, and damn, how perfect is Zoe Kravitz? I found myself laughing during this more than I thought I might, so in that, this is far from a failure and probably best described as "a movie that I enjoyed watching one time". Would never survive a second viewing. A little too cringey in places for me, with some melodrama that felt really unnecessary. It's fine.

film.summary: Members of an elite DEA task force find themselves being taken down one by one after they rob a drug cartel safe house. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty dumb. Feels like they were really trying to go for some A-Team shit. The dialogue is hit-and-miss between funny, charming & genuine, and stupid, cliched & generally terrible. It does a few scarce moments of tension fairly well, and definitely has an edge to it. The movie's best shot at sentimentality with the storyline of John and his family is totally undercut when he has sex with the homocide PI. The movie gets willfully dumber from there, all the way to its "okay" conclusion.

film.summary: Seduction, passion and power struggles unfold as the creators of "Basic Instinct" blow the lid off the seemingly glamorous world of Las Vegas showdancing in this controversial film that stars Elizabeth Berkley. (MGM)
film.quote: Probably one of the 10 sexiest films I've ever watched, but... doesn't make it good.

film.summary: A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son who was imprisoned after being set up in drug deal. (imdb)
film.quote: The opening 20 minutes felt kind of poor, felt like a long PSA against mandatory minimum sentencing (which I'm not going to take a stand on in a movie review), and the emotional conveyance just didn't feel genuine to me, up until the visitation scene. The final score is buoyed by a strong third act, but the fact that the whole movie turns out to be what I had a bad feeling it was (based on that opening 20) sinks it once again. It is what it is, but, what it is isn't overly strong or memorable.

film.summary: The turtles find themselves transported back in time to ancient Japan. (imdb)
film.quote: Even with how much I love the Japanese aesthetic, didn't do it for me this time.

film.summary: A dangerous international spy is determined to give up his high stakes life to finally build a closer relationship with his estranged wife and daughter, whom he's previously kept at arm's length to keep out of danger. But first, he must complete one last mission - even if it means juggling the two toughest assignments yet: hunting down the world's most ruthless terrorist and looking after his teenage daughter for the first time in ten years, while his wife is out of town. (imdb)
film.quote: ...I don't think this is how the CIA works. I hope that the only independent intelligence agency in the U.S. isn't so cornball... and not great at their jobs... and apparently, susceptible to squatters. TEENAGERS KNOW HOW TO HANDSHAKE! I guess this is supposed to also be a comedy? Maybe the family drama is a little undercooked, but there's still good in there. I love Kevin Smith dialogue as much as anybody, but it REALLY doesn't fit here. A floater -- not nearly good, yet not bad enough to hate.

film.summary: Notorious director Uwe Boll has set out to create a realistic and brutal film about what actually took place in the gas chambers during World War II in Auschwitz. The director was quoted as saying: It's in the tradition of my movies Stoic, Darfur, Rampage, Tunnel Rats, Heart of America...it shows Auschwitz as what it was: a meat plant for humans...a death factory. (MovieWeb.com)
film.quote: The first 10-plus minutes tries to make a statement about how little teenagers FROM GERMANY know/care about the Holocaust, but, his sample size is too small to be convincing (he picked the six worst examples of the likely dozens he interviewed, which he later "corrects" by using smarter students when it better suits him). The actual film itself is not that bad, it gets the grittiness and the dread down pat for sure. As a whole, though, it feels disjointed and insistent on itself. But, watch it.

film.summary: Warring alien and predator races descend on a small town, where unsuspecting residents must band together for any chance of survival. (imdb)
film.quote: About ten minutes in you can tell that the fundamental mistake this movie makes is to focus on the humans -- humans that are one-note archetypes with no depth or quality of performance. I know I said in my AvP review that "you shouldn't judge movies like this on performance", but when the movie FOCUSES PRIMARILY on human characters, you almost have to. The action is still fine and I appreciate the visual upgrades that came with the three years between movies. But, uh... yeah, it's not great.

film.summary: Devoted lifeguard Mitch Buchannon butts heads with a brash new recruit. Together, they uncover a local criminal plot that threatens the future of the Bay. (imdb)
film.quote: To say that this exceeded my expectations would probably be giving it undue credit, but what should have been an abortion on film is not even the worst thing I've seen THIS YEAR, and for that I can tip my cap. There are just enough one-liners, puns, sexy women, sexy men (let's face it, it's The Rock, you were all thinking it), and the slightest degree of self-awareness, that not even Zac Efron's continued role as an irredeemable little shit could tank this completely. Should have been worse.

film.summary: Shortly after her divorce, a woman falls for handsome younger man who just moved in across the street, though their torrid affair that takes an obsessive, dangerous turn. (imdb)
film.quote: I can't bring myself to out-and-out HATE this. It's just way way WAY too cornball to truly rile me up. Hands-down, this wins the fictitious "Rapey-est Movie of 2015" award. I'll pause to remind you that this is the same year Fifty Shades comes out! It's a thriller book-ended as a horror, that occasionally pulls off decent tension. Don't get me wrong, this is a BAD movie. But it's so comedically bad that I can't hate it. Not "so bad it's good", but high degrees of unexpected entertainment abound.

film.summary: After watching their respective partners die, a cop and a hitman form an alliance in order to bring down their common enemy. (imdb)
film.quote: Maybe this wasn't helped by the fact that I had a crummy cam version that was missing shit. I like Sly a lot but this simply wasn't good. It started out all over the place, it was really cliched (admittedly, sometimes that works well in Sly movies; here it sadly doesn't). Some good lines here and there. The Roman Reigns-lookin' guy (Jason Momoa) was pretty badass, but Sung Kang seldom feels like more than a glorified Kato. It's hard to do character-driven with characters that aren't that great.

film.summary: As the Barret family's peaceful suburban life is rocked by an escalating series of disturbing events, they come to learn that a terrifying and deadly force is after them. (imdb)
film.quote: LOL kitchen's fucked, LOL bottles stacked on table, LOL eight security points tripped at once. Total troll job. This flick is... strange, to be honest. Some force just trolled the crap out of this family for awhile, the parents kind of hate each other because Capitalism, then OH SHIT! That first jump is a great one. Tension is built fairly well, but the screenplay leaves a lot to be desired for horror fans. Bonus points for unintentional comedy. I'm not saying it was aliens... but it was aliens.

film.summary: A funeral ceremony turns into a debacle of exposed family secrets and misplaced bodies.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: The producers who took audiences on a &#034;Road Trip&#034; and back to &#034;Old School&#034; now invite you on a wild Eurotrip. (DreamWorks)
film.quote: Again, a serviceable comedy, a little contemporary, but not the strongest film from these producers (doesn't live up to Old School, for instance).

film.summary: Set in a future-world where humans can control other humans in mass-scale, multi-player online gaming environments, a star player (Butler) from a game called "Slayers" looks to regain his independence while taking down the game's mastermind (Hall).
film.quote: One of the least inspired action/sci-fi flicks I think I've ever seen. It was painfully obvious that it was made by the same guys who made Crank, as, aside from the ballsy action scenes and pseudo-dystopianism, the movie was annoying. People actually liked the "I've Got You Under My Skin" dance-ologue? It was hammy, but dumb. I also HATED the way the movie characterizes the only two "gamers" you meet -- a morbidly obese pervert and an underage boy using his parents' money. Maybe a cult fave...?

film.summary: An intersectional narrative of two families in Brooklyn and the unraveling of unspoken unhappiness that occurs when a young foreign girl spending time abroad upsets the balance on both sides. (imdb)
film.quote: Feels very much like Perry's best shot at actually BEING Woody Allen. Not un-enjoyable, but even at its apex(es) it's not exactly what I would describe as an entertaining film. I'm fine with heavy dialogue (though hit-and-miss here in terms of quality), but I do prefer that dialogue to come from characters whose inter-relationships intrigue me. To me this is a group of unlikable, pretentious, melodramatic people. That just doesn't hook me, intentional or not. It's more annoying than investing.

film.summary: Manny, Diego, and Sid embark upon another adventure after their continent is set adrift. Using an iceberg as a ship, they encounter sea creatures and battle pirates as they explore a new world. (imdb)
film.quote: It's gotten to the point that movies like Ice Age are ones I can sit through, but that offer me little in terms of entertainment. Laughs? Absolutely. Emotional subject matter? Yes, albeit tacked on and completely superficial. Let's face it, these are movies for the kids and nothing more. Maybe it didn't help that I haven't seen the second or third movies, but even so, it wouldn't change the things about this movie that annoyed me. Some good voice acting, but some was terribly distracting. Meh.

film.summary: The U.S. government decides to go after an agri-business giant with a price-fixing accusation, based on the evidence submitted by their star witness, vice president turned informant Mark Whitacre.
film.quote: I'll see anything with Damon in it (human or puppet), and I thought this movie had potential. It sadly left me with a "what's the point?" empty feeling. I mostly dug the introspective monologues, but it was way too dry, mostly unfunny for a dark comedy, and I can't fathom why some actually see the corporate stuff as insightful. Similarly-themed companies are involved in price/volume setting? Next you'll be trying to tell me the sky's blue. Go look at gas stations, bro, this shit ain't original.

film.summary: THE LONGEST RIDE centers on the star-crossed love affair between Luke, a former champion bull rider looking to make a comeback, and Sophia, a college student who is about to embark upon her dream job in New York City's art world. As conflicting paths and ideals test their relationship, Sophia and Luke make an unexpected and fateful connection with Ira, whose memories of his own decades-long romance with his beloved wife deeply inspire the young couple. (imdb)
film.quote: Honestly, probably better than it had any right to be. Not GOOD, I'm not gonna say that, but, not a complete train-wreck by any means either. Alan Alda is the flick's MVP, which is either a good thing (because he's good in his role), a bad thing (because he's not the primary focus of the movie), or an expectation (because it's Alan fucking Alda). Bull riding is bullshit and if you like it you're a horrible person. That's fact. But if you like(d) this movie I can't really blame you. It's alright!

film.summary: The Solomon family has left the fast paced life of Chicago for the secluded world of a North Dakota farm. Amidst the tranquil sway of the farm&#039;s field of sunflowers, Jess, 16, soon realizes how terrifying seclusion can be when she and her brother Ben, 3, begin seeing ominous apparitions invisible to everyone else. (Sony)
film.quote: EXTREMELY conventional for a 2007 horror. The CGI apparitions looked terrible, but John Corbett's character was quite good, and of course, Kristen Stewart and her 16-year-old sexually-frustrated looks sold it. The twist was cool if predictable. I won't totally shit on it, it's just trying to cash in on the horror movie bandwagon. But given that I had been waiting a couple years to see it, I was somewhat disappointed. I expected more. But the crawling scene in the barn creeps me the fuck out.

film.summary: When a missing page from the diary of John Wilkes Booth surfaces, Ben's great-great grandfather is suddenly implicated as a key conspirator in Abraham Lincoln's death. Determined to prove his ancestor's innocence, Ben follows an international chain of clues that takes him on a chase from Paris to London and ultimately back to America. This journey leads Ben and his crew not only to surprising revelations, but also to the trail of the world's most treasured secrets. (Walt Disney Pictures)
film.quote: I agree that most, if not all, of the flick was too convenient, stuff just happened way too easily, but it was still aesthetically pleasing and entertaining enough to redeem the rating.

film.summary: A priest with a haunted past and a novitiate on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate the death of a young nun in Romania and confront a malevolent force in the form of a demonic nun. (imdb)
film.quote: This isn't the original Conjuring, not by a long shot. I feel like I've reached that point with this franchise that I have with Paranormal Activity: the main reason I'm watching is to keep track of the lore, which, isn't really a great reason to be watching if we're being honest. The highlight was arguably when a grown-ass adult man turned around to a group of teenagers and told them to kill themselves and shut up. That's not in the movie, that was in my theatre. So you don't get to see that.

film.summary: By day Abby Russell is a dedicated nurse, someone you wouldn't hesitate to trust your life with. But by night, her real work begins...using her smoldering sexuality she lures cheating men to their brutal deaths and exposes them for who they really are. When a younger nurse starts to suspect Abby's actions and compromises her master plan, Abby must find a way to outsmart her long enough to bring the cheater you'd least expect to justice. (imdb)
film.quote: There are seven naked people in the first 20 minutes. "There is no cure for the married cock" is among the weirder lines I've ever heard. The dialogue is really bad; the acting, SUPER cheesy. But it has a fun tone and interesting (albeit REALLY stupid) premises. Not attracted to Paz, but moar Katrina Bowden please! Make no mistake, this movie is pretty terrible. Is it "so bad it's good"? Kind of. "So bad it's entertaining" is closer. It's a guilty pleasure I guess. But stupid. Very, very stupid.

film.summary: Mall security guard Ronnie Barnhardt is called into action to stop a flasher from turning shopper's paradise into his personal peep show.
film.quote: I give it props for Ray Liotta, and the fact that it out-Blart'ed "Paul Blart" - good thing or bad? I got the feeling that Ronnie was being portrayed and written as, at the same time, some kind of super hero, and a bi-polar go-nowhere asshole. That's really not a combination that leads to effective characterization, outside of Donnie Darko. Quite unfortunate as it kills Rogan's momentum; his recent roles (Z&M, Funny People, Superbad) have been gold. Clearly marks the end of Anna Faris' career.

film.summary: A slave turned gladiator finds himself in a race against time to save his true love, who has been betrothed to a corrupt Roman Senator. As Mount Vesuvius erupts, he must fight to save his beloved as Pompeii crumbles around him. (imdb)
film.quote: There were some early scenes I really liked (ie. windchime of dead bodies & bloody weapons) and some that didn't work (ie. child saunters through small battlefield & has the presence of mind to play dead surrounded by murder). We skip 17 years and the movie goes full Gladiator. Rich girls covertly swoon over shirtless, buff slaves. Horrible dialogue. CGI was hit-and-miss. Too much finger-biting. I guess they depict Pompeii well, and Kiefer is good. I believe that's where my praise ends, though.

film.summary: A man needs an escort for some social events, and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets... only to fall in love.
film.quote: While Julia Roberts plays a pretty convincing hooker (coincidence?) and Richard Gere is pretty sexy, this movie is not half of what everyone talked it up to be. There were okay parts, but... meh.

film.summary: An eccentric would-be writer and full-time dishwasher does everything and anything to prove to his skeptical inamorata that they are meant to be, in this winsome romantic comedy from director Jeremiah Chechik (Benny & Joon). (tiff.net)
film.quote: It's an unconventional rom-com in a somewhat-similar mold to "The Five Year Engagement", but all throughout, I couldn't help feeling like what I was watching was simply TOO ridiculous to be taken seriously. I feel the movie tacks on emotional subtext simply for the sake of having it, and that it's too chaotic and random. I can't say that I wasn't entertained, nor can I say that I was disappointed in the movie not being a formulaic cookie-cutter rom-com. But this just didn't work well for me.

film.summary: The story picks up six months after the horrifying events that terrorized Rachel Keller (Watts) and her son Aidan (Dorfman) in Seattle. To escape her haunting memories, Rachel takes Aidan and moves to the small coastal community of Astoria, Oregon, to start fresh. However, Rachel&#039;s resolve quickly turns to dread when evidence at a local crime scene-including an unmarked videotape-seems eerily familiar. Rachel realizes that the vengeful Samara is back and more determined than ever to continue her relentless cycle of terror and death. (DreamWorks)
film.quote: I was okay with this flick, it was decent. But I mean, a flick like this isn't going to break any barriers anymore. The CGI deer were kinda flimsy and silly.

film.summary: After she's accused of being a Russian sleeper spy, rogue CIA agent Evelyn Salt (Angelina Jolie) goes on the run, using every tactic, accent and disguise she knows to elude her pursuers, clear her name and protect her husband. Her supervisor, Winter (Liev Schreiber), buys her story, while counterintelligence officer Peabody (Chiwetel Ejiofor) decidedly does not and will do anything to stop her in this fast-paced, intrigue-filled spy adventure.
film.quote: I'll say that the casting was spot-on. The titular role was tailor-made for Angie. I liked the musical choices for the most part. Unfortunately, this is where praise mostly ends. Uninspired dialogue I thought, filled with Cold War cliches, and plenty of wonk in the action. It's a genre flick, maybe it'll be your thing. The cheese was too much for me. A decent effort by a mostly-unknown director (I wouldn't mind seeing him in big-budget efforts in the future), I just don't agree with this vision.

film.summary: When a man inadvertently injurers Santa on Christmas Eve, he finds himself magically recruited to take his place. (imdb)
film.quote: Only an average comedy series, first one didn't leave much to live up to.

film.summary: A mysterious killer video tape is circulating around. One look at this tape and you have seven days left to live. News Reporter Cindy Campbell (Faris) witnesses this video tape and tries to work out a way to prevent her death. But this is not the only mystery to appear. Crop circles have been appearing in the local farm of Tom (Sheen) and George (Rex). With help from Aunt Shaneequa (Latifah), Cindy suspects that the aliens may be linked with the killer tape and must now work out both mysteries before it's the end of the world. (imdb)
film.quote: This is unfortunately where the Wayans hit the wall compared to their first two flicks.

film.summary: In an ancient time, predating the pyramids, the evil king Memnon is using the psychic powers of his sorceress Cassandra to fortell his great victories. In a last ditch effort to stop Memnon from taking over the world, the leaders of the remaining free tribes hire the assassin Mathayus to kill the sorceress.
film.quote: The Rock says, "Put enough money in front of me, I'll do anything!" Seriously though, at that point (2002), did the Mummy franchise REALLY need a spin-off? Decent film, nothing to write home about.

film.summary: A high school jock makes a bet that he can turn an unattractive girl into the school&#039;s prom queen. (imdb)
film.quote: Sadly enough, this was one of the first movies that Obdurate and I ever rented, and it fueled his obsession with Rachel Leigh Cook. It was cute at the time.

film.summary: A mercenary is killed, but comes back from Hell as a reluctant soldier of the Devil. (imdb)
film.quote: You know, this movie kinda grew on me. The ending theme music would have made a great theme for a pro wrestler.

film.summary: FBI profiler Special Agent Illeana Scott (Jolie) suddenly finds herself on a twisted and terrifying journey, surrounded by suspects in a case that has become chillingly personal. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Big Angie fan, but I gotta tell ya man, I was bored. Very. Seemed like a really generic tale that's not as twisted and terrifying as the summary would like you to think. Angie was pretty good, good sex scene, but was pretty disappointed with the flick as a whole.

film.summary: Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.
film.quote: This flick has redeeming qualities - mostly, RDJ and Nolte, and Cruise is fucking hilarious. But it also kinda falls on its face. Yes, you're pointing out the hypocrisy of Hollywood. Congrats, Ben Stiller. You still haven't been relevant since Zoolander, which isn't much to be proud of. The premise is blissfully and intentionally ignorant, the plot twist with Nolte's character you could see from a mile away. Nothing new, nothing original. Ultimately, it is aesthetically retarded and forgettable.

film.summary: While recovering from a tragic accident on the road, the patrolman Edward Malus receives a letter from his former fiancÃ©e Willow, who left him years ago without any explanation, telling that her daughter Rowan is missing. Edward travels to the private island of Summerisle, where Willow lives in an odd community that plant fruits, and she reveals that Rowan is actually their daughter... (imdb)
film.quote: Extremely wonky if this indeed is NOT an intentional comedy. Some redeeming moments as well; Cage's "walking nightmares" kind of work, some fun dialogue, there's relative suspense, and it's always fun to see LeeLee. But the bees scene proves that Cage wasn't taking this seriously. But he sure can smack a bitch. The actual wicker man was a neat concept as far as sacrifices go. The original theatrical ending is better than the unrated one; more LeeLee! Y'know what, fuck it, see this movie.

film.summary: Nick Wild is a Las Vegas bodyguard with lethal professional skills and a personal gambling problem. When a friend is beaten by a sadistic thug, Nick strikes back, only to find out the thug is the son of a powerful mob boss. Suddenly Nick is plunged into the criminal underworld, chased by enforcers and wanted by the mob. Having raised the stakes, Nick has one last play to change his fortunes...and this time, it's all or nothing. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think I can call this thing BAD. Just WILDLY inconsistent, if you'll forgive the pun. The weird tonal shifts I think will turn a lot of people off but I've seen less-interesting movies than this, and less-interesting takes on things like gambling addiction and being afraid of the world. But I will say this about Wild Card -- I was actually fairly bored for most of it. Even the fight scenes which I fear substitute slow-motion for ingenuity. You'll see worse this year but this isn't great.

film.summary: In this futuristic sci-fi thriller set 400 years in the future, Charlize Theron stars as Aeon Flux, the top underground operative at war with the totalitarian regime governing what appears to be a perfect society. But is this perfect life hiding a perfect lie? Aeon is on the front lines of a rebellion that will reveal a world of secrets. (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: I usually try not to rag too too much on sci-fi flicks, but this is at the very bottom of my Average pile, hanging by a thread. Some decent visuals throughout, but never allowed me to become lost in the movie aesthetic and suspend disbelief.

film.summary: The movie is set in a world where dragons are hunted for oil. In an adaption of Moby Dick, we follow Ahab and his doomed crew in their hunt for the white dragon.
film.quote: Pretty bad CGI to start; the white dragon looks like something straight out of The Asylum's playbook, a "we need a dragon but we only have 20-thou to spend" sort of thing. Anyways. I give the film props for taking a classic tale and putting at least a somewhat-fascinating spin on it. Ahab was an interesting character; at the same time, protagonist and vengeance-fueled anti-hero. Some unneeded emotional tack-ons, but nothing too egregious. Don't shy away because of bad reviews. It's worth a look.

film.summary: Jim (Biggs), Oz (Klein), Finch (Thomas) and Kevin (Nicholas) are four friends who make a pact that before they graduate they will all lose their virginity. The hard job now is how to reach that goal by prom night. Whilst Oz begins singing to grab attention and Kevin tries to persuade his girlfriend, Finch tries any easy route of spreading rumors and Jim fails miserably... (imdb)
film.quote: Serviceable adolescent comedy. I mean, it works, for what it is, and at the time, I have to admit that I did really enjoy the flick. But what it is isn't much.

film.summary: Does contemporary America have a controlling class? (imdb)
film.quote: Yes. It does.

film.summary: In the remote sands of the Moroccan desert, a rifle shot rings out -- detonating a chain of events that will link an American tourist couple's frantic struggle to survive, two Moroccan boys involved in an accidental crime, a nanny illegally crossing into Mexico with two American children and a Japanese teen rebel whose father is sought by the police in Tokyo. (Paramount Vantage)
film.quote: Not a fan. Looked like it was going to be really good, never hit it for me from start to finish.

film.summary: An expectant couple's intimate weekend turns to terror when they discover their secluded country inn is a haunted maternity home where unwanted infants and mothers were murdered. (imdb)
film.quote: Uh. Wow. Boy. You know I really love supporting the arts in my home province (shout-out to those in the Nova Scotia film industry), so I paid to see this. Buuuuut, if I'm being honest, this is not a good movie. Not offensively bad, so it stays out of the pantheons of the worst of the genre, but there's just so little that's remarkable about it; not the story, nor the performances or production design, outside of fleeting instances. In a genre plagued with mundanity, this changes exactly nothing.

film.summary: Family man and firefighter Gordon Brewer (Schwarzenegger) is plunged into the complex and dangerous world of international terrorism after he loses his wife and child in a bombing credited to Claudio &#034;The Wolf&#034; Perrini (Curtis). Frustrated with the official investigation and haunted by the thought that the man responsible for murdering his family might never be brought to justice, Brewer takes matters into his own hands and travels to Colombia to track down the terrorist. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Really generic Ahhhhhhnold action flick.

film.summary: After a mysterious, lost night on their honeymoon, a newlywed couple finds themselves dealing with an earlier-than-planned pregnancy. While recording everything for posterity, the husband begins to notice odd behavior in his wife that they initially write off to nerves, but, as the months pass, it becomes evident that the dark changes to her body and mind have a much more sinister origin. (imdb)
film.quote: "Handi-cam" style? Again? Alright. I'll give it this much, the early "possession" scene was pretty good; not *really* getting to see what happened was arguably better than seeing it. When you get to see what happens, you start to see the holes in it. Aside from that, this is fairly standard. There's not a lot in this movie that you haven't seen before, not to say that there aren't good moments. But almost every formula & convention of the genre is present. Less interesting than it thinks it is.

film.summary: A brash young police detective (Dorff) joins forces with a beautiful, ambitious Department of Health researcher (McElhone) to find the answers behind the mysterious deaths of four people who each died 48 hours after logging on to the Internet site Feardotcom. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: A workable premise gets kinda molested.

film.summary: A young woman searches for her twin sister in a Japanese forest only to find herself surrounded by paranormal forces. (imdb)
film.quote: I wanted to like this. Like I *really* wanted to like this. I really wanted this to be more than what it is. Like... JAPANESE SUICIDE FOREST, that should be all this needs to be atmospheric and creepy and... BE GOOD, DAMMIT, WHY WON'T YOU BE GOOD!?!? The only thing that keeps this from being a red-spectrum, candidate-for-worst-of-2016, is that I feel that there's enough there for the average movie-goer to latch on to, even if it IS just the jump-scares. But for me, it's alllllll a hallucination.

film.summary: When millionaire James King is nailed for fraud and bound for San Quentin, he turns to Darnell Lewis to prep him to go behind bars. (imdb)
film.quote: I can get behind Kevin Hart in this. He's got some really funny moments. Will Ferrell does what he usually does, to continuingly-diminishing returns. Comedy movies often try too hard to be "more than just a comedy", and this has elements of that for sure. I don't think it helps the movie's case. This is not OFFENSIVELY bad. But it's a lot of lazy comedy with shoe-horned drama and extraneous story that simply isn't necessary. A mostly-pointless comedy becomes a completely-pointless dramedy.

film.summary: Laurie Strode struggles to come to terms with her brother Michael's deadly return to Haddonfield, Illinois; meanwhile, Michael prepares for another reunion with his sister
film.quote: As I told Obby, "is it sad that the Weird Al part was the most enjoyable part of the movie for me?". The horror cliches are literally dripping down the walls of this flick, and it's so reliant on jump-scares that, I dunno, it just wasn't... good. It's hard to rag on horror flicks sometimes, but it's not memorable at all. I woulda boned any of the chicks in it, so yay points there, but other than that I just didn't get into it at all. And the dream sequence beginning just pissed me off.

film.summary: A new take on Wes Craven&#039;s 1977 film of the same name, The Hills Have Eyes is the story of a family road trip that goes terrifyingly awry when the travelers become stranded in a government atomic zone. Miles from nowhere, the Carters soon realize the seemingly uninhabited wasteland is actually the breeding ground of a blood-thirst mutant family -- and they are the prey. (Fox Searchlight)
film.quote: At least the marketing for this film was solid. There wasn't much payoff, unfortunately, but as least it was made by Fox Searchlight and not a *real* production company.

film.summary: The U.S. military makes a scarred bounty hunter with warrants on his own head an offer he cannot refuse: in exchange for his freedom, he must stop a terrorist who is ready to unleash Hell on Earth.
film.quote: I have to bump it up into low-end average for the following reasons: steampunk weapons; Megan Fox in a corset; John Malkovich; comic book movie. The plot? Come on, man. This ain't that kinda movie. I'm of the majority that don't think that Megan Fox deserves to be on the same screen as John Malkovich, BUT, I will give a hearty "fuck you" to all those people who avoided this movie JUST because she was in it. Stop being teabags. You're not clever, you're not hip for hating on Megan Fox - you suck.

film.summary: A group of martial arts warriors have only six days to save the Earth from an extra-dimensional invasion (imdb)
film.quote: Exciting, if you're in grade 8 or a big fan of the series.

film.summary: The year is 1899, and Christian, a young English writer, has come to Paris to follow the Bohemian revolution taking hold of the city's drug and prostitute infested underworld. And nowhere is the thrill of the underworld more alive than at the Moulin Rouge, a night club where the rich and poor men alike come to be entertained by the dancers, but things take a wicked turn for Christian as he starts a deadly love affair with the star courtesan of the club, Satine... (imdb)
film.quote: Another flick that is arguably more famous on the internet for the Nostalgia Critic review of it than of its own merits. A guilty pleasure for some, a charisma vacuum for me. I understand the appeal of films like this, but honestly, it just seemed like an excuse to create a slutty music video.

film.summary: A re-imagining of the horror icon Freddy Krueger, a serial-killer who wields a glove with four blades embedded in the fingers and kills people in their dreams, resulting in their real death in reality.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: A hotel room in the center of Rome serves as the setting for two young and recently acquainted women to have a physical adventure that touches their very souls. (imdb)
film.quote: Alright, look. It wasn't horrible... but some of it was. "I haven't been completely honest with you..." Oh, what a fuckin' shocker that is. Not like you've been lying to each other for the whole movie -- oh wait, yes you have. Well, at least you were when you weren't fingering each other. I'm sorry, but after the first thirty times they tell each other that they lied about something, it's not a twist anymore - it's just annoying.

film.summary: A couple begin to experience some unusual activity after bringing their newborn son home from the hospital. With the help of home-surveillance cameras and a team of experts, they learn they're being stalked by a nefarious demon.
film.quote: Know that this movie will be DIRECTLY compared to this year's other horror trope spoof, "A Haunted House", which I enjoyed. Intro was okay, liked the Benny Hill bit. Snoop Dogg is fucking AWESOME and deserved 100% of the screen time. Child hostility was also good for cheap pops. And props for Terry Crews and the scenes with the apes. But the sum of the parts isn't as good as it could/should be, and the whole thing didn't feel as fresh as "A Haunted House". It's okay, just not special.

film.summary: Strange lights descend on the city of Los Angeles, drawing people outside like moths to a flame where an extraterrestrial force threatens to swallow the entire human population off the face of the Earth. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Okay, so... yeah. Looked pretty, was forgivably wonky for about the first 40-ish minutes. I thought the first 15 minutes were kinda throw-away but that's minor. Once we were introduced to "angry Mexican landlord", however, the wonk was too much to handle. This dude has a serious "pushing-people-up-against-the-wall" problem. I found there to be too many plot points brought up that were then totally abandoned sans resolution. Also, FUCK..THAT..ENDING! Honestly. What the FUCK were they thinking????

film.summary: Slender Man tells the story of a tall, thin, horrifying figure with unnaturally long arms and a featureless face, who is reputed to be responsible for the haunting and disappearance of countless children and teens.
film.quote: Look, I'm a big baby. Anything resembling a scare gets me. I've stopped giving horror movies credit for scaring me unless it's done in a unique way. Fleeting moments of interesting plot points or visual elements won't carry a memelord premise that's under-performed. This is not unwatchable, like they're clearly trying (to be the Blair Witch Project), and there's some meat on this bone. I guess when the alternative is "no effort", that's praise, but late goofiness only drags this down further.

film.summary: When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously. (imdb)
film.quote: Toy soldiers and nuclear technology? Weird...

film.summary: A family staying in a secluded mobile home park for the night are visited by three masked psychopaths, to test their every limit.
film.quote: The first movie was forgettable outside of a few scenes and the ending. A decade later, I'll say that the sequel is far more memorable, largely for bad reasons. Laughably trope-drenched, a waste of its atmosphere, and more entertaining to mock than to consume. (Positive) highlights include the pool scene, the 80's vibe, and the soundtrack. (Negative) highlights include killers becoming T-1000's, no care being given to continuity, and a popcorn-fart of an ending. Watch for laughs, not for scares.

film.summary: Shep Ramsey is an interstellar hero, righting wrongs, etc. His ship is damaged after a fight (imdb)
film.quote: While this movie is arguably more famous from the awesome review given to it by The Nostalgic Critic, than anything that it itself did, I do have to give it credit for some amazing laughs. It's obviously my kind of humor, and it doesn't surprise me that I only see 20 green-spectrum reviews out of my top 250. It's a bad movie, there's no getting around it, but it's too damn funny to hate on it. It gets a lowest-end Average from me due to its consistent ability to make me laugh. Cudos, Cappello.

film.summary: With their collective eye on a $20 million payoff, a motley crew of bank robbers (including Paul Walker, Michael Ealy, Chris Brown and T.I.) get busy planning out their next heist. But a detective (Matt Dillon) who's obsessed with his work is just as obsessed with making sure the thieves never pull off their scheme.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: When the Russian mob kidnaps the daughter of a reformed criminal, he rounds up his old crew and seeks his own brand of justice. (imdb)
film.quote: I guess I'm just a big Nic Cage mark, even when he hams it up like mad. And whenever a movie drops the "Fortune favors the bold" proverb I have to at LEAST pass it on that, even if the movie is too thin to pass it otherwise. There's some killer lines dropped into this not-so-great screenplay. Oh shit, Danny Glover up in this bitch! The acting is pretty stilted, but I can't exactly call it un-entertaining. Even though it's... okay, REALLY not great, I don't have the heart to call this flick bad.

film.summary: A teenage girl risks everything when she falls in love with a vampire.
film.quote: Y'know what, fuck it, the cultural significance for better or for worse compels you to see this movie and those that follow it. Do I like it? I can't really say that I do. There are some truly awful, fall-flat-on-your-face moments - and then there are some moments that make you think "Hey, y'know what, fuck the haters." I think it's important to remember that, as silly as their "love story" is, Romeo & Juliet is, too. There's some cool lines, some okay scenes, not enough to totally condemn. Ugh.

film.summary: When Edward leaves Bella, her whole world is turned upside down. With Bella's heart broken, she turns to Jacob, her best friend to fill the void that was left by Edward. As Bella spends more time with Jake, she learns that there's more than vampires in the town of Forks. (imdb)
film.quote: Ima barely give it a pass on my ranking scale, for this reason. It's a convoluted, utterly ridiculous, choppy, full-of-holes, bullshit concept, with cliche-dripping, equally-ridiculous, co-dependent emo kids, but at least it has the potential to entertain on the lowest common denominator. There were points, sadly, where I got somewhat sucked into what was going on. Enough at least to make me shell out to see the next one. And let's not kid ourselves, that's all that this "saga" is shooting for.

film.summary: A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable -- and unimaginable -- way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit. (imdb)
film.quote: Full disclosure, Vince Vaughn is pretty much poison to me. Tom Wilkinson was funny, but, even he can kind of wear thin. That's the whole story of this movie I think: it wears thin. To be fair, there are funny moments here that DO include Vaughn, but they're few and far between. Dave Franco didn't work for me from frame one. I guess at the end of the day, I didn't laugh nearly enough. There's drama, but, it's nothing captivating. So it didn't work as comedy OR dramedy for me. But hey... titties.

film.summary: Nick, a somewhat chauvanistic advertising exec hot shot, has his life turned haywire when a fluke accident enables him to hear what women think. At first all he wants to do is rid himself of this curse, until a wacky psycologist shows him that this could be used to his advantage! His first target is Darcy McGuire, the very woman that got the promotion he wanted. But just as his plan is beginning to work, love gets in the way...
film.quote: Meh. "Chauvenism is bad" chick flick with an established heartthrob. About as generic as can be.

film.summary: U.S. Marshal Carrie Stetko tracks a killer in Antarctica, as the sun is about to set for six months.
film.quote: I upped it 5 points due to some pretty hot Beckinsale bum. But I hold that this flick underwhelms due to sub-par dialogue, an ending that fell flat on its face with a pretentious attempt at an epic death scene, as well as the tacked-on back-story for Beckinsale's character, which served no purpose but to extend the flick and then be tossed aside as a lame explanation for why Beckinsale doesn't trust the UN guy at the beginning. Cudos for the killer's death though, it was pretty badass.

film.summary: When Prince Fabious's bride is kidnapped, he goes on a quest to rescue her... accompanied by his lazy useless brother Thadeous.
film.quote: I remember laughing, for sure. And I remember liking both Franco and Portman (surprise surprise there, right?). I was also pleasantly surprised to see Zooey Deschanel, who I love. But I'm not 100% sure that Danny McBride is suited to writing. Yes, there's Eastbound & Down, but after that, y'know, his writing credentials are fairly uninspiring. Maybe he should stick to TV? Anyways, it's funny in parts and has the basic Fantasy idea right, is well-directed and shot, and, ultimately, passable.

film.summary: American soldiers discover a terrorist plot on a Paris-bound train. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't often say something like this, and I say it with all due sensitivity to the film's subject and real-life heroes: this shouldn't have been THIS movie. There's a hell of a story to tell here. But it's undercut by really bad performances, and time-hopping that is, at best, detrimentally noticeable. I can, in the same instant, both appreciate this film's creative aim, and criticize its execution; the payoff didn't justify what you have to go through to get there. This story deserves better.

film.summary: As the sun burns out, an American family gathers at the end of the world, their hopes for rescue slowly crumbling as they also confront long lasting divides amongst each other. (imdb)
film.quote: For the most part, this is pretty bad: the sun burns out in the first 20 minutes, every "family meal" is a tire fire, and none of the tension or anger or sadness is earned through quality of performance or storytelling. It's all random emotional outbursts without much depth worth mentioning. That's a shame, because the halfway point in the movie does kind of perk up a little, but never above treading water. One of the rare occasions where a longer runtime (pre sun burnout) would have helped.

film.summary: Arsenal tells the intertwining stories of the Lindel brothers, Mikey and JP, who had only each other to rely on growing up. As adults, JP found success as the owner of a construction company, while Mikey became a small-time mobster, mired in a life of petty crime. When Mikey is kidnapped and held for a ransom by ruthless crime boss Eddie King, JP turns to the brothers' old pal Sal, a detective, for help. (imdb)
film.quote: Now I miss arcades. I'm talking the big ones that turn kids into tiny gambling addicts. Thanks, movie. Speaking of the movie, I kinda wish I could just keep talking about arcades. There is tone flopping all over the place here - though I think for the most part it's filmed in a consistent way and is at least trying to get its atmosphere over. The characters might be good enough for most audiences but the narrative is mostly a failure. Nic Cage is Nic Cage, and this flick is what it is: not good.

film.summary: "Bad Santa" is the story of two conmen who go on a road trip to malls dressed as Santa and his elf. Rather than spreading good cheer, the duo's motive is to rob each establishment, a strategy that becomes complicated when they encounter an 8-year-old who teaches them the true meaning of Christmas. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Billy Bob Thornton (anybody who nailed Angie is okay in my book), but this just wasn't all that funny to me. Oh look, there's a little person AND he's black, that appeases two minorities. I dunno, didn't hit it.

film.summary: The &quot;black sheep&quot; son of a wealthy family meets a young psychiatric patient who's been raised in isolation her entire life. He takes the naive young woman home for his brother's wedding.
film.quote: The early movie tries REAL hard to underscore "Jay (Boy X) is a bad boy, he gambles, womanizes, drinks and is in trouble with the mob", and you know exactly what his arc is going to be: "Jay meets Daisy (Good Girl Y) who helps him become Good Boy Z". But Jay plays far too much "cockbag" rather than "redeemable black sheep" for that to work. Not to mention the dialogue is really bad, as are the flick's first plot devices. ERW is pretty good despite this. Did a professional write this? Ouch. Skip.

film.summary: A tough cop is dispatched to take down a serial killer who has been targeting police officers.
film.quote: As Mr. Statham awakes from a booze-filled night trying to forget that they ever made THREE "Transporter" movies, here we have "Blitz". As in most cop flicks, he's a badass with a good-guy streak, and random violence and silly impossibilities push the action. Like shooting a cop in broad daylight on a busy street, then disappearing. There at least was one great line: "This lads, is a hurley. Used in the Irish game of Hurling: cross between Hockey and Murder." Epic line. A good kill or two. Skip.

film.summary: A massive ball of furry creatures from another world eat their way through a small mid-western town... (imdb)
film.quote: Full-on Gremlins rip-off, but with bigger gremlins. Works for what it is, but not so much for me as an entertaining flick. Had few-and-far-between moments of comedy, little to no horror above cheap Grudge-like tricks... probably wouldn't watch this again unless I was paid.

film.summary: The disappearance of a magical jade sword spurs a breathtaking quest for the missing treasure. Li is embittered by the loss of his jade sword, and his unrequited pursuit of Yu is further complicated by the mysterious intrusion of an assassin. The identity of the assassin is gradually unveiled as another poignant tale of love begins to ravel with that of Li and Yu against the backdrop of Western China's magnificent landscape. (imdb)
film.quote: I mean... it's a bunch of guys flying around. It's live-action Dragonball Z without the flashy special effects. My love of Oriental aesthetics saves the ranking.

film.summary: Dennis, everyone&#039;s favorite kid from the comics is back. When his parents have to go out of town, he stays with Mr and Mrs Wilson... (imdb)
film.quote: "Je m'excuse, m. Wilson... je m'excuse..."

film.summary: Explores animal exploitation and mistreatment for food, fur and science. (doctor 7)
film.quote: Godwin's Law is penetrated within the first five minutes, as expected. The flick becomes very repetitive, as expected. The imagery is shocking, as expected. Look -- it's not like I'm completely without empathy on the subject. Do I believe in animal experimentation? No. Do I believe in bullfighting, seal hunting, or even circuses? No. Do I believe in the way that, past or present, animals have been abused for food, fur & science? No. But will this make me vegan? No. Push for industrial change.

film.summary: Fantastic Four centers on four young outsiders who teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe, which alters their physical form in shocking ways. Their lives irrevocably upended, the team must learn to harness their daunting new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy. (imdb)
film.quote: So I watched this a second time. And it's among the worst things I've seen all year. I'm open to the idea that this MAY be a victim of our extremely-high expectations for comic book movies, but that's not an excuse for the shitty story and the (mostly) awful B-list acting. There is SO much here that could have been done SO much better and given SO much more room to breathe. But mostly, it should have just not been done. Or hey - just give it to Marvel Studios. Best part was Doom wrecking shop.

film.summary: A horror adaptation of the popular '70s TV show about a magical island resort.
film.quote: The single-biggest crime that this movie commits is, it's a horror-comedy trying to tiptoe between genres, and accomplishes neither: it's not scary enough, and it's certainly not fun (or funny) enough. In fact, this "fun" horror movie is no fun at all. Let me to save you $20 and nearly two hours: living in the past or seeking revenge is a bad idea. Hell, there isn't even satisfaction when the villain gets their comeuppance. This is useless but still exists, which is the worst state of them all.

film.summary: Death still isn't satisfied in the fifth installment of this cult horror franchise, setting out to claim the lives of shaken co-workers who cheated him when they heeded a colleague's premonition about an unstable suspension bridge.
