film.quote: Apparently this is a prequel (as I don't really give a crap about this franchise, I couldn't be arsed to do any research). When I deal with series, sometimes I like to look at their foundations - and that's part of why Final Destination doesn't work for me. The only parts of the production team that's been around for all five movies is one producer and the distributor. Bad news. Anyways, it's apparently an improvement from the last couple, but I mean... it's the same old shit. Skip it for sure.

film.summary: When one school teacher gets the other fired, he is challenged to an after-school fight.
film.quote: Positives: Ice Cube everything, Charlie Day about half the time, and Tracy Morgan in pieces. Unfortunately, Cube and Day can't save this thing. The great cardinal sin that a comedy -- a straight-up, comedy-only comedy -- can commit, is not being funny. This movie isn't funny, for giant stretches at a time. At best, you have sprinklings of laughter throughout 90+ minutes. The Big Sean scene is the only truly funny sequence. That, the mariachi band playing the Rocky theme, and parts of the fight.

film.summary: Get ready for the ultimate showdown! Freddy Krueger, the psychopath from the "Nightmare on Elm Street" series resurrects Jason Voorhees, the equally iconic madman from the "Friday the 13th" film series. With a terrified town in the middle, the two titans of terror enter into a horrifying showdown of epic proportions, alternating between the world of dreams and the harsh reality of the living world. Who will win and who will lose in this battle to end all battles? (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: I'd watch it again, but only to laugh at people who were like "Hey, maybe this is gonna be a franchise, I'd love to see a sequel!"

film.summary: When her sister disappears, Jill is convinced the serial killer who kidnapped her two years ago has returned, and she sets out to once again face her abductor. (imdb)
film.quote: Y'know what... even my massive love for Ms. Seyfried cannot save this turd. I thought it was going to get a pass no matter what. Can't hate a shower scene in the first five minutes. Despite a good line or two, there is some painfully-bad dialogue. Her escape scenes are wonky. My main problem with the flick is it spends 80 minutes building towards a mostly-unsatisfying climax. If you can just enjoy tension-building for what it is, you'll probably dig that aspect. But as a whole, it's not good.

film.summary: Having exorcised the demons of his ex, Malcolm is starting fresh with his new girlfriend and her two children. After moving into their dream home, however, Malcolm is once again plagued by bizarre paranormal events (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah y'know what, I'm not gonna defend this nearly as hard as I defended the first one. I think Marlon Wayans has this "Seth MacFarlane" thing going on where, the harder he tries and the farther he goes to make jokes happen, the flatter they fall. This wasn't completely devoid of comedic merit (I love Gabriel Iglesias after all) and it isn't like it didn't have entertaining moments (though few and far-between), but even for a sequel, this is disappointingly flat compared to the first one for me.

film.summary: A writer who is brutalized during her cabin retreat seeks revenge on her attackers, who left her for dead.
film.quote: The second half of the movie is reduced to cliched, cartoon-ish, semi-interesting horror-flick impossibilities. But that's the second half. The FIRST half, is not about displaying the visual graphic-ness of a gang-rape, but so much more about the psychological torment of pre-rape torture. And it definitely pushes that envelope to a level I've never seen before. But I have to ask... what the fuck happened to the daughter? Is that a cliffhanger, or lazy writing? Can't bring myself to recommend it.

film.summary: Mollie is a single mum who&#039;s on the lookout for a reliable and normal boyfriend. Her son Mikey, (unbeknownst to her) seems to have a better idea of which of the men she dates would make a good father figure (imdb)
film.quote: Relies on pretty cheap "aww" humor, but let's face it, nobody's going to see this movie expecting Dustin Hoffman to break out MacBeth.

film.summary: A newly recruited night security guard at the Museum of Natural History discovers that an ancient curse causes the animals and exhibits on display to come to life and wreak havoc. (imdb)
film.quote: That's enough, Ben Stiller. Go join John Mayer on TMZ.

film.summary: The director of Versus and The Midnight Meat Train returns with this exuberantly gory thriller about a clan of backwoods road bandits whose latest victims are far less helpless than they seem. (tiff.net)
film.quote: Don't expect to be blown away at the start; "girl in underwear running and screaming" is among the trope-iest tropes. And don't expect to be blown away (or at all impressed) by any of the acting -- other than Luke Evans, there isn't a performance to be found that's better than "good". Adelaide Clemens has her moments. It's a group of the worst, most fumble-fucking bandits ever getting punked for a little over an hour by a super-killer. Unintentionally funny, but not in a "so bad it's good" way.

film.summary: A successful professional man with a beautiful wife finds his idyllic life threatened by a temp in his office who reveals herself as a stalker.
film.quote: Strangely, this flick was working for me up until the ending. I thought it was actually smartly executed, if predictable - at times verging on a bad episode of Springer Live - and, I don't care what anyone says, Ali Larter plays "hot-looking-but-crazy bitch" very well. But, the ending totally blew the whole movie to shit. When Ali Larter, in a 6-minute span, goes from normal blonde girl, to Spiderman, to ECW pro wrestler, to dead, that's the point where I wash my hands of it. I want my $10 back.

film.summary: A thief with a unique code of professional ethics is double-crossed by his crew and left for dead. Assuming a new disguise and forming an unlikely alliance with a woman on the inside, he looks to hijack the score of the crew's latest heist. (imdb)
film.quote: Does Parker have magic anti-detection powers? Because it felt like every time you turned around he was stealing a car or breaking into a house *completely* undetected no matter how many people were around. Parker is a low-reward crime thriller with not a lot of punch, despite Statham's always-entertaining spin on his character. And not to sound like a blind hater, but goddamn does J-Lo ever suck in this. She's just not a good actress, and her whole sub-plot and story is not interesting. Pass.

film.summary: Pearl Harbor is a romantic tale set during World War 2. Childhood friends Rafe and Danny become Navy pilots and meet Evelyn, a Navy nurse. Rafe falls for Evelyn, before volunteering, while Evelyn and Danny are transferred to Pearl Harbor.
film.quote: Something got bombed all right. What was it? Oh yeah, Michael Bay's credibility. Wasn't there a war going on or something? CLASSIC TALE? Oh IMDB, you're boycotted.

film.summary: The Undead Apocalypse continues unabated as super-soldier Alice (Milla Jovovich) finds her way to a supposed sanctuary in Los Angeles, which may just be a deadly trap set for her by the ruthless Umbrella Corporation. The fourth film in Paul W.S. Anderson's blood-soaked saga finds Alice teaming up with Claire (Ali Larter) and Chris (Wentworth Miller) and a handful of stragglers to save what's left of humanity.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: As his wedding day approaches, Ben heads to Miami with his soon-to-be brother-in-law James to bring down a drug dealer who's supplying the dealers of Atlanta with product. (imdb)
film.quote: Part of my problem is that this focuses on DRAMATIC character development. In a weirdly half-assed kind of way. If the aim is to make these characters likable, relatable, or enjoyable... this is not the way to go about it. It's all meaningless and bland. Couple that with the generic plotline and the jokes that are mostly dependant on annoying personality traits, you've got a recipe for disaster. Is this a disaster? Not quite. Cube helps that a lot; he's hilarious. You can safely skip this one.

film.summary: The story of a family struggling to survive in a world terrorized by a deadly, primeval species who have bred for decades in the pitch darkness of a vast underground cave system, hunting only with their acute hearing. As the family seeks refuge in a remote haven where they can wait out the invasion, they start to wonder what kind of world will remain when they're ready to emerge.
film.quote: Cloverfield impact aside (I have a soft spot for this type of movie), this is riddled with problems. There have to be enough guns (and gun nuts) in the US to handle this. They couldn't set this movie in Texas; the problem starts at 3am but it's handled by lunch. How does the apocalypse still have Facetime? Seems awfully quick to have established a child rape cult, don't you think Reverend? "Will they evolve?" Yes. That's how evolution works. Is she Katniss Everdeen now? So many questions.

film.summary: Trapped inside her family's lakeside retreat, a young woman descends into madness. (imdb)
film.quote: A very film-school-student style opening (plain white text over black background to long overhead shot of girl on rocks). Some decent early foreshadowing of creepiness to come, but in general the conversations in the first 20 minutes are awkward and tedious. I like the continuous shot gimmick, give it props there, and there are some frames of those shots that are marvelous. Olsen is just too damn wooden for the suspense to come across. Some "classic" horror movie wonk & idiocy there, too. Pass.

film.summary: When five sorority girls inadvertently cause the murder of one of their sisters in a prank gone wrong, they agree to keep the matter to themselves and never speak of it again, so they can get on with their lives. This proves easier said than done, when after graduation a mysterious killer goes after the five of them and anyone who knows their secret. (RottenTomatoes)
film.quote: I woulda put this to a 35 (the lowest-end "Average" rank I give), but the very final scene in the movie knocked it down. Being as impartial as I possibly can, this flick sucked out loud - and speaking of sucked, there wasn't nearly enough of that going on in the movie, if you follow me. A blowjob scene here or there really would have picked up the audience (which, in my case, was myself, Obdurate, and a middle-aged guy in a ball-cap). Shitty premise, shitty execution, one or two decent deaths.

film.summary: Bound and determined to end their contentious relationship once and for all, newly-engaged New Yorker Melanie (Witherspoon) sneaks back home to Alabama to confront her past (including her redneck husband), only to discover that you can take the girl out of the South, but you can never take the South out of the girl. (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: Extremely generic romance against the backdrop of the loveable South. Meh.

film.summary: The thrilling tale of an isolated village confronting the astonishing truth that lies just outside its borders. (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: Looked like a great film, was even a serviceable and moderate recommend. Until the ending. WHAT A TWIST, they're just some fuckin' backwater imbred town on the outskirts of a highway. Sorry, M. Knight -- *GONG*. Maybe if you stop writing movies around your "twists" and focus on just making a strong fuckin' flick, maybe you can save your career.

film.summary: A burglar falls for an heiress as she dies in his arms. When he learns that he has the gift of reincarnation, he sets out to save her. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy fantasy as much as anyone, but holy crap does this ever come off as pretentious and silly. There is no world-building whatsoever, the audience is just dropped into this fantastical New York and expected to roll with it. Good fantasy builds its world FIRST. The dialogue often reads like a slideshow of poorly-written Facebook motivational memes. Crowe has his very good moments (his meetings with "The Judge" are real treats). Farrell has far fewer moments, and is the model of inconsistency.

film.summary: The night before his big medical school exam, a promising student celebrates his 21st birthday with his two best friends. (imdb)
film.quote: O hai Project X. Well, it certainly doesn't bury the lead, as the opening scene is a walk of shame. I hate to give this flick credit but the soundtrack is pretty good. Fuck this movie's dialogue STRAIGHT to Hell... okay well maybe it's a little okay here and there. But the one dude is a twelve year old Danny McBride. Let's face it, this is a low-rent "Hangover" clone without Zach-G's likeability and even when it tries to be serious or emotional, it fails terribly. Nothing in this movie matters.

film.summary: Four waves of increasingly deadly alien attacks have left most of Earth decimated. Cassie is on the run, desperately trying to save her younger brother. (imdb)
film.quote: Through just two movies (this & The Forest), 2016 is shaping up to be one of the worst years on record. I know January is usually bad but damn. I want to say it's too short, but that might sound like I wanted it to go on longer. Things just needed more time. The "twist" is so paper-thin that it all but smacks you in the lips within the first 30 minutes. I dug Cassie & Evan's dynamic to a point, until it became clear that it was just "pair them up because teenagers". I'm told the book is good...

film.summary: A spelling bee loser sets out to exact revenge by finding a loophole and attempting to win as an adult. (imdb)
film.quote: Not any movie can implement a vehicular chair-shot. Has to get a point for that. But I'm struggling heavily to find a reason to like this. I don't ask for believability from comedies but honestly, no-one would ever have sex with this guy, and no-one should like this man-child who talks like an 11-year-old who just discovered Xbox Live but is actually a grudge-carrying genius. Maybe I'm getting old and "that's the joke", but this isn't funny to me. I don't even find the premise that promising.

film.summary: Thinking he can overshadow an unknown actress in the part, an egocentric actor unknowingly gets a witch cast in an upcoming television remake of the classic show "Bewitched". (imdb)
film.quote: Uninspired, doesn't live up to the show.. poorly executed.

film.summary: When Mae is hired to work for the world's largest and most powerful tech and social media company, she sees it as an opportunity of a lifetime. As she rises through the ranks, she is encouraged by the company's founder, Bailey, to engage in a groundbreaking experiment that pushes the boundaries of privacy, ethics and ultimately her personal freedom. Her participation in the experiment, and every decision she makes begin to affect the lives and future of her friends, family and that of humanity. (imdb)
film.quote: It's disappointing to say the least that a movie with Tom Hanks, Emma Watson, Bill Paxton and John Boyega is so stilted and unconvincingly-performed. The Circle plays out as a subdued, shallow cartoon; the company itself, a millennial's wet dream place of employment; the story, a "baby's first corruption" big brother tale that wants desperately for you to believe it's saying so much more than it actually is. Don't worry: the moralistic white girl trope swoops in and saves the day. This is lazy.

film.summary: Imprisoned by an adult world that now fears everyone under 18, a group of teens form a resistance group to fight back and reclaim control of their future. (imdb)
film.quote: Have you seen Hunger Games or Maze Runner? Congratulations, you've also seen this! I foolishly thought, since we have some separation between now and when the YA film craze was at its peak, that maybe this movie would step outside the box and try to be different. Instead, it does nothing different, existing as a horribly derivative, formulaic nothing of a movie, with a screenplay that sounds like it was written on a cereal box. The final 15 minutes are worth watching, but not worth getting to.

film.summary: A nurse, a policeman, a street gang member, his wife, a salesman, and other survivors of a worldwide plague that is producing aggressive, flesh-eating zombies, take refuge in a mega Midwestern shopping mall. (imdb)
film.quote: Did not like this re-make.

film.summary: A young band heads to the woods in order to focus on writing new songs. Hoping to emerge with new music that will score them their big break, they instead find themselves in the middle of a nightmare beyond comprehension.
film.quote: Wastes no time tossing the gore at you. The musical sub-genre of horror is a strange one, with the added dilemma of non-sympathetic, idiotic characters. Had to chuckle at the sign with the title of the movie in the middle of the woods. At least the Nick character is very interesting. Sadly, all atmosphere is blown inside 10 minutes when someone on the film crew's arm is in a shot and the editors just left it in. Inexcusable. Aside from Nick, the music and the ending, it's a poor effort.

film.summary: The story of a privileged girl and a charismatic boy whose instant desire sparks a love affair made only more reckless by parents trying to keep them apart.
film.quote: LOL HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS DIDN'T WANT YOU IN THEIR PICTURE! "Long, Awkward Stares: The Movie", featuring Poor Boy and Rich Girl falling in love. There's talent here -- Wakefield is a good actor, Pettyfer has a name and has been in stuff I liked. This is performance amateur hour; they just throw plot points together with no real sense of pacing, setup, backstory or character development. Okeniyi is the best part of this movie, he's hilarious. There's a good movie to be made here... just not this one.

film.summary: Vin Diesel and Paul Walker return for this fifth installment of the explosive Fast and the Furious series. Brian (Walker) and Mia (Jordana Brewster) break Dom (Diesel) out of prison, and they head to Brazil to put together a racing team to take on a drug dealer who wants to kill them. At the same time, they have to elude the capture of uncompromising federal agent Hobbs (Dwayne Johnson), who's been dispatched to Rio to take them down.
film.quote: Since when did "being more watchable than the last one" become something that we commend in movies like this? This was atrocious. I knew what I was walking into, but Goddammit. This turd is polished so hard, that's how Rock got all his muscles. Tacked-on, useless, contrived emotional subtexts, action that fizzes out before you even start shaking the bottle... and for 130 minutes, at that. The only serviceable thing in the whole movie was Rock's character. At least you got your paychecks, kids.

film.filmname: A Good Day to Die Hard (2013)
film.summary: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working to prevent a nuclear-weapons heist, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces. (imdb)
film.quote: The worst part of the whole thing is that, considering how much I still enjoyed Die Hard 4, this just felt hollow to me. It felt like a big bunch of nothing. Everything felt superficial to me: the performances, the story, the action, the inter-relationships between the characters, none of it worked for me, and it's a sad day when this franchise doesn't make it for me on any level. They could easily have titled this movie "Die Hard 5: Whatever", because everybody came off as in it for a paycheck.

film.summary: As Nell Sweetzer tries to build a new life after the events of the first movie, the evil force that once possessed her returns with an even more horrific plan.
film.quote: This movie ADDED writers (including the new director) and the writing got explicitly WORSE. That to me is unforgivable. It was mildly cool to see the continuation of the Nell character, but forget that, 'cuz costume paraaade! This doesn't have the same quality that the first film had. Even if it wasn't a sequel, I don't think it's a particularly good horror movie on its own. It doesn't build much tension and it isn't overly scary. The lore is only iffy. The last half-hour is almost hilarious.

film.summary: An ensemble comedy intertwining different tales. (imdb)
film.quote: Okay. I get where they're going with virtually every joke, and okay, *sometimes* the setups work. It's not like you won't laugh, because sometimes you will. If you want a complete narrative, go elsewhere; it's sixteen disconnected shorts only connected by one arc that nobody should care about. I like some of the people in it, I just, I don't know what the point of this was. The supermarket & Gotham speed dating shorts were my favorite. And certain moments were funny. Otherwise, just pass it by.

film.summary: After discovering her boyfriend is married, Carly soon meets the wife he's been cheating on. And when yet another affair is discovered, all three women team up to plot mutual revenge on the three-timing SOB. (imdb)
film.quote: Assumed it was garbage. I first had to identify what I thought this movie was TRYING to be. I guess it was trying to be a laugh-heavy rom-com with a take on infidelity, something of a sister-sister tale with the girls bonding over their experience. Verdict? I kept waiting for this comedy to be funny. Mann is funny in parts but REAL annoying in others. Diaz still rocks sexy. Upton can't act... shocking. Fuck Nicki Minaj. The plot is insulting and the ending is formulaic. So... garbage! Nailed it.

film.summary: A scientist becomes obsessed with bringing back his family members who died in a traffic accident. (imdb)
film.quote: Keanu Reeves waving at CGI projections while saying sciency-sounding alphabet soup is pretty funny; I was waiting for him to suit up and become Iron Man. Keanu survives a car crash because he's John Wick, then turns a horrible situation into utter batshit lunacy. I've never seen someone go from idealist protag to super-villain inside 20 minutes. It's adequate direction of a shit script, bad acting, and not even the big evil shadow corporation BS at the end can make me sympathize with this dope.

film.summary: After losing the love of his life to a cruel Philistine prince, a young Hebrew with supernatural strength defends his people, sacrificing everything to avenge his love, his people, and his God. (imdb)
film.quote: So... is there a REASON why Samson has constant troll face? Is that supposed to be endearing? Also is there a reason why this script is so bad? "You're only a slave because you let yourself be one"? That's not how slavery works, even in bad movies! WHY IS EVERYONE AN EXPOSITION FAIRY??? This is *almost* silly enough to be "so bad it's good". Instead, it's just bad, fueled by shit dialogue, tedious action sequences, and making a complete waste of any interesting moments. Skip this, all day long.

film.summary: Michael returns home from military school to find his mother happily in love and living with her new boyfriend. As the two men get to know each other, he becomes more and more suspicious of the man who is always there with a helpful hand.
film.quote: Even if you take away the fact that the trailer for this flick totally spills the beans - basically, if you watch the trailer, you've watched the movie - even if that's taken away and the trailer is viral and gives nothing away, the flick is as transparent as it gets. There's no suspense whatsoever, after the first five minutes you can essentially call it right to the finish. Unreliable characters that you can't get behind, predictable eye candy, and an antagonist that just fails. Poor effort.

film.summary: Fueled by hatred and jealousy, Lex Luthor masterminds an elaborate plot to kill the Man of Steel - and it works. Poisoned by solar radiation, Superman is dying. With weeks to live, he fulfills his life's dreams - especially revealing his true identity to Lois Lane - until Luthor proclaims his ultimate plan to control the world with no alien hero to stop him. Powers fading, Superman engages in a spectacular deadly battle with Luthor that could truly trigger the end of Earth's Greatest Protector. (viewclips.net)
film.quote: The reveal was done really poorly. Like, she just accepts that Clark is Superman with no real emotion at all. And what's up with the Tommy Wiseau-caliber romantic exchanges? That's just some bad story-telling. Not to mention "The last thing I wanted on your special day was a reptile invasion from the Earth's core.", and the corny-as-hell reality dating show sub-plot with the time travelers. Fuck sakes, man. The end battle and closing sequences were good enough, but... an all-around poor effort.

film.filmname: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel (2009)
film.summary: Alvin, Simon and Theodore are back and ready to rock in their second big-screen comedy that reteams them with their beleaguered manager, Dave (Jason Lee), setting them up for a new series of musical misadventures. David Cross reprises his role as music mogul Ian Hawke, with Cameron Richardson returning as Dave's love interest. Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler and Jesse McCartney provide the voices of the three miscreant marmots.
film.quote: Much of the music was cool and well placed. And it's hard to hate on the ol' 'munks. I think I've just moved far beyond these kind of movies, especially since I'm not a father. Speaking of, some parents do need to realize that their kids aren't ready to see a movie in public. Too much squealing and poor behavior in the theatre sadly took away from the movie-going experience. Couldn't help but analyze (maybe over-analyze) the sexed-up Chipettes; makes me wonder how "innocent" this movie truly is.

film.summary: Elliot Richardson, suicidal techno geek, is given seven wishes to turn his life around when he meets up with a very seductive Satan. The catch: his soul. Some of his wishes include a 7 foot basketball star, a rock star, and a hamburger. But, as could be expected, the Devil must put her own little twist on each his fantasies. (imdb)
film.quote: Booooooo. Some films don't have to be remade.

film.summary: Three friends stumble upon the horrific origins of the Bye Bye Man, a mysterious figure they discover is the root cause of the evil behind man's most unspeakable acts.
film.quote: Is the highlight of the movie the fact that the house at the beginning looks like my house without the garage? Why is the little girl wandering around a college party? Anyways. By the numbers, derivative, pedestrian. I guess there's slight intrigue in the sexual tension between the girlfriend and roommate but beyond that, there's little that you haven't seen done better already, and some stuff that's just goofy (worst of all, the performances). Cudos for the one sequence of interrogation.

film.summary: Ben Sherwood's intriguing novel is the basis of this ghost story about Charlie (Zac Efron), who is devoted to his brother, Sam, even after Sam's death. As the caretaker of the cemetery where Sam is buried, Charlie has lots of time to commune with the dead. Sam visits frequently to hang out with Charlie, but when Charlie meets a mysterious young woman (Amanda Crew), he must decide whether to move forward or remain trapped in the past.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Deuce Bigalow is a less than attractive, down on his luck aquarium cleaner. One day he runs into a male gigolo who asks him to look after his precious fish while he is away on business. However, he wrecks the house and needs quick money to repair it. The only way he can make it is to become a gigolo himself, taking on an unusual mix of female clients...
film.quote: *GONG*

film.summary: In Italy, a woman becomes involved in a series of unauthorized exorcisms during her mission to discover what happened to her mother, who allegedly murdered three people during her own exorcism. (imdb)
film.quote: Attempts to hook you with the "what happened to my mother?" storyline, but this flick pales in comparison both to well-done exorcism movies, as well as your average run-of-the-mill handi-cam horror. The only aspect which afforded me any emotional investment was the daughter wondering if she would "go crazy" eventually too. The story didn't feel genuine (and even the most out-there stories can be made to feel genuine). A few serviceable jump-scares. But hey, at least it was better than "Shutter".

film.summary: Dreamcatcher, the film based on Stephen King&#039;s best-selling novel, tells of four young friends who perform a heroic act -- and are changed forever by the uncanny powers they gain in return. Years later the friends, now men, are on a hunting trip in the Maine woods when they are overtaken by a blizzard, a vicious storm in which something much more ominous moves&#8230; (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Thought this had a lot of potential, and it entertained me the first time, BUT, just doesn't hold up at all on subsequent viewings.

film.summary: Buddy (Will Ferrell) was a baby in an orphanage who stowed away in Santa's sack and ended up at the North Pole. Later, as an adult human who happened to be raised by elves, Santa allows him to go to New York City to find his birth father, Walter Hobbs (James Caan). Hobbs, on Santa's naughty list for being a heartless jerk, had no idea that Buddy was even born. Buddy, meanwhile, experiences the delights of New York City (and human culture) as only an elf can. When Walter's relationship with Buddy interferes with his job, he is forced to reevaluate his priorities. (imdb)
film.quote: Film was just annoying. Couldn't wait for it to end.

film.summary: In New York City, a young counterfeiter (Tatum) is introduced to the world of underground street fighting by a seasoned scam artist (Howard), who becomes his manager on the bare-knuckling brawling circuit. (imdb)
film.quote: A 100-minute mumble-fest; there are very few clean, audible lines in the entire flick, and where, with "Rocky", that's lovable, here it's just annoying. Didn't find myself attached to ANY characters, wasn't convinced by their inter-relationships, and most of the fighting had no technique, devolving into glorified bar-fights (save the fight with Cung Le, but he's an actual MMA guy, so that makes sense). In short, too much of this flick felt phoned in, and it failed to entertain me on any level.

film.summary: Pregnant with director Roman Polanski's child and awaiting his return from Europe, 26-year-old Hollywood actress Sharon Tate becomes plagued by visions of her imminent death.
film.quote: We're ten minutes in before any lines are spoken one character to another. There's build-up, and then there's just plain wasting time. Anyway, Hillary Duff is an interesting casting choice for Tate, but it's tough to get past the (admittedly-occasional) dollar-store philosophy and almost goofy (certainly not tense) tactics of the Manson killers. Eventually this falls off the rails into a fleetingly-interesting home invasion that retcons itself at break-neck speed. Is "pointless" too harsh here?

film.summary: Having endured his legendary twelve labors, Hercules, the Greek demigod, has his life as a sword-for-hire tested when the King of Thrace and his daughter seek his aid in defeating a tyrannical warlord. (imdb)
film.quote: Okay. Okay... okay...... okay. SO! HERE'S THE THING ABOUT GRAPHIC NOVEL MOVIES LIKE THIS ONE! I don't care that there were some kinda-sorta-interesting secondary characters. I don't care that the 3D wasn't useless. I don't care that The Rock was actually decent. I'll just come out and say it, this movie is fucking stupid. I know it shouldn't bother me so much. But this movie hurt my feelings it was so bad. Movie adaptations of graphic novel adaptations of historical myths need to be stopped.

film.summary: Anton Tobias (Sawa) wakes up Halloween morning to discover-after watching some TV and perusing the contents of the fridge, oblivious to the pool of blood on the floor-that his parents have been turned into a couple of headless Halloween decorations. After hanging out with his equally irresponsible friends, Mick (Green) and Pnub (Henson), Anton discovers that his right hand has a very bloodthirsty mind of its own, and it&#039;s hell-bent on wreaking deadly havoc with or without him. [Sony]
film.quote: All the fuckin smart marks will say stupid shit like "oh, Jessica Alba, so hot, yay points", but fuck sakes, she was like 17 when this was made. Have fun in jail. Anyways, curious premise for this movie which ultimately ends up as spittle on the cutting-room floor.

film.summary: A tough cop is given his most difficult assignment: masquerade as a a kindergarten teacher in order to find a drug dealer.
film.quote: "Masquerade as an elementary teacher in order to find a drug dealer". Now THAT'S comedy.

film.summary: The cocaine cowboys of the 80's are gone, but Miami's Casablanca allure, the undercover cops and the attitudes of Michael Mann's culturally influential television series have been enhanced by time in the feature film version of Miami Vice. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: You want to know the reality of this movie? Great marketing, backed by a killer Linkin Park/Jay-Z song, but the film flopped harder than Butterbean from the high-board. I mean my God, it was like they still had a half-hour of movie left, but the editors were like "This peice of shit is already 2 1/2 hours long", so they just STOP the movie. Bullshit. Not even worth a free download.

film.summary: Some 15 years after the presumed death of a vicious serial killer, children whose birthdays match his supposed "deathday" start to disappear. But whether the killer -- or his tortured soul -- is responsible remains to be seen. One boy (Max Thieriot) knows for sure, but his own connection to the horrific crimes is far too terrible to imagine.
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Paul Blart is headed to Las Vegas to attend a Security Guard Expo with his teenage daughter, Maya, before she departs for college. While at the convention, he inadvertently discovers a heist -- and it's up to Blart to apprehend the criminals. (imdb)
film.quote: I know we're supposed to sympathize with the character because he's the prototypical "nice guy", but... I don't. What's more, I don't find this funny. Like... at all. It's a shame because I like James. I mean, you lazily telegraph your mother getting murdered by a milk truck, and that's supposed to make me laugh? Really? Sprinkle in a bunch of bad, stereotypical humor, and the whole "I take security super-seriously you guys"... it all just reeks of laziness, despite trying too hard to be funny.

film.summary: 3 high school seniors throw a birthday party to make a name for themselves. As the night progresses, things spiral out of control as word of the party spreads. (imdb)
film.quote: The main thing that makes movies like this enjoyable is not the gross-out or physical comedy, it's having investment-worthy characters getting themselves into those situations. That's why similar movies like Hangover & Superbad work so well, and this one doesn't. Inside 5 minutes the characters mostly display themselves as disposable Superbad ripoffs. The fingerbanging lines, finding the dildo & "ninjas are pussies" were the only laughs. First 20 minutes, very pointless. Not worth the full 90.

film.summary: In Justine's family everyone is a vet and a vegetarian. At 16, she's a gifted teen ready to take on her first year in vet school, where her older sister also studies. There, she gets no time to settle: hazing starts right away. Justine is forced to eat raw meat for the first time in her life. Unexpected consequences emerge as her true self begins to emerge. (Cannes2016)
film.quote: Sure it's uncomfortable watching her scratch the hell out of herself. But it was around the point of the "sister-bonding Brazilian wax" that I pretty much checked out and realized, this is really quite bad. Leaving aside the "eating meat = cannibalism" message -- this thing tries to sell itself as a horror AND a drama. Horror elements I can give you; it's too stupid to be dramatic. "Every cannibal girl needs a gay best friend"; sounds like a bad manga. Solitary nod to Garance for performance.

film.summary: Raze, a horror/action film, focuses on two abducted women & 50 other women who are forced to fight each other using their bare hands.
film.quote: Talking about kickboxing gets girls to make out with you confirmed. Wish I'd known before now. Sorry, just rambling. Movie is interesting premise-wise, but its execution is fairly boring, and nonsensical. This is apparently what passes for "female empowerment", made meaningless by stupidity. Girls are trapped and made to fight because reasons, please have feels. Character development? Nah. Acting? Pfft. Not like there aren't interesting moments. But nothing you can't get elsewhere... and better.

film.summary: While acclimating to campus life, college freshman Sara (Minka Kelly) begins to realize that her new roommate, Rebecca (Leighton Meester), is becoming obsessed with her. When the unhinged Rebecca starts targeting Sara's friends and loved ones, can she save them -- and herself?
film.quote: Positive: I liked how Leighton Meester played the Rebecca character, and there were a few high points (Cam Gigandet's "I thought she was just weird" line, and "The Punch"). But the majority of this flick is uninspired. It's painfully by-the-numbers and doesn't really try anything new of significance. I'm usually easy on this genre, but... ya gotta try harder than this. I also hate on flicks that portray College the way this one does. It's such a cop-out. Also, psychotic behavior =/= superpowers.

film.summary: Catherine and Rebecca are two Catholic School girls going door-to-door selling Religious paraphernalia in order to pay for their books and education. Things go horribly wrong when they knock on the wrong door in the wrong neighborhood. Run! Bitch Run! is a throw back to the classic 1970's Rape and Revenge films like 'Last House On the Left' and 'Ms. 45. (imdb)
film.quote: Yup, it's a throwback to the ol' rape-n-revenge flicks from the 70's, but once the dude raped her in the woods and fucking HOWLED, I was pretty much done.

film.summary: The inhabitants of a space station orbiting the planet Solaris send a message back to Earth, reporting mysterious difficulties and requesting that psychologist Chris Kelvin visit them at the station.
film.quote: Movie pales in comparisons, big-time, to the book. And the book wasn't that great, in my mind. It was GOOD, and Stanislaw Lem is a great writer of the genre, just didn't click for me. And the film didn't do the book any favors.

film.summary: While trying to save their childhood orphanage, Moe, Larry, and Curly inadvertently stumble into a murder plot and wind up starring in a reality TV show. (imdb)
film.quote: Here's the reality of this flick. I didn't SMILE until almost 20 minutes into the thing. Some of the physical comedy and a line or two was pretty okay, but the majority of it is as you would expect - trying way too hard to be funny and lacking any real investment incentive whatsoever. I can only imagine what hardcore or even casual fans of the original Stooges feel about this garbage. But it can't be a positive association. I don't dislike the people in it, I just dislike most everything else.

film.summary: Rose Hathaway is a Dhampir, half human/vampire, guardians of the Moroi, peaceful, mortal vampires living discretely within our world. Her legacy is to protect the Moroi from bloodthirsty, immortal Vampires, the Strigoi. This is her story.
film.quote: No real fucks given. I mean... it's nothing, really. Terrible dialogue, terrible acting, terrible action, plot points and antagonism out of nowhere, and just all-around limp. I don't know that I'm willing to call this "subversive", or "stupidly-self-aware-for-the-sake-of-being-self-aware". Did I mention how much the dialogue sucks and I hate it like poison? Yes? Good. Staring at Zoey for a hundred minutes was fun, at least. This is the very definition of "pass it"; you'll miss literally nothing.

film.summary: This outrageous comedy stars Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson as divorce mediators and lifelong friends who have never met a wedding they couldn&#039;t get themselves into. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: Wilson and Vaughn provide moderate laughs amongst a ridiculously-juvenile premise for two characters that really need to grow up.

film.summary: A retro epic that mixes witty science fiction with hip-hop savoir-faire -- all set against a Western background. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: *barf*

film.summary: The US military takes on a group of aliens bent on colonizing the planet. (lostinlodos)
film.quote: At least they upped the budget from ridiculously slim to very slim, but the flick still manages to look like it was rendered in Windows '95. And don't forget the cheesy nods to better movies than theirs. I'm glad these guys are able to make themselves chuckle at their shit efforts. I guess it's our duty as so-called critics to be willing to give more chances - but these guys just don't get it. They're not quite spoof, they're not quite legit movie; they consistently fail at trying to be both.

film.filmname: Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son (2011)
film.summary: Ace FBI agent Malcolm Turner is forced to don a dress again and go undercover as livin' large granny Big Momma when his stepson, Trent (Brandon T. Jackson), witnesses a murder and must hide out at an all-girls school, disguised as a big-boned coed named Charmaine. Malcolm acts as house mother in Trent's dorm, and while the duo searches for the killer, security guard Kurtis Kool (Faizon Love) falls for Big Momma and Trent lusts after his classmates.
film.quote: Okay, so, fuck Martin Lawrence for one thing. For another thing, fuck Martin Lawrence. The reality of this flick is, it's eighty-five minutes of filler bullcrap in-between the first five minutes of initial plot-making and the last ten minutes of apex action. Anybody that tells you anything different may well be clinically retarded, and you should consider getting them medication. Not even a spot-start by Ken Jeong as the lovable postal worker can score much here. Seriously. Fuck Martin Lawrence.

film.summary: To cash in on all of the "real world" hype of the events in the first film, a man from Burkitsville, Maryland opens a "Blair Witch Hunt" tour, which shows patrons various locations from the original film. A bunch of college students decide to take the tour, and wind up in Rustin Parr's house. There, they decide to camp for the evening, but in the morning, they realize they didn't sleep and they don't remember anything that happened the previous night. From there, they go back to town, and discover that something...or someone has come with them. (imdb)
film.quote: A bitching soundtrack (headlined by Marilyn Manson and System of a Down) combined with hot Goth and Wicca chicks cannot polish this turd. Deviated far too far from the original, keeping the like elements between the two only sparse, and lacking virtually any intensity whatsoever. You could take any three-to-five minute section of the first film and find more intensity than you'll find in this ENTIRE MOVIE. You can't sequel indy blockbuster with Hollywood polish. But at least there's tits in it.

film.summary: Dead Space: Aftermath is an animated feature that bridges the storyline between Dead Space and Dead Space 2, concentrating on the stories of the surviving members of the USG O'Bannon, sent to investigate the events on the USG Ishimura. (wikipedia)
film.quote: Not being a major connoisseur of the Dead Space games, I needed to judge this movie strictly on its content, so I probably set myself up for failure. Inside 10 minutes I was painfully aware of the hokey dialogue, the unnecessary swearing (did Danny McBride write this or something?), and the bad graphical styles, often reminiscent of A Scanner Darkly on 1/10th the budget. I understand its relevance to the series of course, but I can't recommend it based on that or much else you'll find here.

film.summary: MTV icon Tom Green co-writes, directs and stars in Freddy Got Fingered, a film he calls a &#034;touching story of a young man who desperately wants to make his daddy proud.&#034; (Twentieth Century Fox)
film.quote: Tom Green at his average-est

film.summary: Robert is an ordinary man who is faced with extraordinary circumstances. He is locked in a meat freezer by Russian thugs who believe that he owes them 8 million dollars. Robert, who is in every frame of the film soon discovers that he is not alone in the freezer. Sam, a stranger, is also locked in with him, and it becomes a struggle to survive the cold and the forces that are against them (imdb)
film.quote: What the fuck did I just watch? Let's see... a non-sensical plot... missing subtitles... the movie itself can't even keep track of how cold it is (watch people breathe & speak)... idiotic characters who aren't convincing... Robert's idiotic cover (guy in a relationship who talks game about women who aren't his girlfriend). McDermott's shit performance doesn't help. Might have been better if Sam wasn't in the movie at all. This is total below-B-level weaksauce. The "twist" doesn't even save it.

film.summary: Karen Davis (Gellar) is an American Nurse moves to Tokyo and encounter a supernatural spirit who is vengeful and often possesses its victims. A series of horrifying and mysterious deaths start to occur, with the spirit passing its curse onto each victim. Karen must now find away to break this spell, before she becomes its next victim. (imdb)
film.quote: The ONLY real redemptive thing here is SMG's hottness and some mediocre visual scares. Believe this, 15 is me being generous. Take the money and run.

film.summary: It's been twenty years since Laurie Strode escaped her brother's wrath. Now, it's time for one hell of a family reunion. (Trancas International Films)
film.quote: Something is rotten in the state of... I dunno, Michigan?

film.summary: When Shelly, a Playboy bunny, is tossed out of the mansion, she has nowhere to go until she falls in with the sorority girls from Zeta Alpha Zeta. The members of the sorority - who also have got to be the seven most socially clueless women on the planet - are about to lose their house. They need a dose of what only the eternally bubbly Shelley can provide... but they will each learn on their own to stop pretending to be what others want them to be and start being themselves.
film.quote: I can't help but feel like this was Adam Sandler's excuse to see mostly-naked chicks bounce around for a month. I am now officially obsessed with Kat Dennings, and "Heff" is so loveable. Other than that, this was a boring flick with interspersed one-liners about sex and swearing. Nobody is expecting a Coen Bros flick here, but goddamn. "College" is going to draw a lot of this flick's audience by givin 'em more bang for their buck in the genre. It's nice to see Anna Faris every once in awhile.

film.summary: A happy young couple, Sarah and Tom (Brittany Murphy and Ashton Kutcher) marry against the wishes of Sarah's friends and family and go to Europe for their Honeymoon. Unfortunately for them, Sarah's parents send Sarah's ex-boyfriend Peter Prentis (played by Christian Kane) to break up the happy marriage. (imdb)
film.quote: The only decent line in the whole flick was "We're goin to the HoJo's, hunny."

film.summary: Cleveland Heep, a stuttering apartment superintendent, encounters a girl named Story swimming in the complex's pool. He soon learns that she comes from the Blue World, and has a message for mankind. Will he be able to help her complete her mission?
film.quote: *GONG*

film.summary: A couple on a holiday in the Caribbean decide to spend the day on a scuba diving trip. But was it the wrong decision? When a miss-count happens on the boat, Susan (Ryan) and Daniel (Travis) are left behind in the middle of the ocean, with the boat long gone. With all their hopes set on the boat coming back to rescue them, they try to keep themselves safe, especially when sharks start to appear. (imdb)
film.quote: Didn't Jaws already invent this wheel? *GONG*

film.summary: Vin Diesel stars as Navy SEAL Shane Wolfe who, as an elite member of the world&#039;s fiercest and most highly trained force thought he was prepared to take on any duty no matter how perilous or impossible -- until he tried baby-sitting. (Disney)
film.quote: Good for one or two cheap laughs and the predictable "aww" moment at the end. *yawn*

film.summary: A group of friends whose leisurely Mexican holiday takes a turn for the worse when they, along with a fellow tourist embark on a remote archaeological dig in the jungle, where something evil lives among the ruins. (imdb)
film.quote: The bush just wanted to get fresh, what's so wrong about that? *GONG*

film.filmname: The Scorpion King 3: Battle for Redemption (2012)
film.summary: Since his triumphant rise to power in the original blockbuster The Scorpion King, Mathayus' kingdom has fallen and he's lost his queen to plague. Now an assassin for hire, he must defend a kingdom from an evil tyrant and his ghost warriors for the chance to regain the power and glory he once knew. (Amazon.com)
film.quote: 4 minutes in, we already have some bullshit. So Mathayus is tied up, suspended from the ceiling. He manages to get a sword somehow, and INSTEAD OF CUTTING HIMSELF DOWN, he swordfights some enemies first, THEN cuts himself down, ending with an Anakin Skywalker ripoff dual-wielding beheading. What the fuck? What might be self-aware dialogue and action comes off as utter unwatchable shit. Some may call this treasure, me I call it junk. But yay for Ron Perlman and Kimbo Slice! And Batista, I guess.

film.summary: Robbie Hart is singing the hits of the 1980s at weddings and other celebrations. He also can keep the party going in good spirit, he knows what to say and when to say it. Julia is a waitress at the events where Robbie performs. When both of them find someone to marry and prepare for their weddings, it becomes clear that they've chosen wrong partners. (imdb)
film.quote: Some pissed-off loser sings at weddings. Awesome.

film.summary: A World Frozen Over ... A Family Torn Apart. (imdb)
film.quote: From the prolific (due to lack of budget and original ideas) team that brought you the "Mega (insert scary animal name here) VS. (insert other scary animal name here)-osaurus" franchise. Yeah, okay. We get it. It's a mockbuster of 2012 and The Day After Tomorrow. Okay. Congratulations. Can I get my hour and a half back now, please? You guys have done this shit over and over again. Can you try maybe... ideas of your own? Fundamentally fucked from frame 1. I shouldn't expect any more, but... damn.

film.filmname: The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It (2010)
film.summary: Follows Andy, who needs to hook up with a hottie, pronto, because he hasn't had sex in... well, forever - and his luck isn't the only thing that's hard. His equally horny teenage roommates also need it superbad, and with the help of their nerdy pal, McAnalovin' and his fake I.D., they may tap more than just a keg. (imdb)
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Following the first film, Papi and Chloe have had puppies, but can they help save the home of their human owners parents when the bank wants to foreclose ?
film.quote: The movies starts with a weddi---NO IT'S A DOG WEDDING, PSYCHE! Remember, you knew this was gonna be dogshit (no pun... y'know fuck it, pun intended) from the moment you decided to watch it. But on the plus side, it's a good thing they didn't waste any money on, y'know, people that can act. Or decent writing. They can't even do their own jokes well, the attempted little "quick puns" that can be really effective in flicks like this are terrible. Tack on transparent emotion and BAM - stinker.

film.summary: Jamal Walker (Lawrence) toils, unhappily, at Medieval World, a theme park that looks like it has not been renovated, or had customers, since the Dark Ages. After falling into the park&#039;s fetid moat, Jamal crawls out into fourteenth century England. The Middle Ages will never be the same. (Twentieth Century Fox)
film.quote: What a pisspoor comedy. "Let's send a black guy back to the past." "GOLD! Is Martin Lawrence available? No DUI this month? BRILLIANT! 20th Century Fox, you've done it again!" *GONG*

film.summary: Three childhood friends set aside their personal issues and reunite for a girls' weekend on a remote island off the coast of Maine. One wrong move turns their weekend getaway into a deadly fight for survival. (imdb)
film.quote: "I HAVE CANCER! It BETTER make you two all happy with each other. LOL JK I don't have cancer but YAY CAMPING!" Now we meet the guys who will likely try to rape you soon! You could run, but nope, makeout time. Now it's Lord of the Flies. NAKED Lord of the Flies! I want to be mad over the stupid characters with pigeon-holed conflicts that you don't care about. Every so often there's a good line but on the whole, I don't buy these characters, relationships, or dialogues at all. Boring AND terrible.

film.summary: New York radio host Erica Bain has a life that she loves and a fiancÃ© she adores. But all of it is taken from her when a brutal attack leaves Erica badly wounded and her fiancÃ© dead. Unable to move past the tragedy, Erica begins prowling the city streets at night to track down the men she holds responsible. Her dark pursuit of justice catches the public's attention, and the city is riveted by her anonymous exploits... (imdb)
film.quote: So... this woman is brave because her boyfriend gets beaten to death and then she gets a gun and starts killing people? Um... whatever you say! And the ending is just ridiculous and falls so hard on its own face, you feel bad laughing at it - but you probably will. *GONG*

film.summary: A champion high school cheerleading squad discovers its previous captain stole all their best routines from an inner-city school and must scramble to compete at this year's championships. (imdb)
film.quote: Womp-womp. *GONG*

film.summary: A new assignment forces a top spy to team up with his football hooligan brother.
film.quote: Sacha Baron Cohen: for those who prefer their Will Ferrell a little more European. The saving grace here is that you aren't SUPPOSED to care, but where other, better people can make self-aware, silly movies and still have them be enjoyable (partly due to taking the ten minutes required to craft likable, investment-worthy characters), "cinema Cohen" is such a spastic hack that he would rather just keep tossing jizz and butt jokes at you until you crack a smile out of sheer exhaustion and/or pity.

film.summary: Sleek, mysterious, dangerous and sexy, Catwoman has never had any trouble captivating fans...or making enemies. A sometime defender of the underdog, she isn&#039;t above breaking the law to achieve her own ends. Free to walk in both the dark and the light, she is superhero and arch-villain all rolled into one. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: For Halle's body.

film.summary: A trio of elite private investigators (Diaz, Barrymore, Liu) armed with the latest in high-tech tools track down a kidnapped computer ace and keep his top-secret voice-identification software out of lethal hands. (Columbia Pictures)
film.quote: A poor excuse for Lucy Liu Cameron Diaz and Drew Barrymore to try and look tough.

film.summary: When an overworked architect (Sandler) finds a universal remote that lets him control his universe, he feels a rush of power. But before he knows it, the remote is programming him, rather than the other way around. (Sony)
film.quote: "Dear Adam Sandler. You are not a dramatic actor. You are to drama what ILL Mitch is to hip-hop, what Paris Hilton is to Harvard, what the Trailer Park Boys are to Rodeo Drive. Please stop trying. You are losing relevance by the bucketload. Love, Justin." This film was pretty decent, up until the halfway point. Then it tries to go all weighty and dramatic, all "what have I done, I see the folly of my ways", blah blah blah. Destroyed the flick. I'd say try again, but.. don't.

film.summary: Three kids hire a low-budget bodyguard to protect them from the playground bully. (imdb)
film.quote: Goddamn it, Owen Wilson, we KNOW you're better than this.

film.summary: As part of a routine mission, a unit of National Guard soldiers stops at a New Mexico outpost in order to deliver equipment to a group of atomic scientists. When they arrive at the isolated research camp, however, they find it is mysteriously deserted. After spotting a distress signal in a distant mountain range, the team decides to embark on a search and rescue mission into the hills in order to locate the missing scientists. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Some people actually rated this movie upwards of 85? The only redeeming quality was that they fucked up military people this time instead of some random-ass white-bred family. MORE uninspired than the first one, which at least had a decent marketing campaign.

film.summary: Jessica Spencer is convinced she has the perfect life. She's the hottest, most popular girl in high school, head cheerleader, and dating the dreamy quarterback. But she gets a big dose of reality when she wakes up in the body of a 30-year-old man (Schneider)! (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: I re-iterate, fuck you Rob Schneider. Make a decent film, you cunt. Check him out next month, as he stars and co-directs "Ba-Durp-Ba-Durp-De-Durp", rated PG-13.

film.summary: In a world ravaged by the Fire nation's aggression toward the peaceful Air, Water and Earth nations, reluctant youth Aang (Noah Ringer) learns that he's an Avatar -- a rare being who can manipulate all four elements and restore peace to the planet. Now Aang must join with his pal Katara (Nicola Peltz) and other allies to fulfill his destiny. M. Night Shyamalan directs this live-action adaptation of the animated series "Avatar: The Last Airbender."
film.quote: REVIEW TO DO

film.summary: Small babies comment on the disagreements between a husband and wife. (imdb)
film.quote: If ever there was a movie that deserved a sequel, it's this one! *GONG*

film.summary: Kevin Carson is a young man living in the projects who has to survive a three-day weekend after his opportunistic neighbors find out he's holding a winning lottery ticket worth $370 million
film.quote: Fuck.this.movie. Seriously. Fuck this movie, and pretty much everyone in it. What a horrible piece of shit. Seriously. Goddamn. What the fuck?

film.summary: In New York, when the shy and lonely project manager of a design firm Matt Saunders meets Jenny Johnson in the subway, he invites her to date and have dinner with him. Jenny immediately falls in love for him, they have sex and she discloses her true identity to him, telling that she is the powerful superhero G-Girl. After meeting his co-worker and friend Hannah Lewis, the needy Jenny becomes jealous, controlling and manipulative... (imdb)
film.quote: *GONG*

film.summary: A high school senior has to re-live losing his virginity over and over again until he gets it right. (imdb)
film.quote: For the first time in a long time, I am STARTING my rating at 0 and working up, based solely on the first 2 minutes (no pun intended), which is nothing but derivative garbage written by middle-aged men trying to remember what it's like to be a teenager. Reading interviews, the director's inspiration is heartfelt 80's teen movies. Well, Dan, you missed the boat with this mostly-heartless dribble. 5 points for masturbating to get out of trouble, and a few funny lines & scenes. Otherwise, terrible.

film.summary: A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seaborn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker. (imdb)
film.quote: That gong, gong gong gong *GONG*

film.summary: When an American home improvement TV show visits a remote Eastern European village, the young crew thinks the lack of mocha lattÃ©s and free wifi will be the worst of their problems. But after their filming interrupts the superstitious villagers' private religious ritual, the situation takes a turn for the homicidal... and when the blood starts flowing, that's when things get really weird.
film.quote: There's this thing that indie movies do - especially horror - which is to make one/two characters complete cockbags for no reason. Takes 40mins to get going. The main thing about the horror-comedy is: it's supposed to be tense, funny and scary. This is almost never these things; it's more annoying than anything. 2mins of character development gives way to obligatory sex. This is lazy, derivative of better movies, unfocused, and the climactic special effects are atrocious. Put bluntly, this blew.

film.filmname: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets (2017)
film.summary: A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe. (imdb)
film.quote: Way up there among the worst big-budget Sci-Fi I've ever seen. Looks fine, and has some interesting genre elements that it thoroughly underexamines or ignores, but in virtually all other ways, "Valerian" is Sci-Fi's limp penis. Horrible screenplay, absolutely no fun at all, mostly-sluggish action, with leads that couldn't have less chemistry if they actively tried, phoning in a romance that would put Romeo & Juliet's timeline to shame. Zero investment or reason to pay attention. Utter garbage.

film.summary: From the creators of Disaster Movie and Meet the Spartans comes a spoof of pop culture and teenage vampire movies starring Jenn Proske as Becca, a high schooler who must choose between two hunky boys who both have killer smiles. While surrounded by vampires, werewolves (wereChihuahuas, anyone?) and gossipy teens with their own romantic dilemmas, the neurotic Becca also copes with her overprotective father and the school's impending prom.
film.quote: Here's what I liked. 1: Only 1h20m long. 2: Diedrich Bader. 3: Jenn Proske actually plays a really convincing Bella clone. In all truthfulness, this movie blew. It sucked big pointy rocks. It stunk up the place really badly. When you're doing a satire, with source material like Twilight, and your jokes aren't funny, your actors aren't right for your genre, and your pop culture references are stale, you fucked up. Blam this piece of fucking shit. I banish your DVD to the yard sales of tomorrow.

film.summary: A comedy about a day in the life of a barbershop on the south side of Chicago. (MGM)
film.quote: Not nearly enough jiving.

film.summary: An FBI agent disguises himself as an old lady to protect a beautiful federal witness and her son. (imdb)
film.quote: Goddamn you, Martin Lawrence.

film.summary: Jean Claude Van Damme plays a dual role as Alex and Chad, twins separated at the death of their parents... (imdb)
film.quote: What could be better than Jean Claude Van Dam in an action movie? Jean Claude Van Dam in an action movie TWICE! *GONG*

film.summary: Returning from a hunting trip in the forest, the Henderson family&#039;s car hits an animal in the road. At first they fear it was a man... (imdb)
film.quote: Literally, forgot this movie ever existed until it popped up on this list.

film.summary: What begins as a weekend getaway for six friends becomes a terrifying fight for their lives in House of Wax, an exciting re-imagining of the 1953 horror classic. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Yeah, yeah, all you little smart marks rag on the flick just because Paris Hilton was in it. "It was good watching her die", hahahaha, wow you're so clever. Fuck off. I mean, yeah, the movie sucked big pointy rocks, but don't just blast it based on the fact that stupid spoiled whore was in it. Blast it for the fact that there was little to no salvageable acting in it. Blast it for the fact that the premise was good but the flick just tanked it. But don't justify Paris Hilton, people, fuck.

film.summary: All children like to raise a little hell - but it's a whole different story when your family is run by Satan.
film.quote: Blam this peice of crap.

film.summary: In this, the third film, it&#039;s the pets who do the talking. The Ubriacco&#039;s find themselves the owners of two dogs... (imdb)
film.quote: Ladies and gentlemen, WE HAVE A FRANCHISE! *GONG*

film.summary: The film follows the Spice Girls and their entourage (mostly fictional characters) - manager Clifford, his assistant Deborah, filmmaker Piers (who is trying to shoot a documentary on "the real Spice Girls") and others in their everyday life. (imdb)
film.quote: *GONG*

film.summary: Two African-American men trying to pass themselves off as very, very, very white women? Sounds preposterous. But with the help of an FBI friend, who just happens to be a genius with make-up, that&#039;s exactly what the hapless Marcus and Kevin Copeland (Marlon and Shawn Wayans) do when they go undercover as Hamptons&#039; socialites Tiffany and Brittany Wilson. (Sony Pictures)
film.quote: What a trashy fucking movie. I think 18 green-spectrum reviews out of 250 here say enough.

film.summary: The wildly comic story of a suburban couple (Dillon, Hudson) who are just trying to make their new marriage work when her and me unexpectedly becomes You, Me and Dupree (Wilson). (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: *GONG*

film.summary: Small, wimpy Marvin (Schneider) doesn&#039;t have what it takes to fulfill his lifelong dream to be a cop. But his luck changes when he&#039;s critically injured in a car accident, and a deranged scientist secretly uses animal organs to rebuild him. (Revolution Studios)
film.quote: Literally, I would rather watch Gigli while getting oral sex from razorblades than watch this movie. Fuck you, Rob Schneider. You haven't been relevant since SNL.

film.summary: Being a lone young boy in the 'hood" is dangerous and unpleasant. This is what Max experiences when he fools a gang of local toughs who cornered him at school. The gang finds out that the key he gave them is of no value in committing a robbery, and they chase him through the streets of his neighborhood, bent on revenge. He tries to escape by slipping into the open door of an old warehouse, but they follow him there, too... (imdb)
film.quote: Why Shaq why. ONE green-spectrum review out of 250.

film.summary: An American black comedy about love and passion, betrayal and lies. It depicts the depths of friendship and relationships in one's life and raises life's real and most asked question: "Can you ever really trust anyone?...Are you ready to see reflections of your life? A successful banker, Johnny, is madly in love with his fiancÃ©, Lisa, and plans to be married next month. His plans take a horrid turn when he finds the truth about Lisa and the people surrounding him. (IMDB)
film.quote: Please, God, PLEASE see this movie if you haven't. "The Room" is Tommy Wiseau's on-screen masturbation. The most self-indulgent piece of shit ever put on film. And I'm sorry, so few people buy the "oh no, this was intentional, it's a black comedy" excuse that Wiseau has been peddling lo these many years, it's really not even an option. It's just the worst fucking movie ever made, plain and simple. The acting, direction, EVERYTHING in this movie is just horrid. BUT. It's fucking hilarious, man.

film.summary: A newlywed couple Ben and Jane move to Japan for a promising job opportunity - a fashion shoot in Tokyo. During their trip on a dark forest road they experience a tragic car accident, leading to the death of a young local girl. Upon regaining consciousness, they find no trace of her body. A bit distraught the couple arrives in Tokyo to begin their new life... (imdb)
film.quote: Here it is, folks! Quite possibly THE WORST thing ever filmed, and this coming from a man who has seen lots of porn. The moral? Gang-raping your Japanese girlfriend because she is too clingy (and filming it) is bad because she might kill herself and come back and haunt you and your pretty new Caucasian bride. This is not one-percent exaggerated; that IS the plot of this movie. Be smart, kids - don't rape your Japanese girlfriend and film it. And whatever you do, do NOT see 'Shutter', either.

film.summary: Why are Americans so fat? Find out in Super Size Me, a tongue in-cheek - and burger in hand -- look at the legal, financial and physical costs of America's hunger for fast food. (Samuel Goldwyn Films)
film.quote: Everybody's going to gain that kind of weight if they eat 9 Big Macs per day, you fucking twat.

film.summary: A new fable for the hip hop age, where the best street dancers pit their moves and their passion for a chance to turn their talent into their dreams. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: This might be the most aptly-named movie ever, because as Ytadel points out, the only people getting served are the people watching. WE got served, and we all paid for it. Well, except me, somebody else paid for the rental. So they got served more than I did. But we all got served in our own way. My PSI said I would be expected to give this film a 4. TOO BAD.
